name: Bright and airy room
description: We have a quiet and sunny room with a good view in our 3 bedroom flat. In a welcoming atmosphere, our clean and respectful flatshare is located in a leafy neighbourhood with all facilities: shops, library, cafés and bars, a swimming pools, gyms, and fantastic parks. Well connected by metro and bus with the centre: 15 minutes. For walks, we are also a 20 min stroll away from the riverside.
neighborhood_overview: We live in a leafy neighbourhood with plenty of green areas and recreational opportunities such as the library, gyms, swimming pools (covered and summer ones), and the tennis courts. Parking is free outside and it is relatively easy to park near the flat.
host_about:
EN-ES-FR
EN
Hi everybody: I'm Abdel. I'm spanish originaly from Casablanca (Morocco). I've been living for many years in Andlusian area and now in Madrid that I like very much, since 11 years. My job is related with languages and communication. I'm a quiet person. I don't smoke, and I do some sport. I like nature, painting and photography.
Please, do ask me any thing you consider useful for you. 
Kind regards.
 -----
ES
Hola chicos y chicas: soy Abdel. Soy español original de Casablanca, Marruecos. He vivido muchos años en Andalucía y ahora llevo casi 11 años en Madrid, que me encanta. Mi trabajo está relacionado con las lenguas y la comunicación. Soy una persona tranquila y algo reflexiva. No fumo, hago algo de deportes, y me gusta además de la naturaleza, la puntura y la fotografía.
En caso de necesidad, no duden en plantearme cualquier pregunta que consideran oportuna. 
Un cordial saludo.

FR
Bonjour, tout le monde,
Je suis Abdel, espagnol d'origine marocaine (de Casablanca). J'ai vécu pendant plusieurs années en Andalousie, mais maintenant je suis installé à Madrid depuis 11 ans. Je suis une personne cool et un peu pensatif. Je ne fume pas et je pratique un peu de sport. D'autre part, je suis un amoureux de la nature, la peinture et la photographie. S'il vous plait, n'hesitez pas de me poser des questions, si vous en avez besoin ...
Cordialement,

name: Apartamentos Dana Sol
host_about: Apartasol offers a network of several spacious, comfortable apartments in the vibrant heart of Madrid.  The apartments are situated in three different locations, all very central and within walking distance from each other.  The sizes range from 35m 2 studios to 75m 2 two bedroom apartments and they can accommodate from 1 person up to 6 people depending on the type and size of the apartment.  Recently refurbished, the apartments are sure to preserve the traditional Madrileño look. Apartasol is well known for its extremely friendly staff and impeccable cleaning services

name: Tu hogar en centro de Madrid.
description: Very nice, cozy and bright, right in the center of Madrid, equipped with all the comforts of home: elevator, dining room, kitchen, bathroom, TV, fiber optic WIFI, garage square (not included in the price) and a balcony overlooking the paraninfo cardinal Cisneros and music conservatory.  Excellent area, you will love it.
neighborhood_overview: The location of this apartment is ideal for walking around Madrid's most significant tourist and historical landmarks. Beautiful squares such as Plaza de España, Plaza del Callao, Ópera, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol,... Stunning streets are only 1 minute away as Calle de la Gran Vía y calle de la Princesa, full of cinemas, theatres and restaurants. Or Calle Preciados with a multitude of prestigious shops, bars with terraces and lots of entertainment. Visiting major Museums such as El Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofía or the Royal Palace. Another option is to take a bus that takes sightseeing tours around the city. Only 200 m. begins the Plaza de España, which in turn is the entrance to the main green area of Madrid. To its left are the 2 gardens of the Royal Palace: "Sabatini" and "Campo del Moro", and on the right you will find the "Temple of Debod" and the "Parque del Oeste", where you can take the cable car from which you can see Madrid from above crossing the "Casa de Campo".
host_about:
Para mi lo importante son las personas.
Me encanta viajar a lugares y culturas diferentes.  Soy actriz e instructora de yoga.
Y Espero conocerte pronto.

name: Adorable Apartment Malasaña-Gran Via
description: Beautiful apartment with spacious living room with 2 balconies only 200 meters from Gran Via Ave, and only 3 minutes walking to Chueca and Malasaña areas, the most demanding zones of central Madrid
neighborhood_overview:
Just a few meters away from Gran Via Metro Station and about 5 minutes walking from the city´s "0 kilometer " in the Puerta del Sol. Absolute centre of the capital, the most historic but also modern, the most tourist but at the same time the most crowded by locals.


A few minutes walk form this apartment is enough to reach the most visited places in the city. Emblematic points such as the Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real and Gran Vía –Madrid´s Broadway Street, just one block away-.

Worldwide known museums such as Reina Sofía, Prado or Thyssen Bornemisza, and the main park : El Retiro . Everything within walking distance! And of course this is an area where you´ll find the best and most typical restaurants, bars and shops.

The perfect place if you´re willing to get to know Madrid´s essence.
host_about:
Hola, 
Me encanta viajar y conocer gente de otras culturas y costumbres. Por eso disfruto alojando a personas de otros paises y lugares que me permiten ampliar mi visión del mundo.

description:
Cozy Apartment in great location in the center of Madrid at a great price!

You will be able to visit all Madrid on foot!
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of Malasaña, 2 minutes from the Gran Via Avenue and near Chueca, the gay quarter of Madrid, it is also where you will find a vibrant night life, and exciting shopping streets.

This lively cultural hub of Madrid is simply teeming with every kind of restaurant, bar, club and shop you would want or need.

The Apartments Malasaña 1 and 2 (which are together in the same building and floor) are perfect for anyone who wants to know and enjoy Madrid. Located in a renovated historic building next to the Gran Via and Puerta del Sol and near Chueca and Malasaña, are within walking distance of everything, so you can visit Madrid on foot.

This apartment located in the heart of Madrid has all the amenities to make your stay as comfortable and you feel at home.

Madrid has much to offer you, places of great architectural and artistic interest, many palaces that once belonged or still belong to great families and kings, monasteries, and churches. museums like the Museo del Prado.

The best way to stay during your visit to Madrid.
It is located very close to the Central Train Station (3 metro stops) to visit Toledo and Segovia and conecting with Sevilla, Málaga and Barcelona.

description: Room with new orthopedic mattress, ceiling fan and beautiful views in beautiful and cozy 4th floor attic flat situated right on the trendy and "hip" quarter of Malasaña, Madrid's liveliest neighborhood, an unbeatable location, right in the heart of Madrid. It is surrounded by a broad selection of trendy restaurants, coffee shops, Tapas bars, art gallerys, ...where a bohemian community of friendly neighbors live in harmony, happy to share their neighborhood with visitors from all over the world.
neighborhood_overview: Malasaña is a traditional neighborhood in the center of Madrid that is constantly evolving. Here, the oldest businesses coexist in harmony with the most chic, lifelong residents with young newcomers to the neighborhood and tourists who fall in love as soon as they arrive because it is the most fun and interesting neighborhood in Madrid.
host_about:
Organizo conciertos y festivales de música. Tengo dos hijos, pero ya no viven conmigo. Me gusta cocinar y cuidar mis plantas, viajar, callejear, conocer gente linda, otras culturas....

Por mi profesión suelo estar informado de las actividades culturales y de ocio de Madrid. Pregúntame, en confianza, estaré encantado de recomendarte las más interesantes. Buen viaje!

name: Converted theatre, historic centre
description: Set of rooms with own bathroom (not ensuite, but near your bedroom) and your private sitting room in large family flat  in 19th century "palacete"; delicious breakfast (included) served; everything in walking distance, but quiet street. No extra costs (apart from airbnb's!) No kitchen or cooking facilities available.
neighborhood_overview: This is the heart of old Madrid. We have Plaza Mayor, Sol, La Latina, the 3 great art galleries all right on hand, as well as about 500 restaurants within walking distance!
host_about: Although I'm English, I've been living in Spain (Barcelona and Madrid) for half my life, so that must make me "bicultural"! I hosted for a few years, enjoyed it, and am returning to it after  a work-related break. I love the opportunity it gives, as a host, to meet the widest range of people, with all sorts of interests and profiles. Madrid is a great place for a holiday - it can be as relaxed (all-day tapas, siestas) or as lively (bars & clubs everywhere, except for my street fortunately) and as cultural (I'm really close to the 4 major galleries) as you like. And for football aficionados,  well, it's obvious! I would be delighted to give as much or as little guidance as you want to have. Come & stay!

SPACIOUS, 2 BEDROOM HOLIDAY HOME: 2 BATHROOMS,

neighborhood_overview: It can be said without hesitation that this flat enjoys the best location on offer for a holiday in Madrid. Practically a stone's throw away from Madrid's 3 most important art galleries (Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia), it straddles the historic Barrio de las Letras and the Huertas Neighbourhoods with their cultural offer and bustling nightlife, while being a 5 minute walk away from Madrid’s famous Retiro Park and 10 minutes from walk from the Puerta del Sol. The street itself is beautiful, lined with bars, restaurants and taverns but the flat is very quiet at night. All of central Madrid (Sol, Gran Via, Lavapies, Plaza Mayor) is within walking distance from the flat..

name: Private Room in a Sunny and Luxuriously Appointed Apartment
description:
Set a traditional dining table and enjoy a delicious homemade breakfast. Choose a book from a glass cabinet afterwards, and read on an inviting couch or in bed. Catch up on email on a computer by a picture window with views of a quiet neighborhood.

In a quiet area of the city of Madrid (Arturo Soria neighborhood), just 15 minutes from IFEMA and 20 minutes from the airport by metro, I rent a private room with bathroom in a 90 m2 (1000 ft) flat.

It looks onto a private garden and swimming pool which ou can enjoy during your stay in Madrid. WiFi and free national landline calls are included.

If you are planning to stay for a long period of time (more than a week) washing clothes (but not ironing!) and room/bathroom cleaning are included as well.

Metro entrance is just 1 minute walk from the building (line 4-ESPERANZA stop) and 3 minutes walk you can find buses number 120 and 122. You can get to the historic center less than half an hour.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the peaceful Arturo Soria neighborhood. Entrance to the Metro is a 1-minute walk. Reach the historic center of Madrid in less than half an hour.
host_about:
Soy una persona tranquila, amante de la calma y el orden. Me gusta cocinar, la jardinería y disfrutar de la vida junto a mi familia y amigos.

He vivido en Estados Unidos y el Reino Unido por lo que me siento muy a fin con la cultura anglosajona. Me gusta conocer gente de todo el mundo porque es la manera más directa y bonita de aprender. Siempre que puedo me escapo a algún rincón en el extranjero para conocer nuevos lugares y culturas.

Si todos cumplimos unas mínimas normas de convivencia ésta resulta genial. Me encantará ayudarte a orientarte sobre qué lugares y rincones debes visitar en Madrid, sobre todo esos que los que vivimos en la ciudad visitamos y que normalmente los turistas no conocen :-)

host_about:
Airbnb es para mi la plataforma perfecta para viajar en su sentido mas amplio, descubrir como las gentes de otras culturas y paises decoran sus propias casas, tambien  la mejor manera o una de ellas para tener la oportunidad de socializar con las gentes de  esos lugares. Como host, tanto como puedo me gusta estar presente e implicarme en la experiencia de mis guest, si la oportunidad lo requiere y el tiempo me lo permite compartire al maximo la experiencia con mis invitados! 

Airbnb is the perfect platform for me to travel in the broadest sense, discover how people of other cultures and countries decorate their houses, also the best or one of them to have the opportunity to socialize with the people of those places. As host, much as I can I like to be present and to engage in the experience of my guest if required opportunity and time permits I will share the moments with you!

NEIGHBOURHOOD & LOCATION:

Here in the heart of Madrid’s city centre you are surrounded by a taste of grocery stores, tapas bars, like the great famous Mercado de San Miguel and lots of conveniences.

This is the "Los Austrias Neighbourhood" Sol district, bordering with La Latina Neighbourhood with the Cava Baja Street or Las Letras neighbourhood with Huertas Street and Plaza de Santa Ana.

You are under less 1 minute to the Plaza Mayor and 5 minutes walk you arrive at Palacio Real, Opera or to the Km 0 at Puerta del Sol; the centre of Madrid and, in fact, the centre of Spain.

The apartment is also very close to the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia museums, and the Botanic Gardens, Retiro Park, Gran Via, Cibeles Square and the Almudena Cathedral, as well as many theatres, cinemas, restaurants, tapas bars and only 5 minutes to El Rastro, the the very famous market situed in the streets during sundays mornings.

name: Great Studio! Best Reviews!
description:
Unique and full of character.
Perfect for cuples getaway, digital nomads, students or professionals looking for a cozy and bright place in Madrid with personality.
Spacious and bright open-plan loft in the heart of Madrid's Malasaña district, located in the city center.
The loft, formerly my photography studio, is in a building with few neighbors and an artistic atmosphere.
Equipped with air conditioning and WiFi. 40 m² of space with exposed wooden beams and 5-meter ceilings.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the heart of Madrid's central district, known as Malasaña or Madrid's Soho. It is just one block away from the bustling San Ildefonso square, making it one of the trendiest and most exciting areas of this vibrant city. You'll find countless shops, bars, cafes, restaurants, galleries, theaters, and more, right at your doorstep.

The building itself is a protected historical landmark from 1890 and is situated on a charming and character-filled street. Despite being centrally located, the space is bright and sunny, yet still quiet and peaceful."
host_about:
Mi name is Al. I am a professor at the university  in ESD Madrid and a profesional photographer for over 30 years. Through my work I have had the opportunity to travel a lot around the world, and get to know and enjoy different cultures and meet great people all over.
I have  converted my photography and portrait  studio to be used as a self catering loft, with everything you may need. You will be able to sense how this wonderful space is definitely special! 
My own apartment, where I life, is in the same building, so I am always available if there is anything you need or if you have any question. That is very practical because I can always take care of your luggage in case of an early check-in or late check-out.
I am in love with Madrid, and I would be delighted to welcome  & help you to discover Madrid. Its culture, museums, shopping, leisure, and gastronomy.

description:

neighborhood_overview:
PALACIO NEIGHBORHOOD
Palacio is a neighborhood full of Madrid's grand historic buildings. Busy tapas bars line the arcades of the 17th-century Plaza Mayor. Madrid's 18th-century Royal Palace is famous for its sumptuous furnishings and landscaped gardens. Opera and dance performances are staged at the 19th-century Teatro Real. Nearby, the steps of the baroque Almudena Cathedral are a popular gathering place to watch the sunset.

MADRID
Madrid , Spain capital , is one of the cities that is becoming a very attractive tourist destination for both Spanish and international tourists in recent years.
Beyond the monuments that can be visited in Madrid, the charm that is experienced in its main squares and streets, with landmarks such as the Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol or the reborn Gran Via, is one of its main attractions. But above all those who visit Madrid appreciate the very welcoming spirit of the city, always with a great cultural, leisure and gastronomic atm

name: COZY APARTMENT MADRID MALASAÑA
description: Ideal location for getting to know Madrid, located in one of its most lively and emblematic neighborhoods: Malasaña. Just a few minutes walk from other areas of interest such as Plaza Mayor, Sol and Gran Vía.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood in which it is located – Malasaña - is known for its alternative atmosphere that makes it compare to London's Camden Town, New York's East Village or Lisbon's Barrio Alto. Located between Chueca and Argüelles, Malasaña was the center of the so-called Madrid Movida of the 70s and 80s. Its streets are filled with people of all ages and styles, and it has promoted projects and small businesses related to art, fashion, and culture.
host_about: Hola! Somos una pareja a la que nos encanta disfrutar del centro de Madrid: Pasear, su oferta cultural, su gente y su gastronomía. description: Ideal place to visiting and enjoying Madrid walking from his historic center ! Located in a quiet street in the center of Madrid, a place with cultural and touristic interest, in the area there are museums, theatres, shops and bars with terraces.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in San Cosme y San Damián, a street surrounded by historic buildings such as the Palace of Fernán Núñez, the church of San Lorenzo from the 17th century, the Monastery of Santa Isabel, the Royal Superior Conservatory of Music and the museum Reina Sofía, giving the street a great historical attraction.
A few meters away, in Santa Isabel street, is the Doré cinema, headquarters of the National Film Library and the old Antón Martín food market which today has become the new Mecca of the gastronomic world.
San Cosme y San Damián street is in the historical center of Madrid and in the Lavapiés neighborhood, cataloged as the coolest neighborhood by the leisure magazine “Time Out” at the end of 2018. Famous for its sloping streets, its street culture, its lifelong shops, its traditional air, its traditional festivals, its “neighborhood” air and its gastronomic diversity thanks to the confluence of neighbors with very diverse origins in its streets. It is a

My favorite quote "LIVE AND LET LIVE" :)

NRA: ESFCNT00002811500034944100000000000000000000000000001
neighborhood_overview:
EXIT

If you want to enjoy a stay with luxury and glamour, in a good area of Madrid, perfectly connected, this is your apartment. In addition, it is located in one of the many centers of the city of Madrid. Just a few minutes by subway from the historic center, the apartment crown la Castellana, one of the most popular roads and with more solera in the city. The apartment is right where the imperial city is located with the new business axis that now make up Plaza Castilla and the commercial towers. Going through Castellana , which is divided into Paseo de la Castellana, Paseo de Recoletos and Paseo del Prado, we see how tradition coexists with modernity.

From the imposing building of the National Library, to the historic Cibeles, we pass, just ten minutes away from the apartment, through the Santiago Bernabeu, the glorious Real Madrid stadium. Trendy galleries, restaurants for all palates, outdoor terraces, the typical “tapas” bars, the most exclusive loafy venu
host_about:
We are a spanish family of architects and interior designers. We own several apartments in Madrid and Barcelona,  all of them are located in premium areas and are specially adapted for short term rentals for days, weeks or months. 

Our apartments are really special and are full of soul. Suitable for all those who want to enjoy their holidays, feel at home on a business trip, or take advantage of everything the city has to offer due to their exceptional location (something that students thank us a lot for). These are apartments with all the amenities, isolated from noise while being in the very center of the city. Equipped with all the necessities: from WIFI connection, essential for taking advantage of the city and planning the day before leaving home, to a wine-opener to uncork Spanish wine and savor it slowly after a long day. . .

Our way of being brings us closer to the people. We accompany them throughout the whole process, from the moment of booking until the check out. We give them advice according to their preferences and enrich their stay so they can make the most out of the city and, of course, the apartment. We keep them updated  from our weblogs on all the news, events, and dates not to be missed. We have open channels in social networks for consultation and suggestions, and they can benefit from the experience of others who have already enjoyed our services before.

Our apartments are a more human and personal alternative to hotels. The direct and constant attention, as well as a new home in the city makes us your best option.
  
Have a good trip and we hope to see you soon!!!

host_about: Mi vivienda habitual era aquí en mi casa de Madrid donde trabajé de lunes a viernes pues mi vida transcurre mucha parte del tiempo en Bilbao. Lo hago ahora con horarios flexible, también en modo teletrabajo pero participando en acciones de voluntariado vía la Fundación social de la empresa de Comunicaciones en la que he trabajado durante muchos años como Ingeniero. En las jornadas normales, empleo parte de mi tiempo en practicar algún deporte e ir al gimnasio, asistir a cursos, hacer compras o ir al cine. Suelo ausentarme de Madrid con bastante frecuencia, aunque ocasionalmente viene a visitarme mi pareja. Me gusta leer, viajar, la comunicación 2.0, practicar la natación y correr -no más de 10 Km-. visitar museos, asistir a algún concierto o teatro, ir a la Filmoteca, o pasear con parada en un par de bares ;), lo que es fácil en Madrid para mí ya que vivo en el centro y se puede ir caminando a todas partes sin necesidad de coche. Además tengo cuatro estaciones de metro al lado de casa y otras cuatro líneas de autobús  que me dejan en un cuarto de hora en pleno casco antiguo de la ciudad, a lo que añadir biciMAD, sistema público de transporte en bicicleta eléctrica con tres aparcamientos cerca.

name: ❤Quiet & Comfortable apartment downtown
description:
This modernly colourful apartment is an architects jewel. You will have privacy, silence and comfort right in the middle of Madrid. It is close to museums, restaurants and subway, access it through a wine tree covered patio: Open kitchen, living room, bedroom with one double or two twin beds, bathroom. WiFi. Cable TV. NOT apt for INFANTS or PETS.
NOT ACCESSIBLE: There is NO LIFT, but 30 sturdy concrete steps.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located at calle Olivar, one of the most quiet streets in Lavapiés, which is a multi-cultural neighbourhood, full of exotic flavours, lively, safe, friendly, with all kinds of shops and supermarkets. Rent this self catering apartment in this exciting city and explore its artistic, architectural and gastronomic delights in style.

Alternative museums like Tabacalera, Casa Encendida, CaixaForum and Matadero are strung in a 15 minutes walk radius.
Brand new and highly recommendable is Madrid Rio: the 650 ha. large and 10 km long park alongside the Manzanares river, where cyclists and lovebirds meet skateboarders and dog-walkers.
host_about:

The house is located in the area recently named by UNESCO as the "Landscape of Light", with the "Prado Museum" being the star.
The neighborhood of Las Letras or also Huertas, is a very lively neighborhood both during the day and at night; however the house is located in a very quiet area that is not disturbed by street noise. It's a neighborhood that has a lot of vintage shops and many traditional tapas bars. The Botanical Garden and Retiro Park are very close and offer pleasant walks. The country's main museums are 5 minutes from the house and it has excellent transport connections

name: Precioso  apartamento  céntrico
description:
If you choose this apartment to stay in, you can enjoy a comfortable and cozy atmosphere in a quiet residential neighborhood of Madrid just 20 minutes from downtown.
We'll be waiting for you with coffee
and teas available to make you feel at home on your first breakfast.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in a very quiet residential neighborhood with a park and sports area very close by, where you can enjoy paddle courts, tennis, and a swimming pool. There is a small park with a children's area and also a dog park within walking distance.
If you like to have an aperitif, a five-minute walk away is José del Hierro Street, where there are numerous bars serving spectacular tapas. But if you're more of a coffee shop person, we have the Mallorca pastry shop, one of the most prestigious in Madrid, just 50 meters from the house. In the mornings you can smell the freshly baked cakes from the window, and you can sit on its terrace to enjoy a magnificent breakfast.
host_about:
Soy una persona inquieta, con muchas aficiones, y aunque estudié para óptico-optometrista, siempre me ha motivado la decoración y  todo lo relacionado con el diseño de interiores. Hace un par de años, decidí lanzarme a un nuevo proyecto de vida y junto con mi pareja  montamos una pequeña  empresa  donde  hacemos  desde objetos de decoración y lámparas ,a proyectos de decoración a partir de materiales reciclados.
Otra de mis pasiones son los animales, siempre he tenido mascotas, durante años he colaborado con una protectora como casa de acogida asi que el verano pasado montamos una guarderia para peludos. Los alojamos en casa y conviven con nosotros como uno más de la familia. Asi puedo compaginar mis dos aficiones favoritas, la decoración y los perros.
En mi tiempo libre me gusta viajar,  ver cine y salir con los amigos.

name: Malasaña: Amazing&extremely central 2BD flat
description:
Fantastic apartment located in the vibrant Malasaña neighborhood. This renovated space allows the apartment's charm to shine on its own. The building, dating back to 1865, offers a unique blend of historic character and modern style.The apartment is within walking distance to everything you need.

Enjoy excellent connections to 15´Atocha Railway Station , and 40´to the airport . Subway Lines 1, 2, 3, and 4 are all within a 7-minute walk. The living room overlooks a cozy and lively Plaza.
neighborhood_overview:
You gotta love it, Madrid’s Malasaña neighbourhood. It’s trendy and teeming with hipsters, but laid-back at the same time. A creative hub that’s always alive and kicking. From early morning to late at night, colourful Madrileños talk on street corners and walk their dogs between tattoo parlours and barbershops.

There are many reasons to love this neighbourhood. Here, our lovely Madrid local Brian lists five of them.

1.- The colourful and unpolished streets
Just navigating the streets of this neighbourhood is food for the senses. You’ll feel a local and urban vibe that’s both refreshing and inspiring. Lamp posts are covered in colourful stickers, while façades, street corners and shop shutters are clad in street art.

A large number of dogs frequent these streets, their owners enjoying the sunny weekends with cold beers and gourmet burgers at the small squares. Unpolished and authentic, Malasaña has an addictive atmosphere that will make you come bac
host_about:
Somos un matrimonio, de 38 años, arquitectos que trabajamos en MUKAarquitectura. Tenemos el trabajo muy cerca de casa. Nos gusta mucho el cine, viajar, y mantener una buena conversación.

We are a 38-year-old couple. We work as architects for MUKAarquitectura. Our two little two kids are making us to have a lot of fun!. We love movies, wine, travelling and having a good conversation with international guests!.

EN-ES-FR
EN

name: Penthouse with terrace in SOL
description:
It is a charming, one-bedroom apartment with a private, exterior sunny terrace that fits four adults. It is located in a historic, but renovated, elevator building.

Our apartment is located on Calle Barcelona 7, a small pedestrian street only a few meters from the famous Puerta del Sol.

It is a charming, one-bedroom apartment with a private, exterior terrace that fits four adults. It is located in a historic, but renovated, elevator building, whose modern décor is harmonious with the building’s old features (exposed beams, wooden stairs, angled ceilings…).

The main bedroom has a double bed and a spacious built-in closet. The living room has a double sofa bed and enjoys fantastic views of Madrid from its private exterior terrace. Both the bathroom and the kitchen, which are accessed through the living room, are completely equipped.

The Puerta del Sol is a Madrid’s main tourist reference point and a must-see during your stay in Madrid. In fact
neighborhood_overview:
The Puerta del Sol is a Madrid’s main tourist reference point and a must-see during your stay in Madrid. In fact, this is the ideal departure point for any walk around the city, visit to monuments and museums, or shopping in Madrid’s commercial district any day of the year.

The apartment is located in an extremely central area that is easily accessible and has a wide variety of commercial and cultural activity in its immediate vicinity. The neighborhood is one of Madrileños’ favorites for "tapas" and is famous for its bars and restaurants, and night life, all of which you will find only steps away.
host_about:
Hi! We are Alfonso & Guillermo, from micasaisyourhouse.

I (Alfonso) started renting my apartment in Madrid years ago and I discovered a vocation: to try to make people feel like home. I've travelled a lot and I'd love that you feel that nice feeling of being like home in a strange place. 

So with my University friend Guillermo we created micasaisyourhouse and now we manage apartments in Madrid (where Guillermo lives) and Seville (where Alfonso lives). We hope you enjoy your stay with us!

See you soon!

Alfonso & Guillermo

name: Sol.  Your home in Madrid´s Heart
description:
DESIGN apartment in the HEART of Madrid.
In the MAJOR STREET itself.
Unbeatable location in the historic center
One step away from everything you want to see in Madrid
Small. Clean and comfortable for 4 people, although it can fit up to 6 people

WITH ELEVATOR
Housing registered in the tourist office of the Community of Madrid with the number of tourist housing VT-2803
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy a design house recently renovated by an architect / interior designer in the heart of Madrid. In the main street. This house is in an unbeatable location in the historic center. One step away from everything you want to see in Madrid: Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, San Miguel Market, Royal Theater and Royal Palace. The area is known as "Madrid de los Austrias", with its elegant palaces, squares and cobblestone passages. The cultural and leisure offer is concentrated in the Plaza Mayor: international restaurants, terraces and trendy shops. You will not need public transport, you are one step away from the famous La Latina, the Royal Palace, Opera, Sol, and the Gran Vía.
The best gourmet tapas in Mercado de San Miguel, amazing renovated modernist building, just around the corner.
In front of the house is the central tourist information office in Madrid.
5 minutes (300m) from Gran Via neuralgic center of Madrid shopping. Also from the legendary Rastro de Madrid. Flea ma
host_about:

Me gusta  la botanica, el jazz y un buen café.
Me encanta pasear por Madrid cuando la ciudad comienza a despertarse. 
Quiero a mi pareja y lo que más me gusta en el mundo  es estar con mis niñas.

host_about:
I am a university professor, single, friend of friends and good host. I like people and this is a great way to meet people from all over the world. I believe in personal relationships how to change the world.
I like music, singing in a choir made many years ago, reading, cinema. The little things that make life better. Of course gastronomy, travel, are part of the knowledge of the cultures and are the best way to learn.

/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
Soy un profesor universitario, soltero, amigo de sus amigos y buen anfitrión. Me gusta la gente y esta es una magnífica forma de conocer personas de cualquier parte del mundo. Creo en las relaciones personales cómo las que cambian el mundo.
Me gusta la música, de hecho canto en una coral hace muchos años, la lectura, el cine. Las pequeñas cosas que hacen la vida mejor. Por supuesto la gastronomía, los viajes, forman parte del conocimiento de las culturas y son la mejor forma de conocer.

name: Double cozy room in Madrid historic center
description: I rent a cozy and spacious room for two people, bright and quiet. The house has recently been renovated. Located in the historic center of Madrid, in the neighborhood of "Las Letras", near the most important museums of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Known as "Barrio de las Letras", it is one of the most welcoming and pleasant places in the center of Madrid.
It is within the so-called "art triangle" because the 3 most important museums of the city are here: Prado Museum, Reina Sofía Museum and Thyssen Bornemisza Museum.
In addition there are many restaurants, bars, and terraces where you can enjoy a pleasant time outdoors.
It is quiet but at the same time it has a lot of life and is full of charming corners.
host_about:
Pintora y profesora de diseño gráfico Bellas Artes.
Me encanta la música (toda, bueno casi toda) leer, ir al cine y sentarme en una terracita del barrio, (como he dicho antes, es el encantador barrio de las Letras) con mis amigos a charlar.

Una cosa sin la que no podría vivir?
VIAJAR! Lo necesito para "vivir" que diría una amiga : ) 

No tanto un lema, pero una frase que escuché a un amigo y me encantó:
"La vida es corta pero ancha"

description:
Single/double room in cozy apartment with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Building accesible for people with reduced mobility . WIFI.

The tenant will share te appartment with the owner.

10 minutes walk to Metro Station San Fermín-Orcasur, 20 minutes by subway to Puerta del Sol, 5 minutes walk to Caja Mágica and a metro station to Hospital 12 de Octubre.

Surrounded by extensive green areas (Parque del Manzanares), groceries, banks, cafes and bars.
neighborhood_overview:
The area is quiet and very suitable for sports enthusiasts. Running, cycling or walking tours are some of the activities you can practice at Manzanares Park, directly connected with Calle 30 that runs along the banks of the river, passing through El Matadero, Almudena Cathedral, Palacio de Oriente or Casa de Campo in a nice and quiet foot walk.

For tennis enthusiasts, the flat is in front La caja Mágica, which celebrates Mutua Madrileña Masters Tennis, among others sport events.

It is also near Hospital 12 de Octubre.

name: ROYAL PALACE, OPERA, PLAZA MAYOR, LATINA, SOL
description:
This is my beautiful studio apartment; when it's not on Airbnb, I live here. So it's a real home with everything you need for your comfort. It's not a soulless space repurposed for tourist use.

Very quiet despite its fantastic location in the historic center of Madrid. My apartment is in a listed building from 1890, on a pedestrian and tree-lined street in Madrid de los Austrias: area where the royal court lived, during the almost two centuries that the Habsburg dynasty lasted in Spain.
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia Museums. 2 minute walk to the major Tourist Information office in the city, with lots of information and ideas for you to do. You will have a great time in Madrid at my apartment.
host_about:
Hola!  I am a passionate tennis player, swimmer and plant lover.  
I own and operate a plant decoration shop in Madrid, that you can visit anytime, it is called Greenworks Madrid.
If you love plants, mi gardens or mini eco systems let's talk.
In fact I host the "create your own terrarium" experience in there:

name: Stylish apartment in the city center
description:
Cozy apartment located next to Gran Via, the most famous street in Madrid.

Known as the Broadway of Madrid, Gran Via is an area that offers endless experiences, from theaters, flamenco shows, restaurants and stores of the most renown global brands.

Tourist stays are not permitted, in accordance with current regulations from the Madrid City Council. This apartment is perfect for a justified, non-touristic purpose such as educational, professional, medical, creative, or family-related.
neighborhood_overview:
Built between 1910 and 1929, Gran Vía is Madrid’s most famous street and house of numerous restaurants, bars, all types of shops, cinemas and theaters and some of the capital's most iconic buildings.

Gran Via is one of the streets with the most exciting nightlife in Madrid, the street that never sleeps. Some of the most famous buildings in the country can be found here, such as the Metropolis building or the Carrion building with its popular Schweppes sign.

It is also one of the most important shopping streets and house of Primark’s second largest shop in the world, along with other well-known brands like Zara, Loewe, H&M, Sfera, Nike and Adidas.

There is no shortage of events at Gran Via. You can watch the Lion King, Les Miserables or simply go for a live flamenco performance; with many great restaurants in the are you can experience the authentic Spanish gastronomy or enjoy a drink in the bars or rooftops while enjoying beautiful views and its popul

neighborhood_overview: Lavapiés is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Madrid, with more than 500 years old. It was once the Jewish quarter of Madrid. Its main center of activity and meeting place was the Synagogue, located on the site where today is the Church of San Lorenzo. Its name, Lavapies, has its origin in the Jewish tradition of washing before their prayers. The plaque that gives its name to Lavapiés Street illustrates the fountain that once stood in the square and two people washing in it. It is home to dozens of nationalities. In its streets coexist people from distant corners of the planet and you can hear many different languages. Its streets are narrow and old. One of the most characteristic elements of the Lavapiés neighborhood is the Corrala del Sombrerete, one of the few remaining in Madrid. Built in 1872, it was declared a National Monument. Art galleries and small exhibitions abound. In Doctor Fourquet street we find several, there are more scattered around the area. The great reference of

neighborhood_overview: Madrid's history as a continuously inhabited urban center dates back to the 9th century, and is marked by the establishment of the royal court there in 1561. The apartment building is located in one of the oldest neighborhoods in the city. This corner of downtown Madrid was surrounded by a wall that protected the old medieval city of Madrid, and one of the gates to enter the city was placed in the Plaza called Puerta Cerrada, a few meters from the apartment. In 1616, the construction of Plaza Mayor was ordered, which is next to the apartment. A place with a lot of charm, celebrations, gatherings, commerce, religious acts, Royal Ceremonies and Popular Festivals.  50 meters away is the Botin Restaurant, which has the Guinness World Records Certificate as the oldest restaurant in the world. A few meters further, we find the San Miguel market, an old market fused with the modern, today an interesting gastronomy market to enjoy tapas. This corner of the center of Madrid was surrounded by a wall that protected the old medieval city of Madrid, and one of the doors to enter the city was placed in the Plaza called Puerta Cerrada, a few meters from the apartment. In 1616 the construction of the Plaza Mayor is ordered, which is next to the apartment. A place with lots of charm, celebrations, meetings, commerce, religious events, Royal Ceremonies and Popular parties. 50 meters away is the Botin Restaurant, which has the Guinnes Certificate of the Record, as the oldest restaurant in the world. host_about:
Hola! 
Somos un equipo dedicado a alquilar nuestros apartamentos. Tanto Elisa como yo misma nos encargaremos de daros una cálida bienvenida
Estaremos en contacto cuando se vaya acercando la fecha de llegada y os facilitaremos los detalles del alojamiento para que todo vaya como rodado en vuestro Check-in y estancia. 
Para empezar, necesitaríamos una hora de llegada aproximada, un email y un teléfono de contacto, ya que no contamos con una recepción física y por ello uno de nosotros os recibirá en el apartamento a la hora estipulada. 
Cualquier duda estaremos encantados de atenderos. 
¡Hasta pronto!

Hi! 
We are a team who enjoys hosting people in our lovely apartments.
We will be in contact closer to your arrival day with all of the details you'll need for a smooth check in and a wonderful stay. 
In the meantime please let us know your estimated arrival time, your email and a phone number we can reach you on during your stay just in case, as we don't have any reception, one of us will meet you at the apartment at the agreed time. 
If there is anything else on your mind, please let us know and we’d love to assist! 
Kind Regards,

name: Central Gran Via Apt | A/C, WIFI & Weekly Cleaning
description: Stylish apartment on Madrid’s Gran Vía, ideal for long stays for work, study or healthcare purposes. Being interior, it ensures a peaceful, quiet atmosphere to rest after the day. host_about:

name: Amplio, luminoso y bonito, en el centro de Madrid
description: In a quiet pedestrian street within a two minutes walk from Sol, Callao and Opera Exact adress is: (Calle Postigo de San Martín, 5 28013 Madrid). The apartment was remodeled by spanish famous arquitect Manuel Ocaña . Furnished and decorated to the last detail with Vitra, Habitat and vintage scandinavian. Great oak wood floors in all the appartment.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located on Postigo de San Martín Street. Two minutes walk to Callao, five to Sol and five to the Royal Palace. It belongs to Los Austrias, the most ancient part of Madrid and you are in the center of the other four interesting neigbourhods of Madrid: Malasaña, Chueca, Latina and Huertas. All of them within walking distance.
You have tosn of nice restuarants and shops arround. I´ll send you a list of my favourite places and plans as soon as you book but you can always ask me if you have a particular interest.
host_about:
I´m Fernando, I´ve lived in Madrid most of my life, and I love my city.
I first airbnb during a long trip through the United States. As a guest I found it a great way to visit places. Much better than hotels. So when I came back I decided to rent my place. Its a house i designed for me and my wife . We bought it because it had tons of light, clear views and mainly the best location. Its in a quiet pedestrian street with many orange trees, but you are in the middle of everything and you can walk to all the places that we loved in Madrid. I hope you enjoy it as we did when we lived there.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is modern, calm and safe and has supermarkets and a traditional market. There is a sports centre including a gym and a swimming pool that you can use for single days at good price.
It is near the "Matadero cultural centre"
and the picturesque riverside walk "Madrid Río". There's a locomotive museum which hosts a variety of alternative markets "Mercado de motores" the second weekend of every month. The apartment is at walking distance to the main station, Atocha Station, making travel to the airport, all over the province and the country easy and efficient. It is just 5 minutes walk from the multicultural and charming area of Lavapiés, and 10 minutes walk the lively entertainment hub La Latina, host of the famous "Rastro" Flee Market on Sundays.

name: Your little shelter
neighborhood_overview:
Lavapiés, along with the La Latina (Austrias) neighborhood, is Madrid's oldest neighborhood.
Madrid grew from the Royal Palace and these were its first populated neighborhoods.
It was a neighborhood of coexistence of Jews, Muslims and Christians and its narrow streets and old churches attest to this.
Today it is a young, intercultural neighborhood full of typical tapas bars and restaurants with a varied gastronomic offer. You have the only 24-hour supermarket in the area in Plaza de Lavapiés.
You have plenty of bars to have beers and coffee, as well as pubs where you can have a nightcap and listen to good music. Check out the guide we've prepared for you.
It's a safe neighborhood where the police frequently patrol its streets for any problems you may have.
The neighborhood also has numerous theaters, including the Valle Inclán Theater, home of the National Dramatic Center, which has a stable and varied program throughout the year.
The Reina Sofía Mus
host_about:
Actor y profesor de interpretación. Maestro de Educación Primaria y Secundaria. Amante de todos los deportes. Monitor deportivo de Karate y fútbol. Me gusta el cine y la lectura. Salir a la naturaleza tanto en invierno como en verano. El mar y la montaña son ambos necesarios para mi vida.
He viajado por las capitales del mundo más importantes, pero aún me quedan muchas por recorrer. El tibet es mi destino soñado. Charlar con los lugareños es la mejor forma que conozco para comprender la cultura de cada pais.
Querer es poder.

name: Right in Madrid's City Center with Video Projector
description:
This marvelous apartment features three balconies that open onto the street, providing plenty of natural light and excellent decorative features
It comes fully equipped with all the amenities you need
Located in one of the liveliest neighborhoods of Madrid, it's just a short walk away from Gran Vía, the city's main and most famous commercial street
Situated in the heart of the bohemian neighborhood of Malasaña, which can be compared to Williamsburg in New York, it's right in the center of Madrid
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is located in the heart of the bohemian neighborhood of Malasaña, often compared to Williamsburg in New York, right in the center of Madrid.

Malasaña is known for hosting some of the best bars and restaurants in the city. Additionally, in the vicinity of the apartment, guests can explore cutting-edge clothing stores and vintage boutiques.

Within walking distance, you'll find attractions like the historic Plaza del Mayo, the Old Conde Duque Barracks, and the Museum of History. If you wish to explore further, you can walk to Plaza de España, Puerta del Sol, Retiro Park, or Plaza Mayor. Furthermore, the apartment has excellent connectivity to the public transportation system, with the nearest metro stations being Noviciado, Callao, and Tribunal, making it easy to get around.
host_about:
I am from Madrid, in love with my city. I like its imperfect beauty, the streets, the terraces, the sun and its people. I share this passion with decoration and architecture.
 
Tireless traveler, I have lived several years in different countries. I really enjoy meeting new people and different cultures, I also like to travel to miss my city, load up on ideas and inspiration, and then translate it into the environments that I decorate.

name: Chic & Sunny Apt. Historic District-Sol
description: The apartment is disinfected according to the existing recommendations of the health authority. Bed linen and towels are washed according to the hygiene protocol (disinfectant + 70º celsius laundry + iron). All surfaces known as virus carriers, such as door handles, switches, kitchen utensils and all furniture, are disinfected with specific antivirus products. I provide a virus prevention set for every guest (disinfection wipes, antibacterial hygiene hand gel 30 ml, protective mask and gloves).
neighborhood_overview:
The historic district (Sol / Huertas / La Latina) is ideal for exploring the Spanish capital:

• Most of the sights are within walking distance,
• Thriving cultural life, art galleries and the city's main museums (Prado,
Reina Sofia, Thyssen) are only a stone's throw away.
• The area is also known for its exciting nightlife, its typical restaurants,
Tapas bars and terraces known.

•Puerta del Sol > 200 m
•Plaza Mayor > 100 m
•Plaza Santa Ana > 150 m
•Mercado de San Miguel > 150 m
•Gran Vía > 400 m
•Prado Museum> 800 m
•Reina Sofía Museum > 700 m
•Thyssen Bornemisza Museum > 800 m
•Cibeles > 1,1 km
•Retiro Park > 1,2 km
•Almudena cathedral > 300 m
•Kings Palace > 350 m

The exclusive Chueca district is also nearby, where there are many bars, and offers very chic boutiques, great restaurants and cozy street cafes in its squares.

Fuencarral is a street filled with shops.
host_about: Greetings from Madrid! I've been a resident of this beautiful city for 21 years now and I still love the city. I am a young professional who likes to travel. name: Cozy upscale apt museum mile AC
description: The perfect place to have a great stay, a beautiful apartment in the best area of Madrid
host_about:
Hi!!

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer (during 2017 I became mum, so I won't be doing check in's for a while). However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 25 years now and enrolled in a new adventure in spring 2017: becoming a mum. Life had still not so pleasant surprises and in september 2021 she was diagnosed a breast cancer and is still in treatment. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board, a lot since 2012 we must say, and each of them have left their impromt in our company. Now the team is composed by Mica, an Argentinian girl now based in Madrid for a few years, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Mica is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Julia, who joined us in in February 2023. Julia is Mica's friend, also Argentine and has a super cool and fun vibe.

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens, spending time with friends, our dogs and Vanessa's daughter (the only mother of the team!). We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 

We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Osca, Vanessa, Mica and Julia
Nuba Gestión de Apartamentos, S.L.

name: Elegant apartment  in the best area
description:
Perfect property if you need to come to Madrid for work purposes or profesional purposes. This apartment is not rented for tourism. If in doubt please contact us PRIOR to booking. Thank you.

Located between calle Velázquez and calle Lagasca, this luxury 2 bedroom apartment is idealy situated if you are comming to Madrid for work reasons.
neighborhood_overview: This property is located in the heart of the Barrio de Salamanca, the most exclusive shopping street in Madridrio de Salamanca. This is one of the most elegant and sought-after districts of the capital, known for its aristocratic streets, upmarket hotels, excellent transport links and many high-end shops, chic cafés and restaurants. The beautiful Retiro park just a 10 minute stroll away makes this also an ideal location to go with children. All in all, unbeatable cultural options just a short distance away from the city’s historic centre and financial heart.
host_about:
Our small agency was created by two people: Karin Wallis, half English and half Swedish has lived most of her life in Madrid and Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano down to the marrow, has lived in Seville all of his life. We created the agency as we wish to do something different: take peoples charming homes and transform them into rentals, keeping the magic and charm the owners created when they built their home but at the same time making it comfortable and adequate for our clients such as  giving them plenty of empty cupboard space,  ensuring the only food in the fridge is the one of our welcome hamper and making sure everything is working correctly and is sparkling clean so that when you arrive, the property will feel like instant home to you too. There are no two properties alike, nor are there two guest exactly alike but we do trust we will have the right home for you.

Nuestra pequeña agncia fué creada por Karin Wallis, mitad inglesa y mitad sueca ha vivido casi toda su vida en Madrid y Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano hasta la médula, ha vivido en Sevilla toda su vida. Creamos esta empresa dado que queríamos hacer algo diferente: transformar la acogedora casa de un propietario a una propiedad para alquilar manteniendo la magia y el encanto que los propietarios metieron en ella pero a su vez adecuándola para que sea cómodo para nuestros clientes. No hay dos propiedades  iguales, ni hay dos clientes exactamente iguales pero confiamos en tener una casa de su agrado.

name: Downtown Bright Apartment Gran Vía | A002
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía. Within walking distance of cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the city's tourist attractions.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home.

We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

neighborhood_overview:
Lavapiés is a multi-cultural neighbourhood, vegan friendly and gay friendly, full of exotic flavours, lively, secure and lots of shops and supermarkets. Rent this self catering apartment in this exciting city and explore its artistic, architectural and gastronomic delights in style.

Alternative museums like Casa Encendida, CaixaForum and Matadero are strung in a 15-minute walk radius.
Brand new and highly recommendable is Madrid Rio: the 650 ha. large and 10 km long park alongside the Manzanares river where cyclists and lovebirds meet skateboarders and dog-walkers.

When outside my city, I prefer to stay at airbnb hosts, a stunningly efficient and fun way to connect and personalize one's trip.
The inside is the new outside. Detail-oriented within the big picture. Highly motivated, enthusiastic and trilingual.

The important museums are a short distance (5, min (Caja Madrid), 10 min (Thyssen Bornesmiza) and 15 min (El Prado, Reina Sofía and Caixa Forum).
The retreat and the real Botanical Garden, are within 15 minutes walking distance.

. I am currently running a tourism company,so I hope that my recommendations will save you time and offer you a new way to discover a Unique Madrid. 

I enjoy art, sports and cooking... I like homes to be clean and comfortable.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in the district of "Los Austrias", halfway between Royal Palace and Puerta del Sol. Ideal for walking to any of the downtown neighbourhoods of Madrid and comfortably enjoy all its attractions.
This is a pretty district and being pedestrian street, there is no through traffic. It is conveniently located and very famous for its many bars, shops and restaurants. The large open space of Royal Gardens is a short walk away, as are the lively and exciting amenities on Preciados Street and Gran Via Street.

The flat is located at the heart of Madrid’s cultural, historic, artistic and retail center. Four of the city’s most prestigious art institutions - the Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza, the Reina Sofia Museum and the Caixa Forum exhibition space - are all within easy walking distance, making The Westin Palace, Madrid the perfect base for art lovers.

neighborhood_overview:
It's the center of Madrid. On the Sol - Gran Vía - Chueca axis.
This is a neighborhood that has become the most appreciated part of Madrid. All fashion stores, restaurants, etc., have their establishments open in this area, and there are still some small traditional shops dotted between streets.
There is a nearby market (Mercado de San Antón) that has been rehabilitated and has become a meeting point with great atmosphere.
Restaurants, cafes and bars of all styles, categories and prices are all around.

name: Central Double Room near Subway
description: Hemnes room designed with traditional and mordern furniture in a renovated centrally located 100m2 apartment with direct access to Barajas Airport, Atocha Central Train Station and Mendez Álvaro Sur Bus Station, as well as Sol and Museo del Prado.
neighborhood_overview:
Mostly residential area away from the noisy night drunks, though there are also bars and restaurants around the neighborhood as well as cheap supermarkets and fruit shops. It is also a safe area to hang out at night.

If you are interested in art, the famous Reina Sofia museum is within walking distance, and if you enjoy walking like us, you can also walk to Museo del Prado and other art galleries.
host_about:
I'm a designer, a photographer, a modern nomad. I live with less and work from anywhere in the world. So far it has been 8 cities in 3 continents and counting! 

Though I'm a digital designer by profession, I love interior design and took the chance to renovate my mother's decades-old apartment during a trip back so she could live more comfortably. As you can imagine it wasn't an easy task, try telling your parents to throw that old clock stuck at ten to eleven or that weird looking boat that's supposed to bring luck into the family. But we worked out something in the end and I got to take down some walls, placed a new floor that keeps the house super cool in summer, and basically changed all the furniture in the house. 

That boat stayed on though. ;P

My mother is based in Madrid and has been working as a local tour guide for VIP groups from Asian countries and brings them all over Spain, sometimes even to Morocco, Portugal and France. Though tiring she loves her job and meeting people. My sister and I don't stay in Spain normally so she's happy to have company with at the apartment if she's not away on tour.

If you book with us please take care of the house and treat it as your own. I have prepared a guide to give you an overview of the city. If we are at home we'll be happy to help you with planning so you make the most of your stay in the city :)

name: Aparment in the famous "rastro"
description:
Apartment just in the center of the authentic Madrid, in the street of the Rastro, at 500 meters of Mayor Square, 760 meters of Sol and close to the effervescent Latina area. The appartment is in a historic "corrala", tipycal building of authentic Madrid. It has heating, wifi, air conditiong.
From the apartment you can go walking to the principal points of Madrid.
neighborhood_overview:
The Rastro, also called Cascorro, is one of the most authentic neighborhoods in Madrid and it has become a symbol. This district is the area of the "corrala", the antique shops in Ribera de Curtidores street, the effervescent Rastro, the theatres ( Latina and Pavón), the "tapas" in Cava Baja,the flower market inTirso de Molina...all this very close of Mayor Square, Royal Palace, Cathedral and Orient Square.
In the neighborhood there is a lot of restaurants (tipycal cuisine and "tapas" of Madrid and modern and international cuisine)
Also there are many food shops, little fruit shops, supermarkets (LPZ in Ribera de Curtidores street, Carrefour in front of La Latina subway station and Día in Toledo street) and the traditional market of La Cebada.
In the Cascorro square there is a laundry.
Very close to the apartment, two subway stations , Latina and Tirso de Molina, connect the district with the rest of the city.
host_about: Hola, somos Jesús y Amaia.  Nos consideramos  amables y enamorados de nuestra ciudad  y encantados de conocer gente nueva.

neighborhood_overview: The building is located in Menéndez Pidal Street along with a great number of embassies, near the stadium Santiago Bernabeu, Pio XII Auchamp Supermarket, Holiday Gym Fitness, various VIPS and Chamartin traditional market. It is, definitely, the best area of Madrid.
host_about:
I'm an artist and as there are many ways to express ART, I produce this space devoted to comics (spain comic tv). As an actress I've had a long history and if you put my name "Rosanna Walls" on Youtube, sure you get surprises. I'm lucky to have lived in the apartment I offer in Madrid and it is a marvel of home in a nice neighborhood, full of nice streets to walk, close to everything yet away from the hustle so you can relax in peace and access comfortably to any point of Madrid. By direct line or walking through La Castellana you get to Plaza Castilla where you have many transport links to the whole region. You also have the Chamartin station for trains to all northern and Europe. I live in Madrid and I will attend my guests with delight. Come to Madrid at the best cozy corner near the City Financial center "Las Torres de Europa". If you have to work in Madrid this summer it is great that you can take a dip in the pool at any time.

I describe myself as a lover of my house, the home I offer, and of course of Madrid and its People. Come to find out
You will Love it!!



Soy artista y como maneras de manifestar el ARTE, hay muchas,  produzco este espacio dedicado a los cómics http://www.spaincomic.tv como interprete llevo una larga trayectoria y si pones mi nombre en youtube  Rosanna Walls, seguro te llevas sorpresas. Por suerte he vivido en el apartamento que ofrezco en Madrid y es una maravilla de hogar en un buen barrio, lleno de bonitas calles por las que pasear, muy cerca de todo pero un pelín apartado del bullicio para que puedas descansar en paz y acceder cómodamente a cualquier punto de Madrid. En línea directa o paseando por La Castellana, llegas a Plaza Castilla donde tienes muchas conexiones de transporte a toda la comunidad. También tienes la estación de Chamartin de donde salen trenes para todo el norte del país y Europa. Yo vivo en Madrid y atenderé encantada a mis huéspedes. Ven a conocer Madrid al mejor rincón acogedor, cerca de la Ciudad Financiera en Las Torres de Europa. Sí has de trabajar en Madrid este verano lo mejor es que te puedas dar un baño en la piscina siempre que quieras.

Me describo como una enamorada de mi Casa, Hogar que ofrezco; y por supuesto de Madrid y su Gente. Ven a descubrirlo
Te encantará!!!!

description: Small private room (shared bathroom) really quiet and silent in a "corrala" (yard historical house) in the heart of the liveliest and most trendy neighbourhood of Chamberí (near CEF and IE Business School), really well located in Madrid.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the lively neighbourhood of Chamberí, really fashion lately, central, very popular, and safe. It's not just on the very centre, but just a bit away from the tourist crowded Puerta del Sol; it's a real "barrio" where true citizens from Madrid have been living for years.
host_about:
Neighbour of this funny and lively area of Madrid, Chamberí; cosmopolitan and experienced in charming places and spots to discover.
While discovering teletransportation, travelling is still a pleasure in itself.
And it's much better to immerse yourself into your destination than go on tiptoe around: so I always prefer houses and people than hotel stars
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Vecino de este divertido y animado barrio de Madrid, Chamberí, cosmopolita y experimentado en lugares encantadores y sitios por descubrir.
Mientras descubrimos la teletransportación, viajar es aún un placer en sí mismo.
Y es mucho mejor sumergirte en tu destino que pasar de puntillas por él; así que yo siempre prefiero hogares y gente que estrellas de hotel.

neighborhood_overview:
Barrio Malasaña

It is within walking distance of Plaza de Callao and Gran Vía, just 5 minutes away, and Puerta del Sol 10 minutes away


It's a two-minute walk from the Lara Theatre. In the neighborhood you can find numerous bars, restaurants with terraces where you can taste delicious tapas .
If you decide to go shopping for a day, you'll find trendy shops with exquisite taste. There are many vintage shops in the neighborhood.

It is a very lively area with many possibilities for leisure, nightlife and day life.

Due to its excellent location, you can walk to the main museums El Prado, Thyssen...

Right next to the house, on the same sidewalk, less than 20 meters away, you can find several supermarkets.
host_about:
Me encanta viajar y sentirme como en casa a aquellos lugares que visito, espero que podáis sentiros así en la mía. Bienvenidos!!!

My place is good for adventurers and business travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
The Barrio de las Letras bears its name in homage to the grande literatos who inhabited its streets in the Golden Century. Cervantes, Quevedo or Lope de Vega transit through this area located between Paseo del Prado and Plaza de Santa Ana, one of the most popular in Madrid for the charm of its pedestrian streets and its many shops and restaurants that make it especially lively on weekends.

From the Plaza de Santa Ana, famous for its terraces and tapas bars, they run on slopes to Paseo del Prado streets like that of Huertas, whose cobblestones are recorded by great writers in Spanish. Precisely on Lope de Vega street, in the church of San Ildefonso (convent of the Trinitarios Descalzas), a commemorative plaque recalls that in an indeterminate place of the building the remains of the author of El Ingenioso Hidalgo Don Quijote de la Mancha, Miguel de Cervantes. Not far from there we find the house-museum of the great playwright Lope de Vega -curiously on Calle Cervantes-, whic

name: A bonbon in the heart of Madrid
description:
Welcome to my sweet and cozy loft!

Located in one of the most emblematic areas of Madrid, near the Royal Palace it is a haven of peace in the bustle of the capital, allowing you to enjoy the entertainment and charm of our city.
neighborhood_overview:
Due to its strategic location is at walking distance from the most emblematic places of the city: the Royal Palace, the "Almudena" Cathedral, the Royal Theatre, "Puerta del Sol", "Plaza Mayor" with a required stop in the "San Miguel" Market... And on Sundays you will be able to visit the most important famous numismatic market in Spain.

You will not want to stop walking around "La Latina", "El barrio de las letras" with its trendy shops and antiques, the "Gran Via" street and the "Chueca" district. You will also be delighted in the lively Habsburg district, with its unique streets full of history and places to enjoy the Spanish gastronomy and its lively time for "aperitivo". And you can also walk the neighborhood of Lavapies on Sunday, featuring the oldest flea-market of the city, "El Rastro", or visit the museums "Prado", "Thyssen" and "Reina Sofia".
host_about:
I am an optimistic, cheerful and homely person, who looks the green side of life. My friends say I always have a smile in my Lips and my heart. I am perfectionist and care with dedication and love all around me.

I like art, especially painting, traveling, discovering places and different people and making the most of my free time. But especially, enjoy the little things, day by day, with my family.

name: Spacious and close to Gran Vía
description:
Located in the city center, very close to Gran Via, Plaza de España, Royal Palace. To 200m from emblematic Torre de Madrid where Luis Buñuel was living from 60´s to 80´s.
Safety and quietly area to 50m to the Police Station.
150x200 viscolastic matress
Locker room
neighborhood_overview:
It is located in an extremely central area, that is easily accessible and has a wide variety of commercial and cultural activity in its immediate vicinity, only 3 minutes walking from “Palacio Real”, “Teatro Real”. "Sabatini gardens" and the Cathedral, 7 minutes walking from ” Puerta del Sol” and “Plaza Mayor” and 100 meters from “Gran Via” and “Plaza España”. For your safety, there's a police office right on Fomento street.

The neighborhood is one of Madrileños’ favorites for “tapas” and is famous for its bars, restaurants and night life, all of which you will find only steps away.
host_about:
Hi! We are Alfonso & Guillermo, from micasaisyourhouse.

I (Alfonso) started renting my apartment in Madrid years ago and I discovered a vocation: to try to make people feel like home. I've travelled a lot and I'd love that you feel that nice feeling of being like home in a strange place. 

So with my University friend Guillermo we created micasaisyourhouse and now we manage apartments in Madrid (where Guillermo lives) and Seville (where Alfonso lives). We hope you enjoy your stay with us!

See you soon!

Alfonso & Guillermo

name: Well connected Guesthouse in Madrid's green belt
description: Independent fully equipped 30sqm house + 25sqm private sunny patio with outdoor dining area and jasmine clad walls. A newly renovated double bedroom, bathroom, living and dining room, open plan kitchen, it is an oasis away from Madrid's bustle! Our solar pool, loungers can be used occasionally upon prior agreement. 10 min walk to Metro, urban rail and busses. 2 min walk to restaurants. Shopping mall and all amenities nearby. Free parking outside. Next to Montecarmelo, Las Tablas and Alcobendas.
neighborhood_overview: We are lucky with a well served neighbourhood with all amenities at hand. Within an easy walk are local shops and services, Holmes place gym, shopping malls, restaurants and bars, schools and playgrounds, a typical Spanish village setting, Fuencarral and some cultural objects. A bit further 3 large hospitals, hotels, industrial and office parks, cinema's, etc.
host_about:
Hosting, entertaining in general, is my preferred activity, I'm a total people person,  travel extensively and very much look forward to welcoming international guests!  Mind, I love cats & dogs too and we have a few well behaved examples around the property. Other favourite pass times are reading, keeping fit and going to the cinema. 

My husband and I feel we need to share our home with others since our children have left the nest. We can recommend many interesting Madrid spots for all tastes, it's a great city! A private tutor of English, I also spend a lot of time on our home & Garden, while my husband is an active classic car expert.

Cuando Teresa y yo tuvimos a Daniela hace 6 años, nuestra vida cambio por completo. Para empezar, tuvimos a cambiar de casa y cuando lo hicimos no fuimos capaces de deshacernos de la casa en la que hemos sido muy felices..

name: 7mtr2 central studyroom with wide window
description:
7mtr2 room open to a spacious courtyard on a spanish traditional building, in a save and clean district. 5 minutes walking time to Retiro Park, emblematic green area in the center of the city.
All services may be used each time : big and good designed bathroom, a confortable roomy kitchen and a wardrobes room.
Home atmosphere is friendly, warm and independent. If this is your first time in Madrid, we´ll help you to be comfortable from the moment you arrive.
neighborhood_overview: Good area for walks, with Retiro Park on the way to art and museums area. Cinemas, shops and also nice small streets make pleasent wander througth the city.
host_about:
Soy madrileña. Vivo  la ciudad y sus cambios. Si vienes de nuevas, te puedo   ayudar a  ubicarte, y que disfrutes desde tu llegada tanto de las zonas populares, como de rincones singulares  y no tan transitados.

name: Aparment in latina in the center
description: The aparment is in the street of rastro a place that be in the center and you can arrive walking all points. Is provide with Wifi, Air conditionated.
neighborhood_overview:
The Rastro, also called Cascorro, is one of the most authentic neighborhoods in Madrid and it has become a symbol. This district is the area of the "corrala", the antique shops in Ribera de Curtidores street, the effervescent Rastro, the theatres ( Latina and Pavón), the "tapas" in Cava Baja,the flower market inTirso de Molina...all this very close of Mayor Square, Royal Palace, Cathedral and Orient Square.
In the neighborhood there is a lot of restaurants (tipycal cuisine and "tapas" of Madrid and modern and international cuisine)
Also there are many food shops, little fruit shops, supermarkets (LPZ in Ribera de Curtidores street, Carrefour in front of La Latina subway station and Día in Toledo street) and the traditional market of La Cebada.
In the Cascorro square there is a laundry.
Very close to the apartment, two subway stations , Latina and Tirso de Molina, connect the district with the rest of the city.
host_about: Hola, somos Jesús y Amaia.  Nos consideramos  amables y enamorados de nuestra ciudad  y encantados de conocer gente nueva.

name: Between Gran Vía & Palacio Real

You can visit the most representative monument of Madrid by walk.
150x200 viscolastic matress
Locker room
neighborhood_overview:
It is located in an extremely central area, that is easily accessible and has a wide variety of commercial and cultural activity in its immediate vicinity, only 3 minutes walking from “Palacio Real”, “Teatro Real”. "Sabatini gardens" and the Cathedral, 7 minutes walking from ” Puerta del Sol” and “Plaza Mayor” and 100 meters from “Gran Via” and “Plaza España”. The neighborhood is one of Madrileños’ favorites for “tapas” and is famous for its bars, restaurants and night life, all of which you will find only steps away.
host_about:
Hi! We are Alfonso & Guillermo, from micasaisyourhouse.

I (Alfonso) started renting my apartment in Madrid years ago and I discovered a vocation: to try to make people feel like home. I've travelled a lot and I'd love that you feel that nice feeling of being like home in a strange place. 

So with my University friend Guillermo we created micasaisyourhouse and now we manage apartments in Madrid (where Guillermo lives) and Seville (where Alfonso lives). We hope you enjoy your stay with us!

See you soon!

Alfonso & Guillermo

name: WOW! PRINCIPE SANTA ANA Wifi!!! 2br, LIFT
description: PRINCIPE  SANTA ANA (Calle del Principe , Madrid) is placed in a classic building on the CITY CENTER on a 4th floor WITH LIFT, 3 minutes walking to Puerta del Sol and underground, in the centre of the Paseo del Arte, the "PRINCIPE TWIN SANTA ANA" opens out onto the most exuberant city, contemporary theatre and art you can enjoy in the museums near the apartment: the Museo del Prado, the Museo Reina Sofía and the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza.
neighborhood_overview: "PRINCIPE TWIN SANTA ANA" is in the heart of the Letters District, his name came from the famous writers who lived and worked there during XVI and XVII centuries. This district is one of the more attractive commercial areas of Madrid with theatres, restaurants, bars, coffees and hotels. Point of contact of tourists and students is the Plaza SANTA ANA, famous by his terraces and his glamorous nightlife. The Letters District is very close to PLAZA MAYOR and PUERTA del SOL ending on the Paseo del Prado where famous hotels PALACE and RITZ are placed. Enjoy the most emblematic works of Spanish and international art in the most important museums in Spain. Experience the most dynamic nightlife and taste the best tapas. Madrid is full of cultural, gastronomic, leisure and business opportunities and welcomes all visitors. Discover the coolest and most glamorous nightlife of Madrid, if you dare.
host_about: MADRID is the place to be!!!! I am a photographer and world traveler. I prefers to stay at vacation rental properties because there is nothing more than having a place you can call home. What better way to soak up the local culture than to feel a part of the neighborhood? This is what I extend to my guests when they stay at my place.
