name: Imperial Deluxe Plaza Mayor
description: Beautiful and top-end quality loft for 2 people behind Plaza Mayor and located in an authentic corrala from the XVI century.
host_about:
Hi!!

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer (during 2017 I became mum, so I won't be doing check in's for a while). However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 25 years now and enrolled in a new adventure in spring 2017: becoming a mum. Life had still not so pleasant surprises and in september 2021 she was diagnosed a breast cancer and is still in treatment. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board, a lot since 2012 we must say, and each of them have left their impromt in our company. Now the team is composed by Mica, an Argentinian girl now based in Madrid for a few years, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Mica is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Julia, who joined us in in February 2023. Julia is Mica's friend, also Argentine and has a super cool and fun vibe.

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens, spending time with friends, our dogs and Vanessa's daughter (the only mother of the team!). We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 

We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Osca, Vanessa, Mica and Julia
Nuba Gestión de Apartamentos, S.L.

description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home. We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

description: Comfortable apartment (48 m2) within the so-called Triangle of Art: museums Reina Sofía, Thyssen-Bornemisza and El Prado. If you travel to Madrid for travel or business this apartment fits you. Located in the neighborhood of Embajadores (the travel and leisure magazine Time Out called it the coolest neighborhood in the world) and very well connected (it already existed in the 16th century).
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has a wide range of bars and restaurants with a very good atmosphere where breakfast, tapas or dinner will be a sure hit.

The apartment is located nearby two pharmacies and several supermarkets, specifically the one located in Plaza de Lavapiés, Carrefour, is open 24 hours from Monday to Sunday.



A few steps from the Doré Cinema, belonging to the National Film Library, where the author's films are projected in the context of different cycles. A few steps away from Caixa Forum and the Reina Sofía Museum. And if you are looking for classic painting you have the Museo del Prado and the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza within a few minutes walk.

name: View to Plaza Mayor
description: Entire apartment, completely renewed, in an historical building. At the very heart of Madrid, with all the monuments and places of interest at walking distance. Ideal for a city trip
neighborhood_overview:
In all regards, the Plaza Mayor is ideally located to visit the City as every interesting monuments or sightseeing are situated nearby, like the Royal Palace, the Golden Art Triangle (Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia), as well as nice shopping areas.

The neighbourhood also provides any type of restaurants and bars, or the well-known Mercado de San Miguel (San Miguel Market) were any kind of typical Spanish food is served.

It provides also excellent connections with tube stations and with the airport or the train station Atocha.

And any tips on the city, or on bars and restaurants is more than willingly given! Anyway, once you make your reservation, I send you all the information you might need, with a personal A-Z Guide of Madrid...

When visiting a city, nothing better than being nearby everything worth seeing and resting afterwards in a nice atmosphere.
host_about:
Hi, I'm glad to welcome you to my apartment in Plaza Mayor, Madrid. 

I am originally from Belgium, French speaking, but living in Spain for ten years. Being here is a great pleasure and I enjoy the city a lot. I like sightseeing and I will be very happy to give you any information regarding its history and places to see... and of course I can give you nice tips on restaurants and other places to go out at night.

I like travelling and meeting new people is always a pleasure. 

Very much into arts en general, litterature as well as good music... 

Hope to welcome you very soon,

name: Charming Salamanca apartment, 1BR. - VI
description: Stylish and bright apartment to let, very well located in an historical area in the centre of Madrid a few steps away from the well-known Velazquez and Serrano streets, in the most exclusive area of the city, with modern commodities and lift.
neighborhood_overview: The district of Salamanca is one of the 21 districts that form the municipality of Madrid. It owes its name to its builder, the Malagueño D. José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marqués de Salamanca, who promoted it and erected in part in the 19th century. It has become one of the most important shopping areas in the city and one of the highest living quarters in Europe with the largest luxury shopping area in Madrid around the streets Serrano, Claudio Coello and Ortega y Gasset.
host_about: Venezuelan architect, italian, spanish and Argentinian descent, loves to eat and share the city secrets with everybody who visit Madrid.  In 2008 starts a small holiday lettings company to complement the architecture and interior design job. name: Modern and bright Duplex in La Latina/Plaza Mayor
description: Sharing Co presents this excellent and spacious accommodation managed by Sharing Co, recently renovated for 4 people in the center of Madrid with two bedrooms and two bathrooms. Live like a local in this traditional accommodation located in a quiet area and just a few minutes walking from Madrid's historic center and traditional places: La Cava Baja, El Rastro, Plaza Mayor, and the Royal Palace in the La Latina neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is well situated in the La Latina neighborhood. All of the primary attractions in Madrid are just a short walk away - The Royal Palace and Opera House, San Francisco Cathedral, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, and just a bit further the museums Reina Sofia and The Prado.
Sundays in La Latina are amazing. The Rastro, a large antiques flea market is steps away and the neighborhood is full of life. We are also a few minutes walking from the tapas bars of Cava Baja. Located just up the street from the apartment are Sixta and Atril - both fun alternative/gay bars that are packed on Sunday evenings before midnight.
For a more fun night out the apartment is 5 metro stops from Chueca. Although we always opt for the 30 minute walk through Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, and Fuencarral - one of the liveliest walks in central Madrid.
host_about: I am from San Francisco, my husband is from Madrid.  We both work for software companies based in London so are able spend a lot of time in Madrid working remote.

name: Cute apartment in Madrid center
description:
Hello! If you are interested in renting a lovely apartment in Madrid center,
be well located to visit Madrid highlights, or you are a digital nomad , this is your place!

I follow the first Airbnb idea that was to rent your place when you are away, not for making business, so my place is not like a hotel-apartment it's my little own space that I rent if I am away.

So if you are looking fo a place to party, sorry, I dont think thats your place...
neighborhood_overview:
Lavapies neighbourhood, wellnone as the multicultural area of Madrid.
In the neighborhood you can enjoy food from the most diverse countries as well as tapas and traditional Spanish cuisine. There is also a rich nightlife. From traditional coffee through live music venues to local ethnic music.
The cultural offer is very varied, highlighting the National Centre de Arte Reina Sofía. Likewise also in the neighborhood, you can find the “Casa Encendida”, social and cultural center of many activities program, and the “Price Theatre/Circus”, venue for the performing arts through exhibitions, workshops and productions.
host_about: Hello!! My name is Marta and I live in Madrid even though I travel quite often ,that's why I  rent my  apartment while I'm away. So if you are looking for a quiet and cozy place and feel like home more than in a hotel, you are welcome!

name: 3 Bdr PH, Best Views, Madrid Center
description: 3/1 Beautiful 6th Floor Pent-House with the most stunning, unobstructed views of all of Madrid. In La Latina’s most central district of Historic Madrid. Comprised of 3 spacious bedrooms (master, 2 twin beds & third one w/movable twin or office space)
neighborhood_overview:
Best possible location in the absolute center of historic Madrid. You will not find a better location for being a tourist and traveler in Madrid. The apartment is right on the square of La Latina & the Mercado Plaza de La Cebada (an indoor fresh produce market), also conveniently located around grocery stores, pharmacies, Cava Baja Restaurants... In front of La Latina Metro and just a short walk to Tirso de Molina Metro.

Bakeries and food stores a few steps away.

Very well located next to all the restaurants, tapas and Madrid 'movida' BUT very quiet apartment, where you can rest well.

Gorgeous views and sunsets.

Walking distance to Mercado de San Miguel, Cava Baja, Casa Lucio, Plaza de La Paja, Plaza Mayor.
host_about:
Spanish-American family living in the U.S. sharing the properties we own and love across the United States and Spain. 
Our Madrid apartment has been in the family for generations, and as the 3rd generation of owners, our siblings and I, hope to keep it in the family for many more to enjoy beautiful Madrid and our roots. We go back every year and take the kids to practice their Spanish; we feel privileged to own such a spot to call home in the true center of old Madrid.

We love Spain and the exposure to our heritage that our family gets to enjoy like, if they were living in Spain though our Madrid apartment  and... to expose them to all the culture in the city. We speak English, Spanish, French and Italian. We are happy to send more pictures and details if needed. If you rent with us, we would love to share all our favorite places and tips of Madrid and surroundings. We'll get back to you ASAP but no longer than 24 hours!

Located in EL RASTRO, one of the most traditional neighbourhoods of the Spanish capital.
With everything you want to visit very close by:
- Subway/Tube in 2 minutes: Tirso de Molina (light blue line), La Latina (light green line).
- Plaza Mayor and Plaza del Sol in 4 minutes.
- La Latina and Austrias districts (restaurants, cocktails, terrazas) in a 2 minute walk.

neighborhood_overview:
Santa Ana Square is right in the center of Las Letras lively neighborhood.
Most of Madrid amenities are within walking distance, museums or the countless bars, flamenco tablaos or theatres.
Thriving cultural life, art galleries and the main city museums (Prado, Reina Sofia, Thyssen) are a stones throw.
The vicinity is renowned as well for its thrilling night life, its typical restaurants, tapas bars and terraces.
Should you be interested in a particular activity do let us know
host_about:
Entusiasta de Madrid, me gusta pasear por sus calles y observar cómo cambia la ciudad, sus gentes, el paso de las estaciones o simplemente perderme por el centro.
La felicidad reside en las cosas sencillas, comer, viajar, querer, hace deporte, dormir,  si eres capaz de vivir como quieres serás feliz y Madrid es un gran lugar para serlo!.
Al mismo tiempo necesito escapadas frecuentes a la montaña y al mar, contacto con la naturaleza que se pierde en las ciudades.

description: Charming apartment in historical building at Glorieta de Bilbao, with the metro station Bilbao  just at the same door of the apartment, only 10 minutes walking to Gran Via and 2 minutes to Malasana
neighborhood_overview:
The Glorieta de Bilbao is located on the edge of Chamberí district, one of the most desirable area to live by the locals because it has all the services and their good communication with all areas of Madrid. In the Square is the famous Cafe Commercial, one of the oldest in Madrid, which still retains the literary atmosphere of times past.

Crossing the Glorieta, you will find Fuencarral Street, full of designer shops, which leads to the famous Gran Via and then to the Puerta del Sol

From Puerta del Sol, a few minutes you will reach the Royal Palace, Madrid de los Austrias and Plaza Mayor. And also to the Barrio de las Letras and Museums Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia.

The Paseo de la Castellana and the Plaza de Colón is also a 10 minute walk from the apartment, and the Retiro Park is less than 15 minutes away walking.

The trendiest neighborhoods of Madrid, Chueca and Malasaña, are also within less than 10 minutes walk. The Square May 2, fa
host_about:

name: PLAZA MAYOR DELUXE
description:
Beautiful apartment in Plaza Mayor Square. Puerta del Sol can be reached within a 2-minute walk, also Metro Station and Train.
Very bright, spacious, newly renovated with brand new furniture and appliances.
Air conditioning. Free Wifi & Safe
neighborhood_overview:
Many of the city’s most famous monuments can easily be reached on foot.
The surrounding area boasts a wealth of restaurants, cafes and bars to enjoy.
You are under 5 minutes walk you arrive at the Royal Palace, Almudena Cathedral, Opera or Puerta del Sol, the centre of Madrid.
If the walk is a little longer , a 15 minute walk is also the Puerta de Alcala, Plaza de Cibeles, Museo Thyssen, the Prado Museum, Retiro Park...
Just a few minutes from the apartment you will find some of the oldest and most renowned restaurants in Madrid, as Lucio, Lhardy and Botín ... Areas of tapas known as the famous neighborhood of La Latina, the Cava Baja or the recently renovated Mercado de San Miguel.
host_about:
Somos Noelia y Mario, una pareja de Madrid. Vivimos durante varios años en la Plaza Mayor y allí estábamos felices, con un montón de planes a nuestro alrededor, con la tranquilidad de cualquier hogar de puertas para adentro y el bullicio de Madrid con sólo abrir los balcones.

Nuestra familia fue creciendo y tuvimos que cambiarnos de casa, pero como teníamos mucho cariño a nuestro apartamento, decidimos compartirlo con otros viajeros que quisieran conocer el encanto de Madrid.
 
¡Desde los balcones del apartamento se podía disfrutar de una de las plazas con más vida del mundo! Era 2013 y nacía Plaza Mayor Deluxe.

Todo al principio fue una aventura, la reforma, imaginar cómo decorábamos el apartamento, qué equipamiento dejábamos dentro, electrodomésticos, cómo contactábamos con la gente que quisiera alquilarlo…Lo que sí teníamos muy claro es que nuestro fin último es que los invitados que se alojaran en nuestro apartamento se sintieran como en casa.

Entonces llegó nuestra primera reserva... y luego otra y otra más… la gente no sólo venía una vez, sino que ¡muchos querían volver!
Fue cuando nos encontramos con un problema, ¡no teníamos días libres! (vaya problema, ¿verdad?). No en serio, nos daba mucha rabia que la gente que íbamos conociendo y que se iban convirtiendo en amigos quisieran venir a Madrid y no tuviéramos un lugar para ellos. Así que nos liamos la manta a la cabeza y empezamos a trabajar con más apartamentos. En el 2015 nacía Romantic, también en la Plaza Mayor, ideal para parejas. Este apartamento tiene ventanales dan a un patio interior con lo cual se puede disfrutar de los planes de la Plaza Mayor y la tranquilidad y el silencio de un patio privado. 

En el 2016 se nos presentó la oportunidad de gestionar dos apartamentos más y allá que nos lanzamos! Uno de ellos está también en la Plaza Mayor, es el apartamento de más capacidad (hasta 5 personas), lo llamamos Family. El otro está muy cerca de Plaza de España y desde sus ventanales se ve completamente el Palacio Real, las vistas de día y de noche cuando se ilumina el Palacio son espectaculares. Sencillamente impresionante!

El último, por el momento, es Elegance y lo inauguramos en Marzo de 2017. Es un apartamento espectacular, tiene dos habitaciones y en la habitación principal hay dos balcones desde los que se ve la Plaza Mayor, un salón gigante y un cuarto de baño enorme con ducha y bañera. ¡Todo lujo y elegancia!

Lo mejor sin duda de estos años ha sido la cantidad de gente estupenda que hemos ido conociendo, con ellos hemos ido creciendo y ahora tenemos amigos por todo el mundo! 

Os invitamos a que disfrutéis de nuestros apartamentos y esperamos que os sintáis como en vuestra casa.

name: Your house in Madrid. Near the center. Two bedroom
description: Bright, quiet. Very comfortable two double bedroom; kitchen, living room, bathroom, whasing machine, microwave, Towels and hair-dryer. Is near Atocha, Center, University, Madrid River. Supermarket, bar, banks, chemist.
neighborhood_overview:
The House is located in the District of Carabanchel. Here the famous Fiestas de San Isidro, the patron saint of the city is celebrated. In the nearby San Isidro Park, the chulapos and chulapas come in the month of May to celebrate these festivities in popular festivals.

We are also near Madrid River. Wonderful recreational gardens that run across the edge of the near Manzanares, where locals like to walk, rent a bike, exercise and in summer take bath in their fun sources coming out of the ground. There are rental of sun loungers and meadows of grass, as well as cafes and bars. Since it can access other interesting parts of the city.

El Estadio Vicente Calderón and his Museum are also close to the House, within this zone of Madrid River.

The great Park of the Empress is also very close, with more wooded variety.

District is a comfortable and affordable place. With gardens and playgrounds at the door. With supermarket day one minute from the do
host_about:
Hola, soy Mónica.

Madrileña de nacimiento. Vivo y trabajo en Madrid aunque he viajado por países de Europa, Centro y Sur América y Norte de África. Mi destino pendiente: Asia. Hablo Español, Portugués y me defiendo con el Inglés.

Estudié Educación Social y comencé Antropología Cultural. Viví durante un tiempo en Brasil, dónde estudié parte de esta apasionante carrera, la cuál de momento, no he llegado a terminar.
Me dedico a la intervención social con personas sin hogar, en alojamientos institucionales. Un trabajo que considero interesante y desde el que creo se aprende mucho; Sobre todo a nivel de respeto y convivencia, del trato entre personas desde el lado más humano y cómo resolver problemas desde la creatividad y el ingenio.

Intento meditar, procuro pintar y hacer manualidades y me gusta mucho bailar. He hecho danza oriental durante años, aunque ahora la tengo un poco abandonada. También he sacado mi lado más artístico a flote haciendo cursos de clown y poniendo en escena a algún personaje.

Me gusta mucho cocinar. Para mí y para los demás. He hecho cursos profesionales y disfruto enseñando la preparación de platos típicos de nuestra región, aunque me gusta elaborar recetas de cualquier parte del mundo (por lo menos las que conozco).

En mis ratos libres disfruto dando un paseo, visitando los mercados y parques del barrio en el que vivo o teniendo una buena conversación mientras se toma una cerveza con una buena tapa o un chocolate con churros. Esos pequeños-grandes placeres de la vida, de los cuáles creo que se puede gozar en Madrid, sin gastar mucho y si lo conoces un poco. Dar un paseo por el Rastro de Madrid, ir a un concierto o ir al teatro.
Creo que soy de esas personas que te pueden enseñar el Madrid que no sale en las guías turísticas, así como informarte de los lugares más emblemáticos y las rutas típicas. 
Además, cerca de casa, el intercambiador de Plaza Elíptica o la Estación de Atocha te puede llevar a lugares también muy especiales y cercanos como Toledo, Alcalá de Henares o zonas más al Norte como la Sierra de Madrid.
Lugares que me encanta visitar o por los que salir a dar una caminata, sobre todo por el campo, donde procuro ir de vez en cuando. Me gusta mucho hacer escapadas a la naturaleza o pasar unos días en el pequeño pueblo de mi madre, en Ávila.

El barrio en el que vivo y trabajo, Carabanchel, me resulta muy agradable. Tiene una vida social y comunitaria interesante. Sin moverme de él puedo salir a hacer unas compras o dar cursos en los centros públicos o alternativos que existen en la zona.

Madrid, Maguerit como la denominaron los árabes, es una ciudad con mucha magia y encanto, de la que se puede gozar, sobre todo con unas pequeñas pistas y ganas de pasarlo bien.
Te espero en mi casa, de la que disfrutarás durante tu estancia.


Hi, I'm Monica!

Madrid's birth. I live and work in Madrid although I have toured countries of Europe, Central and South America and North Africa. My pending destination: Asia. I speak Spanish, Portuguese and defend me with English.

Studied Social education and Cultural Anthropology began. I lived for a time in Brazil, where studied part of this exciting race, which for the time being, I have not come to end.

I am the social intervention with homeless people, in institutional accommodations. A work which I consider interesting and from which I believe can learn a lot; Above all at the level of respect and coexistence, the treatment of people from the more human side and how solve problems from the creativity and ingenuity.

I try to meditate, try to paint and do crafts and I love dancing. I've done Oriental Dance for years, but now I have it a little abandoned. I've also taken my side more artistic afloat doing clown courses and putting in scene a character.

I really like cooking. For me and for others. I've done professional courses and enjoy teaching the preparation of typical dishes from our region, although I like to prepare recipes from anywhere in the world (at least that I know).

In my spare time I enjoy walking, visiting markets and parks of the neighborhood in which I live or having a good conversation while sipping a beer with a good top or a chocolate with "churros". Those "little and big pleasures of life", which I think that you can enjoy in Madrid, without spending much and if you know him a bit. Take a stroll through the Rastro de Madrid, go to a concert or go to the theatre.

Think I'm of those people who can teach you the Madrid which does not appear in tourist guides as well as inform you of the most emblematic places and typical routes.

In addition, close to home, the Plaza elíptica exchanger or Atocha station can take you to places nearby such as Toledo, Alcalá de Henares and areas further north as the Sierra de Madrid and also very special.
Places that I love to visit or why go to hike, especially for the field, where I try to go from time to time. I like to much make getaways to nature or spend a few days in the small village of my mother, in Avila.

District in which I live and work, Carabanchel, is very pleasant for me. It has an interesting social and community life. Without leaving him I go out to do some shopping or take courses in public or alternative centers that exist in the area.

Madrid, Maguerit as they called it the Arabs, is a city with much magic and charm, which you can enjoy, especially with some small tracks and desire to pass it well.

I hope in my house, which you can enjoy during your stay.



    Oi, eu sou a Monica.

    Do Madrid de nascimento. Moro e trabalho em Madrid, apesar de eu ter excursionado países da Europa, América do Sul e Central, e Norte da África. Meu destino pendente: Ásia. Falo Espanhol, Português e defende-me com o inglês.

     

    Estudou Social Educação e Antropologia Cultural começaram. Eu vivi por um tempo no Brasil, onde estudou parte da emocionante corrida, que por enquanto, eu não vim para acabar.

    Eu sou a intervenção social com pessoas desabrigadas, em acomodações institucionais. Um trabalho que considero interessante e do qual eu acredito que posso aprender muito; Acima de tudo a nível de respeito e de convivência, o tratamento de pessoas do lado mais humano e como resolver problemas da criatividade e engenhosidade.

     

    Tento meditar, tente pintar e fazer artesanato e adoro dançar. Fiz dança oriental por anos, mas agora eu tenho um pouco abandonado. Também tomei meu lado mais artístico à tona, fazendo cursos de palhaço e colocando em cena um personagem.

     

    Eu realmente gosto de cozinhar. Para mim e para os outros. Já fiz cursos profissionalizantes e gostar de ensinar a preparação de pratos típicos da nossa região, embora eu gosto de preparar receitas de qualquer lugar do mundo (pelo menos que eu saiba).

     

    No meu tempo livre gosto de caminhar, visitar os mercados e parques do bairro em que vivo ou ter uma boa conversa enquanto bebe uma cerveja com um bom top ou um chocolate com churros. Esses pequenos-grandes prazeres da vida, que eu acho que você pode apreciar em Madrid, sem gastar muito e se você conhecê-lo um pouco. Faça um passeio através do Rastro de Madrid, ir a um show ou ir ao teatro.

    Acha que eu sou daquelas pessoas que pode ensiná-lo a Madrid que não aparece no turista guias, bem como informá-lo dos locais mais emblemáticos e rotas típicas.

    Além disso, perto de casa, o permutador de Plaza elíptica ou estação Atocha pode te levar a lugares próximos como Toledo, Alcalá de Henares e áreas mais a norte, como o Sierra de Madrid e também muito especial.

    Lugares que adoro visitar ou por que vai para caminhar, especialmente para o campo, onde eu tento ir de vez em quando. Eu queria muito fazer viagens à natureza ou passar alguns dias na pequena aldeia de minha mãe, em Ávila.

No distrito em que vivo e trabalho, Carabanchel, é muito agradável para mim. Tem uma vida interessante, social e comunitário. Sem deixá-lo, saio para fazer compras ou fazer cursos em centros públicos ou alternativos que existem na área.

     

    Madrid, Maguerit como lhe chamavam os árabes, é uma cidade com muita magia e encanto, que você pode desfrutar, especialmente com algumas pequenas faixas e desejo passá-la bem.

    Espero em minha casa, que poderá desfrutar durante a sua estadia.

    こんにちは、私はモニカーです。

    マドリード

    誕生。住んでいるし、ヨーロッパ、中央、南アメリカ、北アフリカの国をツアーしているものの、マドリードで働きます。私の保留中の目的地： アジア。スペイン語、ポルトガル語を話すし、英語で私を守るため。

     

    研究社会教育・文化人類学を始めた。ブラジルでは、どこでこのエキサイティングなの一部を学ぶレース、当分の間、私は終わりに来ていないのためにしばらく住んでください。

    制度の宿泊施設で、ホームレスの人々 と社会的介入をいます。私は考えて面白いとは私が信じる仕事にたくさん; 学ぶことができます。上記のすべての尊敬と共存より多くの人間側からの人々 の治療のレベルでの創造性と創意工夫から問題を解決して。

     

    私は瞑想をペイントしようとしてしないでください工芸品と私の愛のダンスします。年、東のダンスをやったが今少し捨てられて。私はまたより功妙な海上ピエロ コース、シーンに文字を入れて私の側を撮影しました。

     

    私は本当に料理が好きです。私にとって、他の人。専門コースをやったし、どこからのレシピを準備したいが、私たちの地域からの典型的な料理の準備を指導を楽しむ世界で (少なくとも私が知っている）。

     

    暇なときにウォーキング、市場との住んでいる近所の公園を訪問、良い良いトップでビールやチュロスが付いているチョコレートを飲みながら会話を楽しんでお楽しみ。それら pequenos グランデスはの多くを費やすことがなく、マドリードで楽しむことができます、あなたは少し彼を知っているかどうかと思う人生の快楽。ラストロ de マドリードでの散歩、コンサートに行くまたは劇場に行きます。

    と思うそれらの人々 の観光客には表示されませんマドリードを教えることができる午前ガイドとして最も象徴的な場所、代表的なルートをお知らせ。

    さらに、ホーム、プラザ見る: エリプティカ エクスチェン ジャー、アトーチャ駅近くに取ることができますあなた近くのアルカラ ・ デ ・ エナレス トレドなどへさらにエリア北シエラ ・ デ ・ マドリッドとして、また非常に特別です。

    またはなぜ時から行くしたいフィールドの特にハイキングに行くを訪問する愛している場所。私は自然に多くの作る逃走したいまたは私の母は、アビラの小さな村で数日を過ごします。私は生活し、働くカラバンチェル、

     

    地区は私にとって非常に楽しかったです。それは社会やコミュニティの生活面白い。彼を離れることがなく私はいくつかの買い物や、エリア内に存在するパブリックまたは代替センターでコースを取るに行きます。

     

    マドリード、Maguerit として彼らは、アラブ人と呼ばれる都市が多くの魔法と魅力とことができますいくつかの小さなトラックの特に楽しむ渡します。

    することを望むご滞在中に楽しむことができます私の家でほしい。

    Salut, je suis Monica.

Naissance de Madrid. J'habite et travaille à Madrid, bien que j'ai fait une tournée des pays d'Europe, centrale et l'Amérique du Sud et Afrique du Nord. Ma destination en attente : Asie. Je parle espagnol, portugais et me défendre avec l'anglais.

     

    Éducation sociale étudie et anthropologie culturelle a commencé. J'ai vécu pendant un certain temps au Brésil, où une partie étudiée de ce passionnant course, qui pour l'instant, je ne suis pas venu à la fin.

    Je suis l'intervention sociale auprès des sans-abri, dans accommodements institutionnels. Un travail qui me paraît intéressant et qui je crois peut apprendre beaucoup de choses ; Surtout au niveau du respect et de coexistence, le traitement de personnes côté plus humain et comment résoudre les problèmes de la créativité et l'ingéniosité.

     

    j'ai essayer de méditer, essayer de peindre et de métiers d'art et j'aime danser. J'ai fait danse est pour des années, mais maintenant je l'ai un peu abandonné. J'ai aussi pris mon côté plus artistique sous voile, faire des cours de clown et mettant en scène un personnage.

     

    J'aime vraiment cuisiner. Pour moi et pour d'autres. J'ai fait des cours de formation professionnelles et profiter de l'enseignement de la préparation de plats typiques de notre région, bien que j'aime préparer des recettes de partout dans le monde (au moins que je connais).

     

    Dans mon temps libre, j'aime marcher, visiter les marchés et les parcs du quartier dans lequel j'habite ou avoir une bonne conversation en sirotant une bière avec un bon top ou un chocolat avec des churros. Ces pequenos-grandes plaisirs de la vie, qui, je pense que vous pouvez apprécier à Madrid, sans dépenser beaucoup et si tu le connais un peu. Promenez-vous dans le Rastro de Madrid, aller à un concert ou aller au théâtre.

    Pense que je suis de ceux qui peut vous apprendre le Madrid qui n'apparaît pas dans la touristique guide ainsi que vous informe des lieux emblématiques et des itinéraires typiques.

    En outre, à proximité de la maison, l'échangeur de Plaza elíptica ou la gare d'Atocha peut vous emmener dans des endroits à proximité comme Tolède, Alcalá de Henares et zones plus au nord de la Sierra de Madrid et aussi très spécial.

    Les lieux que j'aime visiter ou pourquoi aller faire de la randonnée, en particulier pour le champ, où j'essaie d'aller de temps en temps. J'aime beaucoup escapades de rendre à la nature ou passer quelques jours dans le petit village de ma mère, à Avila.

     

    District dans lequel je vis et travaille, Carabanchel, est très agréable pour moi. Il a une vie sociale et communautaire intéressante. Sans lui laisser, je sors pour faire du shopping ou prendre des cours dans des centres publics ou alternatives qui existent dans la région.

     

    Madrid, Maguerit comme ils l'appelaient les arabes, est une ville avec beaucoup de magie et charme, que vous pouvez profiter, en particulier avec d'autres petits titres et désirez passer bien.

    J'espère que dans ma maison, que vous pourrez déguster lors de votre séjour.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood of Las Letras is one of the best located in Madrid, as you are in the heart of the city, a short walk from Atocha Station and a few streets from the city's Art Triangle (Prado Museum, Thyssen and Reina Sofia). Within the area you will find Calle Huertas, known for the atmosphere of its bars, Plaza Santa Ana, one of the city's most lively squares and with renowned restaurants to discover Spanish cuisine. You are a 5-minute walk from Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol.
On the opposite side, you can walk a few minutes to Cibeles, Puerta de Alcalá, and Retiro Park.

If you're looking for shopping, you have several options to do so... from the Puerta del Sol you'll find Calle Preciados known for its great shops! (Corte Ingles, Fnac, and various fashion stores)

If you are looking for a much more chic area, you can walk to the Salamanca neighborhood and its famous Calle Serrano, recognized in the fashion world for its famous boutiques. The start of this

name: Downtown Comfortable Apartment Gran Vía | A007
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home.

We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

host_about: Estoy feliz compartiendo mi casa, creo que si en algo nos parecemos todos y cada uno es en el placer de tener oportunidad de conocer gente positiva , curiosa, de compartir con personas de diferentes nacionalidades momentos que son muy ricos donde podemos aprender mucho  sobre otras costumbres ,vivir experiencias , practicar otros idiomas,hacer disfrutar de nuestra ciudad , de su gastronomía , atracciones , particularidades y secretos que si nuestros huéspedes la conocieran por su cuenta dudo que pudieran absorber su verdadera esencia . En una palabra me gusta esta actividad , llevo poco tiempo en ella ya que antes  tuve oportunidad  de ser docente en mi ciudad natal  Buenos Aires , tuve tiendas de ropa con mis propios diseños aquí en Madrid y en cada una de ellas aprendí muchas que  espero me sirvan para este nuevo reto que he emprendido con mucho entusiasmo . Me encanta viajar , por trabajo he conocido muchos países y creo que es una experiencia enriquecedora . Amo la naturaleza , la vida al aire libre , hacer senderismo  y tratar de mejorar un poco este mundo participando en diferentes movimientos sociales . En una palabra me encanta estar viva.

name: Retiro Apartment (Staymadrid)
description: This bright and airy apartment is on the first floor of a brand new refurbished building and benefits from a fantastic location. The property is wooden flooring throughout, tastefully decorated and comprises a living room and dining area.
neighborhood_overview:
It is a neighborhood full of charm. A neighborhood for all ages and tastes due to its leisure offer, restaurants and bars.
The Retiro Park is without a doubt my favorite place. Its sculptures, the lake with its boats, the vegetation and all its history make it unique. On weekends it seems like a festival full of musicians, street artists, children and young people skating, fairs, etc. The crystal palace has a lot of really nice exhibits. Likewise, its terraces inside and outside the park make the neighborhood fill with color and joy.
Its proximity to Calle Goya (8 minutes walk), a street famous for its shops and the Salamanca neighborhood (luxury shops, leading brands and high-end jewelry stores), its proximity to emblematic monuments such as La Cibeles or La Puerta de Alcalá, in addition to the most important museums in the city (15 -20 minute walk) make the neighborhood one of the most attractive and desired in Madrid.
host_about: Hola soy Yoima, Me gusta viajar y conocer a personas de distintas partes del mundo, con diferentes culturas e idiomas,  relacionarme y aprender de otros me ayuda a comprender otras realidades y a ser mas tolerante como persona.

name: Beautiful apt Old Town and Royal Palace La Latina
description: Charming spacious aparment for 4 people, with 2 balconies, bathtub and elevator in La Latina (Old Town), walking distance to the main sights
host_about:
Hi!!

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer (during 2017 I became mum, so I won't be doing check in's for a while). However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 25 years now and enrolled in a new adventure in spring 2017: becoming a mum. Life had still not so pleasant surprises and in september 2021 she was diagnosed a breast cancer and is still in treatment. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board, a lot since 2012 we must say, and each of them have left their impromt in our company. Now the team is composed by Mica, an Argentinian girl now based in Madrid for a few years, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Mica is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Julia, who joined us in in February 2023. Julia is Mica's friend, also Argentine and has a super cool and fun vibe.

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens, spending time with friends, our dogs and Vanessa's daughter (the only mother of the team!). We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 

We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Osca, Vanessa, Mica and Julia
Nuba Gestión de Apartamentos, S.L.

name: Beautiful & Comfortable Apartment Gran Vía | A061
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home. We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

name: Single room with bathroom in the center of Madrid
description:
Bright, quiet, exterior single room next to a private bathroom. Located in the heart of Madrid (a 10-minute walk from Plaza de Sol, El Retiro Park, and the Prado Museum).

Wi-Fi, central heating, 3-meter-high ceilings.
Two elevators, and a doorman available Monday through Friday. There is a DIA supermarket in the same building.
Excellent transport links: metro, bus, express bus (airport), train, taxi, and rental bikes.
neighborhood_overview:
Very close to important points of interest: historic center, Reina Sofía museum, Prado museum, Thysen museum, Royal Palace, Opera, Plaza Mayor, Plaza de Sol, Plaza de España, Botanical garden, Retiro park, Madrid-Río park, market street map of El Rastro (Sundays). All of them can be reached on foot in a few minutes. Public transport is also many and unbeatable, very close: as soon as you leave home you will find the metro, bus, train, taxi, bicycle a few steps away.
There are more than four public access libraries.
Lavapiés (or "Latin Quarter") is the most dynamic, the best intercultural, march-fun area (the cheapest and most traditional in Madrid). We are also next to major cultural centers in Madrid: Casa Encendida, Circo Price, Valle Inclán theater, Caracol concert hall, Matadero cultural center, Tabacalera cultural center, and several alternative theater venues.
On Sunday mornings there is the famous El Rastro street market, five minutes away, which the visitor will

neighborhood_overview: WHERE TO EAT: The area has a rich and varied national and international gastronomic selection on offer. Here are several suggestions, all less than 200 meters from LA CASA DE LUNA: If you like signature cuisine, right opposite is the Gastrobar (delicious!!). In Corredera Baja 10 I recommend Marichestnut and for a snack in the attached building there is the Italian Bookstore/Coffee Shop. Mediterranean cuisine with Arabic touches in La Mucca de Pez, with a lively terrace. There is a wonderful Argentine restaurant, La Martina, in Luna Square, and it also has midday specials and a varied menu. For lovers of Indian food, the daily special for €10 from 'Curry's' (Silva, 16) is magnificent. On that same street there are several tasty Japanese and Chinese restaurants. If you prefer the Creole flavor of New Orleans, go to Gumbo on Calle del Pez. description:
Barrio de las Letras.
Cozy renovated apartment on Calle Cervantes in a historical building. Located in the middle of Madrid 5 minutes from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor and 3 minutes from Museo del Prado, Thyssen Museum.
Very quiet street with supermarket next door and a lot of bars and shops.

neighborhood_overview:
Where your feet feel the literature...
Have you ever walked through book fragments? Have you dreamed of being a part or the protagonist of a novel? If your answer is yes, go into the surprising Barrio de las Letras.
Don't be in a hurry, let yourself be carried away by the literature printed in a beautiful golden color. Feel the Spanish Golden Age at every step, on every corner, on every wall.
Modern shops, design shops, other "all life" stores, convents, palaces, luxury hotels, tasks, taverns, restaurants, museums, squares, plazas and a succession of streets where Madrid gives us its history, culture, cuisine and, of course, its letters!
Perfectly delimited between the famous streets of Atocha, Carrera de San Jerónimo and Paseo del Prado and closing the almost perfect triangle, Calle Carretas. description: 20'from the airport,central design apartment recently renovated in the most characteristic neighborhood of Madrid.Silencioso,has 2 bathrooms,2 rooms, equipped kitchen,large living room, fiber optic WIFI, sheets, towels,hairdryer, bathroom products
neighborhood_overview:
The historic neighborhood of Malasaña together with the adjacent neighborhood of Chueca represent the most important neighborhoods of the Madrid movement. Here are concentrated the cult bars in the 70s-80s creating the alternative and lively atmosphere that give authenticity to this beautiful and characteristic area of Madrid. You can reach all the rest of downtown Madrid in a maximum of 20 minutes on foot.

The most interesting tourist sites: Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real, Teatro de la Opera, Jardines de Oriente, Puerta de Alcalá, Retiro Park, Plaza de la Cibeles, Prado Museum (where you can admire many works by Velazquez and Goya, among others), Reina Sofia Museum (where you can admire Picasso's famous "Guernica" painting, among other works ), Thyssen Bornemisza Museum (where you can admire ancient and modern paintings) ...

.. and if you are tired and don't feel like walking anymore don't worry .. metro lines and bus stop very close will take you dire

Debido a la Nueva Normativa del Ayuntamiento de Madrid no podemos alquilar con fines Turísticos, solo podemos alquilar aquellas personas que vengan a Madrid por temas de Trabajo, Estudios, Asuntos Médicos... Con toda la pena que nos enfrentamos lamentablemente es así, una lástima.

description: The house is about 100 m and has a large living room, master bedroom, another bedroom with two beds and another room with a double sofa bed that communicates with a large and modern kitchen, where another or two other people can sleep
neighborhood_overview: It is a very nice neighborhood, quiet, safe day and night and very well connected to any point of the city, both by metro, bus or car. It is full of bars, restaurants to tapas or eat very well, as well as supermarkets and places to have a drink, cinemas, gym, pool close to the house, etc.
host_about: Mi nombre es Carmen y soy una apasionada de viajar y conocer gentes y ciudades de todo el mundo, cosa que he hecho gracias a mi trabajo como Organizadora de Eventos. Actualmente soy Coach terapeuta emocional especializada en "autoestima e imagen interior y exterior".  Me encanta la decoración y la moda como aficiones. La casa que alquilo es muy acogedora y elegante y un remanso de paz en el centro de Madrid. Me encargo personalmente de ella por lo que yo os daría la bienvenida y os orientaría y explicaría los sitios donde ir en la ciudad y alrededores, ya que nací en Madrid y lo conozco muy bien. Además os  daré trucos y sitios de gran interés pero menos turísticos, dependiendo de vuestros gustos y aficiones, donde podréis ir, ya que yo como viajera del mundo, sé que a veces lo menos turístico es lo que más gusta! También puedo daros servicio de guía turística y acompañante a ciudades cercanas. Estaré encantada de daros la bienvenida en mi casa, donde os encontrareis como en la vuestra.. Hasta pronto!!!

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in one of the most famous and important streets in all of Madrid, Calle Mayor, located in the center. It is a few meters from the famous Plaza Mayor, where you can enjoy numerous bars, restaurants and terraces. In addition, at Christmas you can visit the Christmas market in the Plaza Mayor.

Thanks to this central location, it is possible to walk to the most emblematic sites of Madrid such as El Palacio Real, La Catedral de la Almudena, Puerta del Sol, Gran Via or the Sabatini Gardens.

But in addition, you will be surrounded by numerous corners with a lot of charm. I invite you to visit the restaurant El Botín, the oldest restaurant in the world, just a 4-minute walk from the apartment. Another place with a lot of charm is the Sabatini terrace, with beautiful views of the Royal Palace and its gardens, open in the summer months. neighborhood_overview:
L'Appartement is located where modernity and tradition meet in Malasaña, the most fashionable district of Europe, "the new Soho" located in Madrid. Theaters, bars, vintage stores, supermarkets, bookstores, clothing stores, department stores, terraces, art galleries and restaurants centuries as part of the offer of this neighborhood that never sleeps. Landmarks of Madrid, such as Plaza de Callao, the Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, the Palacio de Oriente Madrid de los Austrias, as well as museums and Markets Fashion (San Anton, San Miguel and Platea) will be also easy access with a short walk, and an extensive network of public transport metro and bus, you can reach in few minutes to the main museums and attractions in the city.
Malasaña is the area between San Bernardo Street west, south Gran Vía, Fuencarral street east and north of Carranza. You cross the street and go into San Bernardo Conde Duque area, ending at the Plaza of Spain and Princess Street.
host_about:
Hechizada con Madrid! Soy una persona que disfruta cada rincon de todo lugar nuevo que visito, encantada en conocer personas de diferentes culturas en esta Ciudad que brilla por si misma y brindarles mi casa para que se sientan como en la suya!

name: The coziest attic on Madrid's heart
description:
Your bedroom have a comfortable double bed, table and chair suitable for working, big built-in wardrobe and personal scale (convenient for weighting the luggage before taking your plane).

It is connected to the balcony, so the views are awesome!
neighborhood_overview:
Our attic is located on Malasaña, a central neighbourhood of Madrid, surrounded by several metro stations.

Malasaña was the center of the movida movement in late 1970s and 1980s Madrid. It
is a vibrant neighborhood and a center for the 'hipster' phenomena, full of lively bars and clubs overflowing with young people.

It's one of the classic areas for partying the night away, but still our street is really calm, so you will have no problems during the night. The night life is diverse in our neighbourhood, though the most common themes are non-pretentious style places, mixed places and colourful or bohemian cafes.

Commercially, it has many fashion boutiques as well as shops for design and nice market products, which rarely mainstream. There are many second-hand vintage shops, used book stores and unique gift shops.
host_about: I am a student from Spain, but I like moving around so during my degree studies I have been living in Warsaw, City of Mexico and next is Rio! So, you can see that I love traveling and meeting new interesting peple, and I hope that using Airbnb helps me on that! :)

I suggest you enjoy downtown Madrid and rest at the foot of the mountains.

name: Inviting Flat @ Madrid's Heart
description: Inviting and renovated flat in the very heart of Madrid (Santa Ana & J. Benavente Squares). Close to all the relevant and fascinating Madrid spots. An exceptional place to get the most of Madrid.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is one of the most charming of Madrid and it´s surrounded by the most authentic Spain´s Capital tradition. The Plaza Mayor, Plaza de la Villa, Puerta del Sol, Gran Vía and the Royal Palace will surely captivate you upon your first walks in the city.
The flat borders with the lively 'La Latina' quarter, the undisputed epicenter of Madrid Tapas, a great option to feel the Spanish 'joie de vivre' and share a beer (or two) with friends and locals. Want to taste the most trendy tapas in a unique place? If so, visit the 'Mercado de San Miguel', a MUST EXPERIENCE.
Another way to enjoy Madrid cuisine and its atmosphere is having walks in the nearby 'Las Letras' quarter (within only 3 min. from the apartment). There you´ll find out why Madrid terraces are so popular all over the world (specially in Spring and Summer).



Did you know Madrid has its own London Soho version? 'Chueca' is probably the most COLOURFUL quarter of the city, plenty of styl
host_about:
Contact me and I will be happy to give you all the information you need. If you want to know more about me, read the reviews of my guests!

Contácteme y estaré encantada de darte toda la información que necesitas. Si quieres saber más sobre mi, lee los comentarios de mis huéspedes!

name: Agradable Apto en Barrio Salamanca
description: Nice  apartment of 40 square meters in the Salamanca neighborhood for 2 people. Comfortable, fully equipped (washing machine, refrigerator, microwave, TV, internet). Close to everything you need for your stay in Madrid.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on one of the best sites in Madrid. El Barrio Salamanca. Arborized, quiet, and surrounded by supermarkets, bars, and restaurants. Just a couple of streets away you can enjoy the wonderful terraces of the boulevard of Juan Bravo and Diego de León. Nearby are the exclusive Calles Serrano, Velásquez and Paseo de la Castellana. Also one of the most beautiful and pleasant streets of the city  José Ortega y Gasset  that brings together  the most  exclusive stores: Felipe Varela, Hugo Boss, Channel, Armani, Dior, Dolce & Gabana, Escada, Hermes, Agata Ruiz de la Prada, among others. Just a 10-minute walk away you will find the monumental Plaza de Toros de las Ventas and 5 minutes from the Corte Inglés de Goya stores.
host_about: Hola soy Luz,  Colombiana de nacimiento y Española de adopción. Administradora Hotelera de profesión y vinculada al área administrativa y comercial durante los 16 años que llevo viviendo en Madrid. Enamorada eterna de Madrid, de la lectura, de la naturaleza y de los paseos al parque de El Retiro que está a pocos minutos de mi casa. Me encanta el Blues y el Jazz y de vez en cuando me pego mis escapadas a conciertos.He viajado por algunas ciudades europeas y la que me ha impactado profundamente ha sido Venecia tal vez por el vínculo emotivo que tengo con la edad media y por eso mismo en mis mas inmediatos sueños está conocer Florencia. Una de mis metas personales es hablar inglés fluidamente, por lo pronto solo lo leo y lo escribo. Me gustaría conocer y compartir experiencias con personas de todo el mundo. Bienvenidos a mi casa.

name: Beautiful & Comfortable Apartment Gran Vía | A060
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home. We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

name: Bedroom in Retiro Park
description: Private bedroom in Retiro Park, with wifi access, elevator, renewed bathroom...
neighborhood_overview:
The retreat neighborhood is characterized by its residential and commercial character. The Retirement Park is its central lung. Atocha, Méndez Álvaro and Avenida de América train and bus stations are just a few stops away by public transport. In the neighborhood there are many shops, tapas bars, bars for drinks, restaurants. A five-minute walk away is the Goya shopping area and the Exclusive Barrio de Salamanca. On the same street as the apartment there are three supermarkets and the Ibiza market. Ibiza, Goya, and Sáinz tube lines are close by, and many public bus lines.
To go downtown, you can also walk through the walking retreat (15-20min).
There is a very large gym in the building.

description:
Temporary rental, ideal for students, workers or displaced persons over 30 days.

1 large room and interior; very quiet, high ceilings , very cozy atmosphere, ceiling fan
Spacious bathroom, en suite.

1 small room with single bed.

Living room dining/kitchen and sofa bed

neighborhood_overview:
It is a restricted access neighborhood for circulation, so it is necessary to request a permit to enter. If you come by car, please tell me and tell me your license plate number so I can apply for permission. We are not responsible for fines.
It's a bohemian, crowded neighborhood with wonderful creative potential.
It has a great spirit of solidarity and there is no lack of entertainment with a lot of imagination.
It has a very important cultural weight in Madrid life both for all the events of classical theater and for a huge variety of alternative theaters.
Wine tastings, bike rides, guided tours…
It is the Madrid neighborhood of Lavapies, very famous for its great cultural activity. It is a neighborhood with a very diverse population which makes it very interesting.
Europe's "art street" is located here, hat¡and a multitude of galleries and exhibition halls. Charming restaurants and genuine markets.

English:
It is a bohemian quarter full

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is between the neighborhoods Malasaña, Chueca y Gran Vía,

CHUECA: is a square sited in a central neighbourhood in Madrid named Justicia. It lies just to the north of the old city, with its metro station "Chueca." is very lively, with many street cafes and boutique shops.

MALASAÑA is surrounded by several metro stations and is a central neighbourhood of Madrid.
it was the center of the movida movement in late 1970s and 1980s Madrid.
Night life venues in the area include La Vía Láctea, Penta, Diplodocus, Nueva Visión, La Vaca Austera, and El Barco. Templo de Susu is a high-end retro clothing shop. Very bohemian cafes include Pepe Botella, La Paca, La Ida and Lolina Vintage Café. An American book shop and bar (J & J's Books and Coffee) sits on Calle Espíritu Santo near the Noviciado metro station.

It is unclear if Malasaña will maintain its alternative and hip atmosphere or if it will become more commercial and upmarket. In November

description:
Charming flat next to the Retiro, bright and modern, with private terrace. Its spacious living room with high ceilings provides a cosy atmosphere. It is located next to Atocha-Renfe station. Ideal for 2 people, with a bedroom with a double bed and a bathroom. This urban retreat combines privileged location, contemporary design and serenity, providing a unique experience in Madrid.

Read more below :)
neighborhood_overview:
Hidden behind the buildings of the main avenue is this small neighborhood, which is like a small town of low houses in the heart of Madrid where the neighbors know each other, greet and like to stop and chat, but 50 meters away is the avenue where you can find everything you need in a big city (supermarkets, pharmacies, transportation, restaurants... ) something unique!
It's great to be able to walk the retreat, especially in autumn, and in summer it's a luxury to sit on a bench or on the grass and enjoy the shade of centuries-old trees.
We love to go to the theater or have a drink in the center walking, and if at the time of returning we are exhausted, the taxi never costs more than 6 euros!

name: Lovely doble room (bathroom and air conditioner)
description:
A very comfortable double room with private bathroom and airconditioner for a lovely stay in Madrid downtown.
Our apartment is located in Malasaña quarter, one of the coolest districts in Madrid. Beautiful, charm, comfortable, chic, excellent room in the boho heart of the city. You are welcome.
neighborhood_overview:
The inner-city barrio of Malasaña is where Madrid gets up close and personal. Here, it’s more an experience of life as it's lived by madrileños (people from Madrid) than the traditional traveller experience of ticking off from a list of wonderful, if more static, attractions. This is a barrio with attitude and personality, a barrio where Madrid's famed nightlife, shopping and eating choices live and breathe and take you under the skin of the city.
This barrio with Chueca is well known as one of the boho quarters in Madrid. You will find nice little shops, bars, restaurants and also art galleries and gorgeous night life.
host_about: Comisariado independiente en el sector de las artes escénicas.  Me gusta viajar y recibir personas en casa. Mis experiencias como anfitriona han sido muy positivas. La frase que define mi forma de ver la vida es: "disfruto aprendiendo de las personas y las situaciones"

name: MADRID WITH NO NOISE
description: It is a cosy and luminous apartment in the best area of the historical centre, just five minutes away from Palacio Real. It is a very quiet street but it is 80 metters away from de well known area of restaurants and bars La Latina.
neighborhood_overview: Even though the place is located just one step away from the best zone of restaurants and leisure in the city, our street is very quiet, has not commercial promises nor any noisy activities. It has not crossing traffic, just parking access. It is a non-exit street. The Palacio quarter is a plateau that oversees a green area, therefore the air is fresher and cleaner than any other area in the city center. You can walk to the main touristic places of the city (Royal Palace, Opera House, Reina Sofía Museum, Prado Museum, Matadero, Casa Encendida, Madrid Río, Puerta del Sol, Gran Vía....)

Un saludo cordial, Luis

name: Apart T Gran Via-Palacio Real, fully equipped!
description: Designer apartment in the middle of Madrid's downtown city center.
neighborhood_overview:
Forget about public transport.

Less than five minutes away you can visit the monumental Madrid de los Austrias with the Royal Palace, the Almudena Cathedral, or the Madrid Opera House. Walking a little more, you can enjoy the Rastro market and the most castle Madrid with the Plaza Mayor and the mythical Puerta del Sol.

Crossing the Gran Vía, full of cinemas and musicals, you immediately find the neighborhoods of Malasaña and Chueca, known as the gay neighborhood, full of fashion shops, terraces, cafes and restaurants.

And in a pleasant walk of less than ten minutes, through the peculiar neighborhood of Las Letras, you will arrive directly at the Prado Museum and the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum.
Anyway, if you want to go a little further, two steps away is Plaza de España that communicates directly with all the other neighborhoods of Madrid and its vicinity.
host_about:
Hola viajeros!
Soy una diseñadora afincada en Madrid que me encanta viajar,conocer gente,perderme por las ciudades, amante de otras culturas.
Aficionada al arte, la música, la gastronomía y a las ciudades vivas como Madrid.
Estaré encantada de recibiros en The Apartments y Casa Prudencia, un sueño para cualquier viajero cosmopolita, tan acogedor como tu propia casa y completamente equipados.
The Apartments y Casa Prudencia son sitios ideales donde me gustaría alojarme en uno de mis viajes a cualquier ciudad con una ubicación excepcional.

name: Bonito ático muy luminoso Aravaca.
description: Our beautiful penthouse is located in Aravaca/Pozuelo. Private development,with pool, gym,sauna, garage, 24-hour surveillance. 10 minutes from downtown Madrid by bus/car/train (first stop Príncipe Pio). Free WiFi. Views. Tranquility but just minutes from Plaza Mayor/ Puerta del Sol. We speak English.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very comfortable to live in, it has a supercor open every day of the year from 9 in the morning to 10 at night.
The commuter train is in front of the house and in 5 minutes you are at the Príncipe Pío station where you connect to the Metros network in Madrid.
It has many bars and places to drink beers and rations, just like eating or dining.
host_about: Soy profesora jubilada de un colegio público de Las Rozas. Tengo dos hijos mayores. Vivo ahora en otra casa cercana  y viajo mucho así que me gustaría alquilar el ático y las habitaciones a personas responsables que lo supieran cuidar bien porque lo tengo a todo detalle :)

name: Vivienda 2 dormitorios y 6 plazas en Centro Madrid
description:
SEASONAL RENTALS.

2 bedrooms with double bed. Living room with double sofa bed Includes bed linen and towels. Equipped kitchen. Third floor no elevator. Crib at no additional charge. Air conditioning. Quiet street next to Plaza de Lavapiés. Puerta del sol a 10-minute walk. Atocha station a 5-minute walk away. 2 minutes away metro or bus. For check-in after 10 pm, an extra €25 will be paid and no check-in after 12:00 am
neighborhood_overview:
You're staying at the trendy neighborhood in Madrid. Multicultural neighborhood, very dynamic and with a lot of life. It is located 10 minutes walk from the Puerta del Sol.

Located next to the Plaza de Lavapiés, in a quiet street that allows you to rest after a day visiting the city, and very well connected with metro and buses in the Plaza.

Building configured around the typical corrala with its wooden structures. In the surroundings we find terraces where you can have a drink, quality restaurants and fast food and supermarkets. Large multi-ethnic offer in restaurants and tapas bars, which is complemented by the gastronomic offer in the surroundings of the Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. House located in a bohemian neighborhood, with a lot of atmosphere during the day and night, and with a great cultural and artistic activity.

There are independent theaters, Valle-Inclán Theater, Casa Encendida, Circus Price Theater and bars that offer exhibitions and

name: Beautiful, bohemian large apartment in La Latina!
description: Gorgeous, stylishly decorated one-bedroom apt in heart of famous La Latina neighborhood! Fully-equipped kitchen, large dining and living room, bath, beautiful balcony. Only 1 flight walk up. Steps away from the Metro and close to Atocha Train that will you all over Europe. 10 minutes walk to Palacio Real, Playa Mayor, and the best nightlife Madrid has to offer - Tapas restaurants, Cava Baja St., theaters and bars. And the best part, you have the place all for yourself.
neighborhood_overview:
The best area of Madrid, bars, theaters, restaurants, Cebada market 2 streets away. Plaza Mayor 2 streets away.
El Rastro, the most important flea market in Madrid 5m walking.
Easy access from Barajas, via Metro or Bus to Atocha or Cibeles.

name: Private doble bed room in Chamberí
description: Bedroom with double bed in Chamberí on quiet street.
neighborhood_overview: Cinemas (Verdi) and theatres  (Canal) very close and an animated square (plaza de Olavide) where you can have beer and tapas.
host_about:
Alojo en mi casa, por lo que vas a tener que compartir conmigo las zonas comunes. Solo hay un baño en la casa, pero no lo necesito antes de las 12 del mediodía, excepto algún sábado que me toca trabajar, porque suelo levantarme tarde.
Soy una persona nocturna, lo cual no quiere decir que sea un juerguista, sino que aprovecho bastante bastante el tiempo de ocio después del trabajo, así que puede ser que llegue a casa después de medianoche, del cine o de un concierto y encienda la televisión o me ponga a trabajar en el cuarto del ordenador hasta las tantas de la mañana. Si perteneces a esa clase de persona que se va a la cama antes de medianoche, yo no te recomendaría que me pidieras alojamiento, salvo que no te moleste el ruido moderado.

name: Habitación individual en Chamberí
description: Single room with very comfortable bed and window to quiet patio not very bright (the patio in the photo overlooks other rooms, but you can access it and use it as a smoking area).  There is also access to kitchen and dining area.
neighborhood_overview: Just around the corner, you have the Cines Verdi and the theatres of the Canal. Down the street you can quickly reach the square of Olavide, the liveliest in the Chamberí neighborhood, where you can tap and have a few beers. There are also bars open next door until 3 in the morning and several "low cost" tapas shops on the way home, on Bravo Murillo street (100 Montaditos, Tapeando, Lizarran...)

name: Spacious apartment at "SOL"
description: The apartment located in a restored old building in the center of Madrid presents a design inspired by a retro-vintage style with modern touches; completely renovated with up-to-date and welcoming environments.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is one of the most charming of Madrid and is surrounded by the most authentic tradition of the capital. The Plaza Mayor, Plaza de la Villa, Puerta del Sol, Gran Via, the Almudena Cathedral and the Royal Palace, are elements that are sure to captivate your heart on your first walks around the apartment.

The apartment adjoins the La Latina district, the heart of the best tapas bars to share taking a beer or two ...and a very friendly atmosphere. I recommend you visit the cosmopolitan "Mercado de San Miguel", one of the undisputed references to the new trend of gourmet tapas - A must!

Another way to enjoy the cuisine and the authentic atmosphere of Madrid is walking in the nearby neighborhood of "Las Letras" (just 3 minutes’ walk), there you will discover why the terraces of Madrid are so famous in the world (especially in spring and summer).

Did you know that Madrid has its own version of Soho Londoner? Yes, it is "Chueca" a neighborhood
host_about:
Contact me and I will be happy to give you all the information you need. If you want to know more about me, read the reviews of my guests!

Contácteme y estaré encantada de darte toda la información que necesitas. Si quieres saber más sobre mi, lee los comentarios de mis huéspedes!

Soñadora, creativa, diseñadora, mama, empresaria, mexicana de nacimiento y española de sangre. Me encanta mi ciudad! la comida, la arquitectura, sus calles, su gente...el sol!.

name: Modern and bright 55m2 studio ideal for 2
description: This one bedroom, 1 bathroom and open plan living area is ideal for a couple or if you are comming to work to Madrid.  The property has great Wifi, smart TV and a Netflix account.
host_about:
Our small agency was created by two people: Karin Wallis, half English and half Swedish has lived most of her life in Madrid and Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano down to the marrow, has lived in Seville all of his life. We created the agency as we wish to do something different: take peoples charming homes and transform them into rentals, keeping the magic and charm the owners created when they built their home but at the same time making it comfortable and adequate for our clients such as  giving them plenty of empty cupboard space,  ensuring the only food in the fridge is the one of our welcome hamper and making sure everything is working correctly and is sparkling clean so that when you arrive, the property will feel like instant home to you too. There are no two properties alike, nor are there two guest exactly alike but we do trust we will have the right home for you.

Nuestra pequeña agncia fué creada por Karin Wallis, mitad inglesa y mitad sueca ha vivido casi toda su vida en Madrid y Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano hasta la médula, ha vivido en Sevilla toda su vida. Creamos esta empresa dado que queríamos hacer algo diferente: transformar la acogedora casa de un propietario a una propiedad para alquilar manteniendo la magia y el encanto que los propietarios metieron en ella pero a su vez adecuándola para que sea cómodo para nuestros clientes. No hay dos propiedades  iguales, ni hay dos clientes exactamente iguales pero confiamos en tener una casa de su agrado.

neighborhood_overview:
Calle de Espoz y Mina is an urban street in Madrid, in the district of Sol, located between Puerta del Sol and Plaza del Ángel, facing south-north.1 It is dedicated to Francisco Espoz y Mina, a guerrilla fighter and military leader of the Spanish War of Independence.
Of the six neighbourhoods that make up the Centro district, Sol is the one that occupies the central position. Next to it are the Palacio, Universidad, Justicia, Cortes and Embajadores. In its tourist version, it is surrounded by Madrid de los Austrias, La Latina, Lavapiés, Letras, Paseo del Arte, Salesas, Chueca, Malasaña, Conde Duque and Princesa.
In this area, which some call Sol-Gran Vía, we find many of the city's main attractions. Some of them are inside Puerta del Sol itself, others in its vicinity. Its shopping areas are among the busiest, sometimes to the point of overcrowding.

name: Deluxe Loft By The Prado Museum
description: A beautiful, sunny and silent loft, located on a quiet semi-pedestrian street in the charming neighbourhood of Las Letras, walking distance to Prado.
host_about:
Hi!!

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer (during 2017 I became mum, so I won't be doing check in's for a while). However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 25 years now and enrolled in a new adventure in spring 2017: becoming a mum. Life had still not so pleasant surprises and in september 2021 she was diagnosed a breast cancer and is still in treatment. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board, a lot since 2012 we must say, and each of them have left their impromt in our company. Now the team is composed by Mica, an Argentinian girl now based in Madrid for a few years, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Mica is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Julia, who joined us in in February 2023. Julia is Mica's friend, also Argentine and has a super cool and fun vibe.

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens, spending time with friends, our dogs and Vanessa's daughter (the only mother of the team!). We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 

We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Osca, Vanessa, Mica and Julia
Nuba Gestión de Apartamentos, S.L.

Mapfre foundation, Museum of Romanticism, Longoria Palace, COAM cultural Foundation...

You'll love it as we do!

host_about:
Airbnb es para mi la plataforma perfecta para viajar en su sentido mas amplio, descubrir como las gentes de otras culturas y paises decoran sus propias casas, tambien  la mejor manera o una de ellas para tener la oportunidad de socializar con las gentes de  esos lugares. Como host, tanto como puedo me gusta estar presente e implicarme en la experiencia de mis guest, si la oportunidad lo requiere y el tiempo me lo permite compartire al maximo la experiencia con mis invitados! 

Airbnb is the perfect platform for me to travel in the broadest sense, discover how people of other cultures and countries decorate their houses, also the best or one of them to have the opportunity to socialize with the people of those places. As host, much as I can I like to be present and to engage in the experience of my guest if required opportunity and time permits I will share the moments with you!
