neighborhood_overview: Palos de Moguer (Palos de la frontera) is a neighborhood characterized by having a wide range of bars, restaurants, shops, banks, and supermarkets. It is close to the center of the capital and, therefore, to all Madrid tourist attractions, especially to the area of ​​museums such as Reina Sofia, Madrid Río, or the Matadero. The Museum of the Military Pharmacy Collection and the Railway Museum of Madrid are also located in the neighborhood.
host_about:
Iris Nava (México, D. F. 1972)

Vivo y trabajó en Madrid.
Estudié Ciencias de la Cultura en la Universidad del Claustro de Sor Juana. Teatro en el Centro Universitario de Teatro de la Universidad Autónoma de México, y Sociología en la Universidad Nacional de México.
 Hé tomado cursos de danza y artes escénicas desde 1984 y cursos de performance, gestión cultural y turismo.
Soy hace 20 años gestora cultural he trabajado en la Embajada de México en España como coordinadora de Coordinadora de Humanidades y Eventos Especiales.  En Grupo INK  (Trestintas) Madrid como Coordinadora de Producción Interna.
He trabajado en diversas areas dentro del Museo Universitario del Chopo, México, D. F. y he formado parte del Comité Organizador del Festival Internacional Cervantino México, D.F. /Guanajuato, como Asistente de la Subdirección de Artes Plásticas y Actividades Académicas, también he realizado labores de coordinación en el Centro Nacional de las artes en Extensión académica bajo Jefatura de Teatro, Cine, Vídeo, Historia y Critica de las Artes. México, D. F.  Continuo haciendo labores de gestión cultural para museos como el Centro de Arte Dos de Mayo.  
Hago deporte, entre otros orientación, yoga algo de ciclismo, natación y cuando puedo surf, esquí 
Soy una voraz consumidora de cultura y una persona social.

• Lavapiés, is a central and traditional neighborhood of the oldest in Madrid.
• Located between the Glorieta de Embajadores and the Lavapiés and Tirso de Molina squares.
• It is very close to the neighborhoods of Latina, Las Letras, Los Austrias and Chueca.
• One of its main characteristics is its cultural diversity. People from different nationalities, ethnicities and cultures live together, which makes it a unique neighborhood where many cultural activities take place.
• There are a variety of bars and restaurants with typical national and international dishes, which deserve to be tasted.
• Next to the Lavapiés and Tirso de Molina Metro stations, just one station from the central and emblematic Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor.

name: Newly Renovated Penthouse with Private Terrace
description:
The apartment has a spectacular PRIVATE rooftop where you can relax and enjoy in the heart of downtown Madrid. This unique apartment is located on a downtown, but it’s a quiet apartment, which is what makes it unique a haven of peace in the heart of Madrid.
It is strategically located with a two-minute walk from the Gran Vía, between the Sol and Sevilla metro stops. Enjoy it!
neighborhood_overview:
This unique apartment is located on a downtown, but it’s a quiet apartment, which is what makes it unique—a haven of peace in the heart of Madrid.
You’ll be able to relax after long days of tourism through the city in the apartment’s comfortable living room.
If you’re one who prefers to enjoy the city life, you are steps away from the best spots for entertainment in Madrid.
It is strategically located with a two-minute walk from the Gran Vía, between the Sol and Sevilla metro stops. If you prefer to explore the history and charm of downtown, you won’t need to use public transportation. You can walk to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, and the famous Mercado San Miguel to please your palate with traditional Spanish tapas.
We want you to experience yourself the charm of the apartment. We’re sure that you won’t want to leave.
in the city center of Madrid, at Barrio de las letras.

name: Piso de temporada en Chueca
description: Fully equipped apartment available for mid- to long-term stays due to work, health, or study purposes . A seasonal rental contract is required, and the security deposit will vary depending on the length of stay. Feel free to contact us for more information!
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is located just between two of Madrid's coolest neighborhoods, Malasaña and Chueca.

Respectable and unruly at the same time, Malasaña is an historic neighborhood with a unique character and a provocative past. Locals fought and lost against French troops in 1808,Spainfound its modern Renaissance in the rebellious rock of the 70s and 80s, and still today the streets manage a well-worn charm. By day you see children playing in the squares and a thriving local community living out its life, but by night, people come from all overMadridto eat, drink and rock on in Malasaña’s alternative bars and cafes.

See & Do
A proud neighborhood full of life and history, Malasaña’s biggest attractions are its squares, like the Plaza del Dos de Mayo (the heart of the neighborhood) and its architecture, best exemplified in the old institutional buildings scattered throughout the area or the Conde Duque Barracks, now a large cultural center.
Eat
The Malasa

neighborhood_overview:
This is a restricted traffic area : If you come by Spanish plate car , please, tell me the plate number and ask me to order a permission for you in the specific dates. We are not responsible of the fines.
It is a bohemian quarter full of people with a great creative potential.
It is a district with a spirit of solidarity and no shortage of entertainment with a lot of imagination .
It has an important role in Madrid life therefore all events classical theater as a huge variety of alternative theaters cultural weight .
Wine tastings, bike rides, guided tours …
It is the Madrid district of Lavapies , very famous for its great cultural activity. It's a neighborhood with a very diverse population which makes it very interesting.
"Street art " in Europe are here , hat¡y multitude of galleries and exhibition halls . Charming restaurants and genuine markets.
host_about:
Hola! 
Somos un equipo dedicado a alquilar nuestros apartamentos. Tanto Elisa como yo misma nos encargaremos de daros una cálida bienvenida
Estaremos en contacto cuando se vaya acercando la fecha de llegada y os facilitaremos los detalles del alojamiento para que todo vaya como rodado en vuestro Check-in y estancia. 
Para empezar, necesitaríamos una hora de llegada aproximada, un email y un teléfono de contacto, ya que no contamos con una recepción física y por ello uno de nosotros os recibirá en el apartamento a la hora estipulada. 
Cualquier duda estaremos encantados de atenderos. 
¡Hasta pronto!

Hi! 
We are a team who enjoys hosting people in our lovely apartments.
We will be in contact closer to your arrival day with all of the details you'll need for a smooth check in and a wonderful stay. 
In the meantime please let us know your estimated arrival time, your email and a phone number we can reach you on during your stay just in case, as we don't have any reception, one of us will meet you at the apartment at the agreed time. 
If there is anything else on your mind, please let us know and we’d love to assist! 
Kind Regards,

name: Private room in Chamartin with en-suite
description: A newly built family home situated in a peaceful historic colony with a beautiful garden and swimming pool. Very well situated, just a 5-7 minute walk to Plaza Castilla, Chamartin train station, shops, bars and restaurants. Bus or metro easily straight into the centre of Madrid in 20 minutes. The guest bedroom is very quiet with lots of light and private ensuite bathroom.
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the Chamartin neighbourhood. Chamartin is one of the 21 districts into which the city of Madrid is divided. Chamartin is the most residential and landscaped district of the central area (within the M-30) of Madrid.  Commercial areas are concentrated in some streets while there are others with few shops and therefore more residential. The whole District is well connected by public transport.
host_about:
Hi, I am Alix. I am English, but have been living in Madrid for over 20 years. I am lucky to have an amazing job supporting charities and non profits all over the world. My family and I love to travel. We especially enjoy being given inside tips and doing things that aren't in the guide books! We hope to be able to make your stay in Madrid truly memorable. 

We're a bilingual family fluent in English and Spanish.

description: Apartment with two double bedrooms in a building with elevator. Capacity for 4 people. Designed for students, workers and people who need a home in Madrid for a few months. neighborhood_overview:
It is a multicultural and bustling neighborhood, located 1.5 km from Atocha Station and 4 km from the Puerta del Sol.
Traditional municipal market next to the house.
Numerous shops, bars, restaurants, shopping mall with cinema in the surroundings make this area a very lively neighborhood at much more affordable prices than the city center.
5 minutes away is the stadium of Vallecas, belonging to the legendary football club of Rayo Vallecano.
Just a 15 minute walk we have the best views of the city with amazing sunsets, the mountains of the Sierra de Guadarrama in the background and the city at your feet, all a gift for the view little known to tourists.

name: Downtown Cozy Exterior Duplex Studio | A018
description:
The apartment is located in a prime location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, steps away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants, and all the city's tourist attractions.

At Apartamentos Day Madrid Apartment, we pay attention to every detail in our accommodations to make you feel at home.
We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

host_about:
Free soul.. I am outgoing,

 funny, sensitive, super optimistic, happy person :)


 .... I always  try to smile to life and see the good things!!

Bubbly vivacious outlook on life, honest, transparent, spontaneous,  authentic loyal, loving person, good friend.

My passionate energy and real love of life is contagious and encouraged.

Tender heart with great personal magnetism.

What else.....??? I define myself as a SPECIAL PERSON however we are all specials.

I am meticulous with cleaning and I like to have everything tidy. I can't live in a mess, not for me.

Also very careful and treat everything with respect and love, I like when it is reciprocal too.
Simply; do what you would like others do for you.

I Enjoy nature, love sailing, outdoors!!.....Adventurouswho loves travelling, enjoy life to the fullest , always finding new challenges and unexpected events.

I'm not ambicious, like to share what I have.

I also like sport, nature, animals,  eat healthy, creative work, I designer and make clothes as a hobby, read, learn about different cultures, life experience and being able to connect relate, have compassion...see more and understand more, keep growing on my sacred path....listen, feel peace and harmony around me.... laughing dancing... Living in my truth, being myself, let life be as it is and if something goes wrong.. .... nothing happens! ... everything is perfect! it is what it is!!

I was administrative/accountan working with lawyers and a few years ago I realized I did not want to have a box life without any sense to me... I left everything  I move on from comfort and security life,  jumped in the UNKNOWING and my life changed for better,  now I choose simplicity in everything,  is where the magic of life is. 
I do what inspires me, makes me happy and only what I like to do!

I'm very interested and involved in intentional community projects, workshops and volunteer work with animals protection and rescue.

No fears, no limitations!!
When fear ends, life begins.

name: Acogedor apartamento Deluxe
description: This cozy and central apartment, with a terrace, an equipped kitchen, a room, a sofa bed and excellent comfort, It can accommodate up to 4 people; located in a building of more than 100 years in an old Jewish neighborhood, 5 minutes from the Plaza Sol and next to a subway station.
neighborhood_overview:
Barrio Lavapies, its name comes from antiquity, where in its square there was a large source of water, because the old Jewish neighborhood was in the fact that Muslims must wash their feet before entering the temple.
Today it is a neighborhood with a large population of foreigners and due to this multiculturalism, events such as the Chinese New Year and Ramadan are very resonant. However, the popular party verbena of San Lorenzo is the most celebrated event in the lavapies neighborhood.
The neighborhood has endless bars and restaurants where the curry and spices of Hindu cuisine predominate. And if you like flea markets, every Sunday the lavapies neighborhood has the most chaste and great in Madrid: El Rastro, where you can get pieces that you may not see in other places.
host_about: Pastelero carismatico que le gusta descubrir nuevas culturas, nuevos rincones, su comida y costumbres. Amante de la naturaleza.

Located in Chamberi neighbourhood, in a quiet area of downtown Madrid, with many traditional shops, tapas' bars & theaters. Easy access to main tourist attractions by foot or underground (3/4 minutes’ walk).
neighborhood_overview: The Chamberi neighbourhood is one of the most typical and authentic areas of Madrid city center. There are plenty of places to do and see around and nice restaurants and tapas bars, traditional bakeries and even ecologic shops, a 24h open market. The municipal Chamberi grocery market is 5 min away, if you wish to visit a different place where locals go.  To go out, you will find the mythical Galileo Galilei club with live music or events every day, the Canal Theatres to watch Ballet, theatre, concerts. You will also find the Canal Golf course if you like golf, the park and sports club with an open space area where you can walk or exercise for free!. There is also the Moncloa area, Arguelles street with many shops and El Corte Ingles shoping mall, etc. The Faro de Madrid" tourist attractions to have a spectacular view of the city is only a few minutes from the apartment.  Templo de Debod, Gorgeous Rosales Park and Plaza de Espania are also a few minutes away. There are some main central

host_about:
Hola! 
Somos un equipo dedicado a alquilar nuestros apartamentos. Tanto Elisa como yo misma nos encargaremos de daros una cálida bienvenida
Estaremos en contacto cuando se vaya acercando la fecha de llegada y os facilitaremos los detalles del alojamiento para que todo vaya como rodado en vuestro Check-in y estancia. 
Para empezar, necesitaríamos una hora de llegada aproximada, un email y un teléfono de contacto, ya que no contamos con una recepción física y por ello uno de nosotros os recibirá en el apartamento a la hora estipulada. 
Cualquier duda estaremos encantados de atenderos. 
¡Hasta pronto!

Hi! 
We are a team who enjoys hosting people in our lovely apartments.
We will be in contact closer to your arrival day with all of the details you'll need for a smooth check in and a wonderful stay. 
In the meantime please let us know your estimated arrival time, your email and a phone number we can reach you on during your stay just in case, as we don't have any reception, one of us will meet you at the apartment at the agreed time. 
If there is anything else on your mind, please let us know and we’d love to assist! 
Kind Regards,

name: STUNNING  FLAT IN PUERTA DEL SOL
description:
Spacious for 2 people (cot offered), double bed, sofa bed, bathroom, kitchen, towels, sheets and dishes are available.

Our place is close to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Teatro Real, Palacio Real. You’ll love our place because of the location, the comfy bed, the space and the cosiness.

Enjoy the history, food and beauty of Madrid in a flat in the downtown. Metro/Bus stations and Sol Square 1 min walking!
host_about:
My sister Laurel, my friend Olgis and I started 4 years ago to share our places and experiences with people from all over the globe. 

My name is Raul, I am a Spanish traveller, I speak English and French, I work in Algeria on a rotational basis 4x4 weeks and I love cooking, training, playing football and going to the stadium. Laurel speaks English, she loves traveling, and she helps people to recover from injuries by using osteopathic techniques. Olgis currently teaches elementary school, she speaks English and loves travelling, visiting museums and diving!!

All of us have a great sense of hospitality, so all of you are welcome to discover Madrid, where you can enjoy visiting museums, monuments, football stadiums and eating tapas! 

AIRBNB has been a great platform for us and we are extremely grateful to the AirBnB community for giving us the opportunity to provide the best service and experice to our guests!


Mi Hermana Laurel, mi amiga Olgis y yo empezamos hace 4 años a compartir nuestros apartamentos y experiencias con gente de todo el mundo.

Me llamo Raúl y soy un viajero español que habla ingles y francés, trabajo en Argelia cada 4 semanas. Me encanta cocinar , entrenar, jugar al futbol e ir al estadio. Laurel habla ingles, le encanta viajar y ayuda a la gente a recuperarse de las lesiones a través de tratamientos osteopáticos. Olgis trabaja en un colegio, habla ingles y le encanta viajar, visitar museos y bucear!

Los tres tenemos un gran sentido de la hospitalidad, así que todos vosotros sois bienvenidos en Madrid, donde podéis disfrutar de monumentos, museos, estadios de futbol y de las tapas!

AIRBNB has sido una plataforma increíble para nosotros, y estamos muy agradecidos a la comunidad de Airbnb nos haya concedido la oportunidad de poder dar el mejor servicio y experiencia posible a nuestros huéspedes!

name: Stylish private room in artistic penthouse duplex
description:
Beautiful private room in a duplex loft JUST 20 MINUTES AWAY BY SUBWAY from tapas bars in Puerta del Sol, theaters at Gran via and Real Madrid Stadium.

Spend some days in a private, comfy room in a colorful and eclectic house. Slide open the glass doors up in the living room and enjoy the morning on a balcony (where smoking is allowed) surrounded by potted plants while making friends with the resident Maine Coon cat, Camilo.
neighborhood_overview:
Very calm and quiet neighborhood. You will find restaurants (genuine Spanish, Japanese, Italian, fast food...), supermarket, drugstore, 24/7 store and ATM a few steps away from the apartment's door.

Every Sunday there is a flea market 3 minutes away from home. Nice Sunday plan, uh?

Four times a year an independent design flea market takes place two subway stations away. A must if you are here in Madrid!
host_about:
Hi! My name is Alejandro, although everybody calls me Ale.

I'm from Algeciras (Southern Andalusia, Spain). You might have heard about it before because It is the world famous flamenco guitar player Paco de Lucía's birthplace so, of course, I am a big flamenco fan.

 I have been living in Madrid for more than 10 years where I do a bunch of different stuff but mainly I am a maritime broker and a photographer.

I am very interested in graphic design, interior design,  creativity and gastronomy.


¡Hola! Mi nombre es Alejandro, aunque todos me llaman Ale. Soy de Algeciras (Cádiz) pero llevo viviendo en Madrid, donde trabajo en el sector marítimo, desde hace 10 años.

name: Downtown Comfortable Apartment Gran Vía | A059
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home. We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

The Malasaña-Conde Duque neighborhood is one of the most central and popular neighborhood in the capital. It's a mix of characters, tourists, and lifelong neighbors.

The neighborhood is slowly pedestrianized and has a great cultural offer (museums, theaters, theaters, cinemas, exhibition halls, etc.).
In its charming little ones such as San Ildefonso, Juan Pujol, 2 de Mayo, or the Counters and the Corps Guards Glorieta in the Conde Duque neighborhood one can have a coffee or a cane and enjoy the temperature of Madrid.
There are also quite a number of interesting restaurants nearby.
Calle Pez, which is 2 minutes away, is also an attractive area with a neighborhood vibe, where one can find good bars, restaurants, cafes, shops and the Alfíl theater.

Malasaña is one of the classic areas of Madrid for nightlife.

name: Cozy & Quiet Duplex Apartment Gran Vía | A062
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home. We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

neighborhood_overview:
MADRID RIO is a new rehabilitated area where you can walk along the river and walk to Royal Palace, (Matadero Art center) The famous Toledo´s bridge is just 100 meters from the house. Walking distance to the famous flea market called El Rastro. Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol is just 10 minutes from the house.
MADRID RIO, is an area rehabilitated for a few years, where there are pedestrian areas along the river that go from Príncipe Pío, through Palacio Real and reaches the old slaughterhouse, now become the Center of all the Arts. The famous Manzanares Bridge as well as the pedestrian area is a 2-minute walk from the house. Ideal for walking or snacks. El Rastro, Plaza Mayor or Puerta del Sol is 10 minutes from home.

I also enjoy traveling and meeting all kind of different people. Music and art are  a main part of my life.  Madrid is a cultural city and there’s hundreds of things to do and enjoy.  Come and see for yourself.
Safe travels !!
Soy María y soy madrileña. Me gusta hacer sentir a mis huéspedes lo mejor posible y proveer toda la información para que disfruten de su estadía. name: Balcony Cozy Callao Sqb2bdr/lift AC
description: Fantastic 2 bedroom apartment in a building with lift for up to 4 people in a back quiet street of Callao Square and very close to Gran Via and Sol .
host_about:
Hi!!

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer (during 2017 I became mum, so I won't be doing check in's for a while). However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 25 years now and enrolled in a new adventure in spring 2017: becoming a mum. Life had still not so pleasant surprises and in september 2021 she was diagnosed a breast cancer and is still in treatment. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board, a lot since 2012 we must say, and each of them have left their impromt in our company. Now the team is composed by Mica, an Argentinian girl now based in Madrid for a few years, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Mica is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Julia, who joined us in in February 2023. Julia is Mica's friend, also Argentine and has a super cool and fun vibe.

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens, spending time with friends, our dogs and Vanessa's daughter (the only mother of the team!). We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 

We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Osca, Vanessa, Mica and Julia
Nuba Gestión de Apartamentos, S.L.

neighborhood_overview:
Despite not being the most touristic neighborhood, the neighborhood of Colonia Mazanares is loved by madrilenos and has a lot to offer to its visitors.
We have beautiful views of the Manzanres River and a very nice walk from just 7 min to the beginning of Madrid Rio.
It is also in our neighborhood the hermitage of San Antonio de la Florida, with frescoes by Goya and the famous Meson Casa Mingo.
If you like to walk in the countryside, we recommend the cable car ride that is 15 min walk and takes you to the Casa de Campo.

I speak several languages and enjoy meeting people from all over the world. It will be my pleasure to host you in Madrid.

host_about: I am 37. Was born in Winnipeg Canada, but I am portuguese. Have lived in Barcelona Spain for more than 10 years and for the last 5 have been living in Madrid. neighborhood_overview:
YOU HAVE TO TAKE PUBLIC TRANSPORT TO GO TO THE CENTER OF MADRID.

host_about:
Hablo español.
Falo português.
I'm learning English.
Capisco un po 'di italiano.

Soy Brasileña, residente en España, desde 2001 y vegetariana desde 2002. Tengo una simpática niña. 
Me gusta el deporte, practico capoeira, american crossfit, acrobacia.  Soy profesora de portugués y me divierte mi trabajo. 
Amante de la pedagogía Waldorf y todas sus ramificaciones. También me gusta conocer otras pedagogías y sistemas educativos. La historia, geografía, psicología, experiencias personales, son otras de mis pasiones 
Me encantan actividades al aire libre, estar con gente, charlar y escuchar sus historias, conocer algo de su cultura, probar platos nuevos etc. Pero también respeto el silencio, si es lo que prefieres.

name: Superb Apartment Center of the City
description: Superb and spacious apartment in the center of Madrid,  just 3 minutes away walking from Plaza Mayor, located next to all the great and must see sites and attractions of this wonderful city.
neighborhood_overview:
Nearly everything you have two see and enjoy in Madrid downtown is whitin a very short walking distance, Plaza Mayor, Sol, Opera, The Royal Palace, the shopping walking street of Preciados, the emblematic Gran Vía, the lovely San Miguel Market, and the Cava Alta and Cava Baja Streets which are full of life and you can try the delicious "spanish tapas".

On Sundays you can get to the colourful fleamarket of El Rastro, where you can find antiques, clothing and curiosities.
host_about: I'm from Madrid and I love the alternative, cultural and night life which this city offers. Although almost everybody knows where Madrid is located, I think it is a city which continues surprising its visitors.

¡Hola!

Arantxa

name: Genial apartamento en la Latina
description: Great apartment located in the historic, commercial and cultural center of Madrid, in the heart of Barrio de la Latina. Newly renovated, for 2 or 4 people, 5 minutes from Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol.
neighborhood_overview:
Due to its location, it is ideal to walk to the most emblematic places of the city: Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol and its lively shops, the popular Madrid Rastro on Sundays and holidays, the Royal Palace and Almudena Cathedral, Gran Vía and Chueca District. The Barrio de las Letras with clothing and antique shops and the well-known museums of El Prado, El Reina Sofia and Thyssen Bornemisza. La Latina is a very lively area, ideal to enjoy Spanish cuisine and its lively hour of aperitif and “Tapas” in the traditional bars and tavernas on the streets of Cava Baja, Cava Alta and plazas de La Cebada and La Paja. We'll leave you a map of the city with all kinds of suggestions, so you can have an unforgettable trip.
It is the ideal place to stay and enjoy Madrid as it is close enough to walk to the most remarkable sites: La Plaza Mayor, La Puerta del Sol, the famous El Rastro open- air street market on Sundays, El Palacio Real y La Catedral de la Almudena, El Barrio de las Letras with its
host_about: Soy una chica, española a la que le encanta su pais y viajar a otros lugares, motivo por el que conocí esta página que me llevó a comprarme este apartamento que he decorado con mucho entusiasmo (me encanta el mundo de la decoración). Vivo en una ciudad próxima a Madrid .(Ciudad Real), pero tengo un amigo que se encarga de recibiros si yo no puedo. Lo que más me gusta es disfrutar con los amigos, conocer sitios nuevos, pasear las ciudades, el arte, la fotografia, mi familia....Espero que disfruteis en mi casa como yo cuando estoy en ella.

name: Opera / Royal Palace apartment
description: Charming apartment in the historic center of Madrid. Its 100 m2 distribution makes it ideal for families and groups of up to 6 people. It has been renovated with special attention to quality and design.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the historic center of Madrid. A few minutes’ walk from the Royal Palace, the Opera, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, La Almudena Cathedral and San Miguel Market. Ideal for cultural visits, it is well connected with the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia museums.

You have great selection of restaurants, tapas bars, pubs and cafes in the surroundings and most of them have terraces.

The best shopping areas are also at a walking distance: Gran Via, Fuencarral, Callao, Barrio Salamanca, as well as the famous open-air street market called El Rastro (flea Market).

It is also close to the two biggest parks of the city: Casa de Campo and Retiro.

description:
We are going to México until Christmas time and we want to rent our beautiful home. It´s located at the beautiful and pedestrinalized Plaza de Santiago, two minutes away from the Royal Palace and its gardens and five minutes walk to Puerta del Sol.

Large and fully equiped kitchen and office.
Huge living room with four windows and a balcony and beautiful furnitures.
A full bathroom and a guest toilet.
Two bedrooms each with a balcony to
The large terrace

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located on Plaza de Santiago. Five minutes walk to Callao, five to Sol and two to the Royal Palace or Mercado de San Miguel or Plaza Mayor.
It belongs to Los Austrias, the most ancient part of Madrid and you are in the center of the other four interesting neigbourhods of Madrid: Malasaña, Chueca, Latina and Huertas. All of them within walking distance.
You have tons of nice restuarants and shops arround. I´ll send you a list of my favourite places and plans as soon as you book but you can always ask me if you have a particular interest.
host_about:
I´m Fernando, I´ve lived in Madrid most of my life, and I love my city.
I first airbnb during a long trip through the United States. As a guest I found it a great way to visit places. Much better than hotels. So when I came back I decided to rent my place. Its a house i designed for me and my wife . We bought it because it had tons of light, clear views and mainly the best location. Its in a quiet pedestrian street with many orange trees, but you are in the middle of everything and you can walk to all the places that we loved in Madrid. I hope you enjoy it as we did when we lived there.

We are surrounded by retail stores and a variety of food franchises, including Burger King, McDonald's, KFC, as well as Italian and Mexican restaurants. Culinary diversity is at your fingertips!

CONVENIENT SHOPPING: For your daily needs, we have supermarkets such as Mercadona and a Carrefour Express that is open 24 hours a day. You'll never want for anything during your stay.

INSTANT TRANSPORT: Metro station is only 100 steps away, allowing you to easily move around the city. In addition, just a 10-minute walk away, you'll find the Méndez Álvaro South Bus Station, connecting you to other cities in Spain.

name: Sunny and bright apartment
description:
3 bedroom Sunny and Bright apartment, in a charming cosmopolitan neighbourhood, full of life.
Many small shops and traditional indoor market.
Large parking space (off-street and securely gated area).
Excellent access to all Madrid:
Distance to Plaza España by bus 22 minutes, by car 13 minutes.
Distance to nearest metro station (Alto de Extremadura) walking 6 minutes.
Suitable for Temporary Accommodation (students and professionals)
neighborhood_overview:
This neighbourhood is buzzing with atmosphere. Traditionally, this was part of Madrid's leafy outskirts, where families lived a quiet routine, everyone knew each-other, with great access to the centre of Madrid in 10 - 15 minutes on public transporte. Today, the neighbourhood retains the family and friendly ambiance, with lots of small local shops for everything from bakeries, and fresh fruit shops to shoe shops, and toy-shops. Many immigrants who moved to Madrid to look for work, move here once they start to have children, so most of the public spaces are full of parks for kids, and colourful out-door vibe, with lots of nationalities and languages.

Inside secrets for locals: A couple of doors away, on the same road, you can find a wonderful old-fashioned "Roast House" that offers home made meals (Delicious roast chicken from a traditional farm), to order. The prices for they "take away" meals are really cheap (old fashioned prices for locals!) and the quality is home made,
host_about: I am a collector of antique embroideries. I was born in Madrid, and often travel for my passion. I rent my apartment in Madrid, for people who like to travel and chase after their passions.

description:

Spacious and pleasant penthouse in the historic center, within reach of the Paseo del Prado museums, and art galleries.
Fully equipped, quiet and full of light and very comfortable for 4 people.

neighborhood_overview: In the dynamic Calle Argumosa, with abundant gastronomic offerings, Spanish and international, which includes establishments with organic and vegan products, periodic tapas fairs and outdoor terraces. Around the corner on Calle Doctor Fourquet, there are 15 art galleries under the Reina Sofía Museum, making it a benchmark for modern and contemporary art in Spain. The best-known alternative theater halls are on the surrounding streets, as well as the Spanish Film Library and several film and theater schools. A neighborhood with a very dynamic and cultural atmosphere.

host_about:
Buenos días ,
Me llamo Vladimir y soy estudiante de Relaciones Internacionales , en mi tiempo libre me gusta viajar , ir a actividades culturales , aprender y disfrutar dela capital de España.
En la convivencia soy un chico responsable,ordenado y educado . Le doy gran importancia a la limpieza , no me suele gustar que entre compañeros no  exista relación , es decir soy partidario de fomentar actividades de ir a ( cenar , ver tv, salir  .. etc) .  Destacar que no me hace mucha gracia las mascotas , ya que en la ciudad el tiempo se pasa rápido y todas las mascotas exigen mucho tiempo .
Mis experiencias en el extranjero han sido fantásticas y me gustaría que mi futuro RoomMate viviera lo mismo en Madrid , porque es una ciudad para disfrutarla ! .

I live in Madrid since 10 years ago, and take up for visual and performing arts (music, set design, theatre, contemporary dance). The initial idea was to share this space with people with artistic interests although, after this time as a host, having the chance of knowing: travelers, dreamers, students, people of anywhere in the world, I have seen that no matter what you do or where you come from, only exists what moves you inside.

Vivo en Madrid desde hace 10 años. Me dedico al mundo de las artes  (música, escenografía, danza, teatro). La idea inicial fue compartir este espacio con personas con inquietudes artísticas aunque, después de este tiempo de anfitrión conociendo a: viajeros, soñadores, estudiantes, personas de cualquier lugar del mundo, he visto que no importa lo que hagas o de dónde vengas, sino lo que te mueve por dentro.

name: BOUTIQUE QUALITY. HOME WARMTH
description: CENTRAL. Clean and quiet  room with comfy double bed, closet and a/c. Next to it, private bathroom. The flat is bright and within walking distance or by metro to everything in Madrid. It has a leafy terrace with herbs and trees.
neighborhood_overview:
Moncloa/Arguelles is one the best kept secrets of Madrid. The district is one of the best in Central Madrid and is just 15 min walk to Plaza España. It´s a lively neighborhood with plenty of shops, bars, coffee shops, open-air terraces, restaurants, gourmet artisan stores, conventional and organic supermarkets. It´s the perfect place to live like a local.
3 min away from the apartment to the East is Calle Princesa a great shopping street with a big Zara and a Corte Ingles ( department store). 3 min to the West is the beautiful Parque de Oeste with its creek, pond, walking paths, tall trees, green grass and the Egyptian Temple of Debod, the best place in Madrid to watch the sunset. La Universidad Complutense is just 5 min away by Metro or bike.
host_about:
I´m an acupucturist and naturopathic practitioner (former photojournalist). I enjoy riding my bike, walking, a good chat, good food (though I´m vegetarian),  swimming and reading. I practice ashtanga yoga . I have lived in several countries and have travel widely for work and turism. Nowadays, I still very much enjoy traveling, but I focus on discovering the destination like a relax  local with plenty of time.
.

name: Charming central apartment, 2BR, for families - SM
description: Located in the heart of Madrid in the Austrias neighborhood, one of the most emblematic areas of the city, near Plaza Mayor and plaza Sol in the City Center of Madrid. San Miguel's market is an historic and touristic market  in the center of the city
neighborhood_overview: Located in the historical center it represents a great choice for anyone looking to spend time in the exciting and vibrant Spanish capital. This area includes the origins of Madrid through its narrow winding streets. It located in the heart of old Madrid, the area of greatest personality of the city and best commercial, cultural and leisure activities. You only have to go a little beyond Plaza Mayor to discover some of the great surprises Madrid offers, as the Mercado de San Miguel, a beautiful iron structure dating from 1913 and which houses an interesting Spanish cuisine where you can taste and buy high quality products. A few steps away is the “Arco de Cuchilleros”, a good place to drink good wine in his classic taverns or eat in typical Castillian mesons. The best known is La Casa Botin, founded in 1725, it still retains the old house and the original oven. Also a few minutes away you will find the Almudena Cathedral and the Royal Palace, the elegant Plaza de Oriente and the Opera
host_about: Venezuelan architect, italian, spanish and Argentinian descent, loves to eat and share the city secrets with everybody who visit Madrid.  In 2008 starts a small holiday lettings company to complement the architecture and interior design job.  I have created Flat Sweet Home and today we manage several apartments in Madrid city center, I love to host people traveling, my main purpose is to give a beautiful experience to  my guests providing high quality apartments and service, a warm interior design and perfect cleaning.  In Flat Sweet Home we love our work, we think it’s important that we can fulfill the wishes of our guests.

description: NO SELF CHECK IN, IMPERATIVE TO GIVE ARRIVAL TIMING. Beautiful and cozy old apartment in old style with balcony to Mayor square, beautiful views to the sunset, but quiet and spacious. AC in all the bedrooms and gas heating. WIFI and basic supplies (shower gel, toilet paper, towels, sugar and salt, etc)
neighborhood_overview:
The Plaza Mayor is one of the city's most important tourist sites, a must-see for every visitor.
In the commercial premises located under its arcades, there are many shops, excellent cafes and pleasant terraces where you can have an aperitif or some tasty tapas. Leaving the Plaza, you will find the lively San Miguel Market, where you can taste authentic delicacies at all hours.
In the neighborhood, there are many restaurants where you can taste the best Madrid cuisine and terraces that invite you to sit at any time of the day. Near Plaza Mayor is Plaza de Santa Ana, full of tapas bars and Plaza del Ángel with the famous Café Central, where you can listen to high-quality jazz live.
In the surroundings, you will find several art galleries, the Prado Museum, the Reina Sofía, the Caixa Fórum (with its beautiful vertical garden) and the Thyssen.
Nearby, there are clothing stores, food stores, a very large Corte Ingles center, tourist and souvenir shops (the Tourist Offi
host_about:
Como anfitrión profesional y gestor de propiedades en Airbnb, mi objetivo es brindar experiencias excepcionales a cada huésped. Con años de experiencia en Madrid, lidero un equipo comprometido con la hospitalidad, garantizando estancias cómodas y memorables. 

Nos especializamos en la gestión integral de alojamientos, combinando calidad, atención personalizada y el auténtico encanto de España. 

¡Bienvenidos a una experiencia única!

description: My comfortable apartment in central Madrid is on a fairly quiet street,  shopping & art museums are close. Good for couples, friends/small family and conveniently located for walking the city. Only 4 minute walk from two metro stations, easy walking to the galleries, markets, parks, and is in a diverse neighbourhood. Our apartment is recently refurbished, a quality mix of vintage & retro with everything you need for a cosy stay. The apartment has a fully functioning kitchen & Air-con.
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is situated in between Anton Martín and Lavapies, a trendy area thriving with alternative and innovative commerce alongside traditional establishments, including many diverse bars and restaurants which within walking distance. It is close to the 5 main art museums: Reina Sofia, Caixa Forum, Casa Encendida, Museo Thyssen and Museo del Prado.

Would you kindly ensure your profile is filled in with a photo, and you have verified your ID before placing a booking, thanks.

The flat is in a traditional part of the city, Lavapies is a very popular neighbourhood with a hip and modern vibe which sits in amongst the older buildings and rhythms of this ancient part of Madrid, each and every street holds a delight. Lavapies throbs with life, it is full of cafes, markets, restaurants, galleries, shops and the street life is famous in the city for it’s variety. It is also easy to escape into a quite square, terrace or roof top and just enjoy the restful warm air. It’s
host_about:
The apartment is comfortable, with a  lovely kitchen for cooking, a great balcony for air and sunshine and plenty of books and solid super fast WiFi. It is my home away from home when i can stay there, it can also be yours. 

I am happy to host people from all backgrounds, creeds and countries. I am Hetero,  LGB and Trans friendly and welcome anyone however they choose to.

name: Calle Mayor, bright and very central 1 bedroom, AC
description: Great one-bedroom one-bathroom apartment in the very center of Madrid , a few steps from the famous Plaza Mayor, and a two-minute walk from the metro station in Puerta del Sol. The apartment comes with Wi-Fi, TV, all modern appliances and a fully equipped open kitchen. Our team will be happy to help you with everything you need. The sofa-bed in the living room can accommodate two more guests.
neighborhood_overview: This great apartment is located on Calle Mayor, just a few steps from Plaza Mayor and very near the famous Puerta del Sol and Mercado de San Miguel. It is great for discovering the city on foot. There are lots of tapas bars and typical Spanish wine taverns near the apartment. The recently refurbished Mercado de San Miguel is a great place for foodies, who will find hundreds of delicious things in this market. Nearby is Calle de Preciados - a lively street which is great for shopping. Madrid's most central square, the Puerta del Sol, is only two minutes' walk away from the apartment. It is very lively: a meeting point for Madrid residents and tourists alike.
host_about:
I live in Madrid, a city that has captivated me from the start for its culture, history and beauty. I work as a full-time host for Aspasios and couldn’t think of a better job: at Aspasios we love to make our guests feel at home. A big part of our job is listening carefully to our visitors: we learn so much from them every day. We enjoy meeting each and every person who comes to stay with us, and want them to come back because of us. We pride ourselves on being professional and friendly at the same time. At Aspasios, we are passionate about hospitality.

My colleague Luis and I are always on hand to help you make the most of your trip to Madrid. We know this lovely city inside out, so can recommend plenty of restaurants, bars and activities that you might not find in the guide books!

Nos gusta conocer a todos y cada uno de los que vienen a quedarse con nosotros, y queremos ser la causa para que vuelvan. Nos enorgullecemos de ser amables y profesionales al mismo tiempo. name: Delightful Apt. Historic District-Sol
description: The apartment is disinfected according to the existing recommendations of the health authority. Bed linen and towels are washed according to the hygiene protocol (disinfectant + 70º celsius laundry + iron). All surfaces known as virus carriers, such as door handles, switches, kitchen utensils and all furniture, are disinfected with specific antivirus products. I provide a virus prevention set for every guest (disinfection wipes, antibacterial hygiene hand gel 30 ml, protective mask and gloves).
neighborhood_overview:
This historic district area (Sol/ Huertas/ La Latina) is perfect for exploring the Spanish capital:

•Most of Madrid amenities are within walking distance, museums; or the countless bars, flamenco tablaos, theatres or musicals.
•Thriving cultural life, art galleries and the main city museums (Prado , Reina Sofia, Thyssen) are a stones throw.
•The vicinity is renowned as well for its thrilling night life, its typical restaurants, tapas bars and terraces.

•Puerta del Sol > 200 m
•Plaza Mayor > 100 m
•Plaza Santa Ana > 150 m
•Mercado de San Miguel > 150 m
•Gran Vía > 400 m
•Prado Museum> 800 m
•Reina Sofía Museum > 700 m
•Thyssen Bornemisza Museum > 800 m
•Cibeles > 1,1 km
•Retiro Park > 1,2 km
•Almudena cathedral > 300 m
•Kings Palace > 350 m

The exclusive Chueca neighbourhood is also nearby where many bars are concentrated, and offers very chic boutiques, high level restaurants and charming
host_about: Greetings from Madrid! I've been a resident of this beautiful city for 21 years now and I still love the city. I am a young professional who likes to travel. I enjoy hanging with friends and eating out at restaurants! For all people who want to visit my lovely city, I offer him accommodation and personal attention. I love my city and I'm sure you too will like it, for its friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Do not hesitate to contact me. I'll be happy to help. See you soon!

name: Apartamento - El Mirador de Goya
description: Apartment for max 4 persons , 1 bedroom, sofa-bed ,kitchenette, bathroom with shower , furnished terrace, heating, air conditioning, Internet
neighborhood_overview: Fully equipped neighborhood, traditional market, 2 supermarkets ,shops,  metro , 10 bus lines. Next to Parque Río , with kilometers of green area to enjoy
host_about:
Soy una mujer emprendedora, llevo ya  desde el año 2007 alquilando el apartamento, estudié Turismo y guía de la ciudad de Madrid. Aparte creo que soy muy vital y urbana , con lo cual me muevo mucho por mi ciudad y cada día descubro lugares nuevos en los que perderme, y es que Madrid es una ciudad muy viva y alegre. En constante renovacion .
Mis múltiples aficiones son muy sencillas y comunes : cine , música, de jazz preferentemente (si puedo acudo a los conciertos de jazz en vivo en varios locales de Madrid ) Pasear por Malasaña , zona cool, por la Casa de Campo , hacer deporte , disfrutar de la magnífica cocina española, Reunirme con amigos , viajar de cuando en cuando...París , Londres , Nueva York, Budapest Etccc pueden ser de mis ciudades favoritas. También me gusta mucho la decoración y la jardinería, el chocolate negro y reírme mucho. Soy muy alegre. Mi estímulo en la vida es vivir y hacer felices a los que me rodean.

name: Pvt Bedroom in Shared Flat in Barrio Salamanca
description: Bedroom for 1 or 2 guests  in a quiet, sunny Two-Bedroom Flat.  Complete access to Elevator, Shower/Toilet, Kitchen, Refrigerator, and Wireless INTERNET. The Bedroom has a large window that opens to a central courtyard with lots of NATURAL LIGHT. All windows have SHUTTERS for privacy. My home was refurbished in 2013.  The GUEST ROOM measures 2,65m x 2,40m. The BED 1,35m x 1,90m.  NO AIR CONDITIONING but I do provide an oscillating fan.
neighborhood_overview: We are only 1 minute away from Plaza Marques de Salamanca with many choice restaurants nearby. If you prefer to shop, we are at the edge of Madrid's GOLDEN MILE - MILLA DE ORO.  Retiro Park is 1.2 Kms.  Palacio de Cibeles 2.2 Kms. Plaza CHUECA (Gay Hub) is 2.5 Kms.  SUN Gate 3 Kms Away.  Atocha Train Station 3.5 Kms.  Palacio Real 4 Kms, Lavapies 4.2 Kms, La Latina 4.2 Kms.
host_about:
I'm originally from the U.S.A.  When I turned 40 and entered mid-life crisis, I opted to escape life in Washington DC.  I gave away my Armani business suits, sold my BMW and invested in a Backpack, a Tent, a Sleeping Bag and a EurRail train pass.  I traveled throughout Europe for 3 months until I decided to plant some temporary roots in Madrid where I have lived since.  I have no regrets.  Teaching English, traveling, and hosting is my passion.

My world is a better place THANKS to the wonderful GUESTS who have shared their time, their culture and their life experience with me.

name: Calle Huertas Coqueto by RegalateMadrid
description:
40 m2 studio for seasonal rent. Spacious and equipped kitchen. Large bathroom. The living room is very bright and has a nice balcony. It has a double bed and a wardrobe. In the living room it has a comfortable sleeper sofa for two people for two people.

MADRID 360 ZBE. Only vehicles with an environmental badge can access.
neighborhood_overview:
The Barrio de Las Letras (Literary Quarter) is one of the oldest areas in Madrid, which is why its streets are narrow and its apartments are so classic and beautiful. The entire neighborhood has been pedestrianized for over 10 years. It is currently the cultural heart of Madrid, where Cervantes, Lope de Vega and other great masters of literature lived in the Spanish Golden Age. The area is full of theaters, including some from the 16th century such as the Teatro Español. The flavor of its streets, especially Calle Huertas, where the house is located, and the fact that it is a pedestrian area has made the neighborhood the capital's trendy area, with its many restaurants, some of which are over a hundred years old, bars, and fashion stores. Being in the museum triangle (El Prado – Reina Sofía – Thyssen) makes it a perfect point for art lovers who come to spend a few days in Madrid.
A neighborhood full of energy, streets full of outdoor terraces, with exotic food and also tradition

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood with the most bohemian and modern residents in the city. Madrid's benchmark for retro fashion and underground culture. The Malasaña neighborhood forms an irregular square flanked by Gran Vía to the south, Calle Fuencarral to the east, Calle Carranza to the north, and finally Calle San Bernardo to the west. Malasaña is also closely linked to La Movida, the cultural and social revolution that emerged in Madrid during the 1980s and had its epicenter in this Madrid neighborhood. Leisure, culture, theater, shopping, bars... everything you could want is in Malasaña.

neighborhood_overview: This great apartment is located on Calle Mayor, just a few steps from Plaza Mayor and very near the famous Puerta del Sol and Mercado de San Miguel. It is great for discovering the city on foot. There are lots of tapas bars and typical Spanish wine taverns near the apartment. The recently refurbished Mercado de San Miguel is a great place for foodies, who will find hundreds of delicious things in this market. Nearby is Calle de Preciados - a lively street which is great for shopping. Madrid's most central square, the Puerta del Sol, is only two minutes' walk away from the apartment. It is very lively: a meeting point for Madrid residents and tourists alike.
host_about:
I live in Madrid, a city that has captivated me from the start for its culture, history and beauty. I work as a full-time host for Aspasios and couldn’t think of a better job: at Aspasios we love to make our guests feel at home. A big part of our job is listening carefully to our visitors: we learn so much from them every day. We enjoy meeting each and every person who comes to stay with us, and want them to come back because of us. We pride ourselves on being professional and friendly at the same time. At Aspasios, we are passionate about hospitality.

My colleague Luis and I are always on hand to help you make the most of your trip to Madrid. We know this lovely city inside out, so can recommend plenty of restaurants, bars and activities that you might not find in the guide books!

Vivo en Madrid, una ciudad que me ha cautivado desde el principio por su cultura, historia y belleza. Trabajo como manager para Aspasios y no podía pensar en un mejor trabajo: a Aspasios nos encanta que nuestros huéspedes se sientan como en casa. Una gran parte de nuestro trabajo es escuchar atentamente a nuestros visitantes: aprendemos mucho de ellos todos los días. Nos gusta conocer a todos y cada uno de los que vienen a quedarse con nosotros, y queremos ser la causa para que vuelvan. Nos enorgullecemos de ser amables y profesionales al mismo tiempo. En Aspasios, nos apasiona la hospitalidad.
Mis colegas y yo estamos siempre a tu disposición para ayudarte a sacar el máximo provecho de tu viaje a Madrid. Conocemos que esta ciudad de adentro hacia afuera, y podemos recomendar restaurantes, bares y actividades que no puedes encontrar en los libros de guía!

neighborhood_overview: We are between Barrio de las Letras and Lavapies neighborhood. Both are very chaste but at the same time multicultural and modern neighborhoods, where you can find a multitude of museums, art galleries, theaters, and also the Spanish Film Library. The Barrio de las Letras is known for being where the most famous writers of the Spanish Golden Age (Cervantes, Lope de Vega, Quevedo) lived. Cultural tours of the area are available for cultural tours of the area. Lavapiés is Madrid's most colorful neighborhood. You can find food here from all over the world, go to concerts of varied music, to the theater, or have a drink in its famous bars with terrace. We are very close to other famous neighborhoods like Malasaña or Chueca, you can go everywhere walking.

name: Gran Via designer apartment
description:
A stunning apartment in the heart of Madrid just steps away from Gran Via and Puerta del Sol. Ideally located in the trendy "barrio" of Chueca, near main tourist sites, surrounded by shops, restaurants and bars. Decorated by top interior designer. Spacious and comfortable. Two large bedrooms and two full bathrooms (one en suite), a fully-equipped kitchen. Size: 140m2.
Wifi, cable TV, stereo speaker, washing machine, Nespresso machine, dishwasher, fridge, iron, hairdryer. (No air conditioner)
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is ideally located on a quiet street in Chueca, one of Madrid's trendiest "barrios" full of boutiques, restaurants and bars. The apartment is steps away from from Gran Via and the pedestrian street Calle Fuencarral. Puerta del Sol is a mere eight minutes away by foot, and Plaza de Cibeles, Plaza Mayor and the city's main museums and tourist attractions are also a short walking distance away.
There are plenty of supermarkets in the area that open every day of the week, most of them until late at night.
The apartment couldn't be better located if you're looking to stay in the centre of Madrid!
host_about:
Hello! I was born in Ireland to an English mother and a Spanish father - which might explain my passion for traveling. My home is in Mexico City, but my second home is Madrid. 
I love to live well, eat well and travel well. I spend a lot of my free time scouting flea markets and vintage and antique shops, interior decorating is much more than just a hobby to me!

description:

A walk from the Plaza Mayor, the Royal Palace and the Prado Museum. Pedestrian area and very well connected, 20 meters from the metro SOL and train nearby. Very commercial area.
neighborhood_overview:
Madrid has a lot of night life, you will be in a very commercial area and with a lot of life, full of places to discover as well as visit. The area is surrounded by years of history and it is ideal if it is your first trip to the city and you want to discover its charms. You'll see there's a lot of street security.
You will be staying within walking distance of Plaza Mayor, Plaza de Opera, Plaza de Oriente and the Royal Palace. You can walk to the Museo del Prado, walk along the Gran Vía madrileña and even reach the Retiro park, get to know La Cibeles and photograph the famous Puerta de Alcalá.
On Sundays, you can go tapas around the area, and visit El Rastro.
Puerta del Sol is just 20 meters away from the house. There you will find the Sol metro station as well as the commuter train that takes you to tourist places such as El Escorial or Aranjuez. name: WOOD, MARBLE AND BRICK
description:
Registered in the Register of Tourism Companies of the General Directorate of Tourism with number VT-2042 “HOUSING FOR TOURIST USE”

Enjoy the center of Madrid, staying in a magnificent modern and functional apartment converted into a comfortable SUITE.

Located in Lavapies, central and traditional neighborhood of the oldest and in the heart of Madrid, ideal to enjoy its surroundings, the essence of its streets and visit the entire tourist environment on foot.
neighborhood_overview:
Lavapiés is a traditional neighborhood of the oldest in Madrid.

Located in the downtown area, between the Ambassador Roundabout and the Lavapiés and Tirso de Molina squares.

It is very close to the neighborhoods of Latina, Las Letras, Los Austrias and Chueca.

One of its main characteristics is its cultural diversity. People from different nationalities, ethnicities and cultures live together, which makes it a unique neighborhood where many cultural activities take place.

There are a variety of bars and restaurants with typical national and international dishes, which deserve to be tasted.

Next to the Lavapiés and Tirso de Molina Metro stations, just one station from the central and emblematic Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor.

The apartment is very close to the Madrid Puerta de Atocha train station.

It is located in a tourist environment where you will see unique buildings from the 19th and early 20th centuries,
host_about:
Bienvenidos a nuestro apartamento.

Mi madre Victoria o yo os recibiremos personalmente en el apartamento y os daremos las explicaciones para que vuestra estancia en Madrid sea más fácil y agradable.

My mother Victoria or I will receive you personally at the apartment and we will give you the explanations so that your stay in Madrid is easier and more pleasant.

description:

neighborhood_overview: The historic quarter of Habsburg Madrid is one of the city’s main attractions. The Plaza de Oriente is part of a historical site comprising the Royal Palace, the Sabatini gardens, Campo del Moro and the Opera Theatre, all important architectural landmarks from the Habsburg era. The Plaza de Oriente opens the way to other sites and places that cannot be missed on any visit to Madrid: the Plaza Mayor, the Almudena Cathedral, Plaza de la Villa, calle Mayor or the Encarnación Monastery. Immerse yourself in culture by taking a short stroll, or a short bus or metro ride, to one of the city’s many famous museums, or visit the “in” places, chic restaurants or shopping areas in Madrid’s vibrant city centre.
host_about:
Our small agency was created by two people: Karin Wallis, half English and half Swedish has lived most of her life in Madrid and Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano down to the marrow, has lived in Seville all of his life. We created the agency as we wish to do something different: take peoples charming homes and transform them into rentals, keeping the magic and charm the owners created when they built their home but at the same time making it comfortable and adequate for our clients such as  giving them plenty of empty cupboard space,  ensuring the only food in the fridge is the one of our welcome hamper and making sure everything is working correctly and is sparkling clean so that when you arrive, the property will feel like instant home to you too. There are no two properties alike, nor are there two guest exactly alike but we do trust we will have the right home for you.

Nuestra pequeña agncia fué creada por Karin Wallis, mitad inglesa y mitad sueca ha vivido casi toda su vida en Madrid y Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano hasta la médula, ha vivido en Sevilla toda su vida. Creamos esta empresa dado que queríamos hacer algo diferente: transformar la acogedora casa de un propietario a una propiedad para alquilar manteniendo la magia y el encanto que los propietarios metieron en ella pero a su vez adecuándola para que sea cómodo para nuestros clientes. No hay dos propiedades  iguales, ni hay dos clientes exactamente iguales pero confiamos en tener una casa de su agrado.

name: Wide Skies Madrid apartment
description: Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, fully equipped apartment with a huge terrace, walking distance to most places of interest, including dozens of antique shops. In-person check-in and you can arrive in the morning. Check-out is 3 pm, negotiable. Sleeps up to 6 people. Great food stores and restaurants right on our street.  You can cook yourself or eat out. We are a few hundred meters from a modern sports center (gyms, 25-meter swimming pool, rooftop jogging track with a beautiful view of Madrid).
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in the very center of town. If you walk straight up our street, in about 7 minutes you will reach the Plaza Mayor. Walking 5 minutes in the opposite direction will take you to the San Franciso el Grande church with marvelous paintings, including by Goya. Royal Palace is about 9 minutes walk.
The Rastro, the largest flea market in Europe, in operation since the Middle Ages, starts two short block away from our door. It is operating every Sunday from 9 am to 3 pm, with some 3000 stalls where you can buy things new and old.
On weekdays, the same area is an antique hunter’s paradise. It is rather sleepy and half empty, but there are probably more than 100 antique stores within a very short walk. They open around 10 – 10:30 am. Go to Calle de la Ribera de Curtidores, which is parallel to our street. This is the main antiques street, there are shops every few meters and some courtyards with additional shops. And virtually all side streets off the Ribera de Curtidor
host_about: A Polish woman, married to an American, living and working in New York, and missing Madrid, my favorite city on the planet. The apartment on Calle Toledo is our second home and, with the August 2015 end of its complete remodeling, is  a life-long dream come true. One day we may move there full time, but for now since we have active professional lives (Ren, a writer, me working in international relations) we decided to share the place with others when we are not there. Friends in Madrid are taking care of the logistics side for our guests. We hope you will love the place. Between the two of us, we can correspond in English, Spanish, Polish and French.  In a pinch, our daughter can help with Swahili, Dutch and Acholi.

Full of the latest trends in bars, restaurants and fashion, you will enjoy walking around this lively neighborhood. It is also located in the heart of the city, with the main destinations just a few minutes away.

In the last few years, the city of Madrid, capital of Spain, is one of the cities that is becoming a very attractive tourist destination for both Spanish and international tourists. Appart from the monuments that can be visited in Madrid, the charm of its main squares and streets, with emblematic places such as the Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol or the reborn Gran Vía, is one of its main attractions. However, above all, those who visit Madrid appreciate the very welcoming spirit of the city, always with a great cultural, leisure and gastronomic atmosphere. name: At the Heart of Madrid
description: A beautiful apartment in the old town of Madrid, situated in a quiet street in La Latina neighborhood. This is an area of tapas bars, restaurants and terraces, 10 min. to Plaza Mayor, 15 min. to Puerta de Sol, 12 min. to Royal Palace… every Madrid attraction at walking distance.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is one of the prefered for turists and people from Madrid to have dinner in one of the many restaurants and tapas bars there are, or to drink a coffe or a beer in a quite terrace. It is also a great place to walk around and see how Madrid looked in the 17th century, as many houses and little streets remain as they were.

Our house is actualy from the 17th century, but the interior is totaly renovated.
It is walking distance to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Gran Via Street, the Opera or the Royal Palace. It is also very close to multicultural neighborhood Lavapiés wich also has a lot of restaurants (Moroccan food, Indian food), Las Letras Neighborhood, and to main Museums.
host_about:
Vivo en esta casa con mis dos hijos (6, 10) y solo alquilamos cuando nos vamos de vacaciones. Nuestro apartamento está lleno de vida (libros, juguetes, todo lo que necesitas en una cocina..)
Todos los amigos que han pasado por aquí a lo largo de los años nos dicen lo encantador que les parece, así que esperamos que a ti también te guste.
Además el barrio es de los más bonitos de Madrid ;)
¡Un saludo!

name: Downtown Comfortable Apartment Gran Vía | A035
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

+ + + + +
// Temporary Notice - Works //
Temporary renovation and improvement works on the building, apologies for any inconvenience that may occasionally be caused. (The working hours of these works are from Monday to Friday 8am to 5:30pm only)
+ + + + +
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer (during 2017 I became mum, so I won't be doing check in's for a while). However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 25 years now and enrolled in a new adventure in spring 2017: becoming a mum. Life had still not so pleasant surprises and in september 2021 she was diagnosed a breast cancer and is still in treatment. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board, a lot since 2012 we must say, and each of them have left their impromt in our company. Now the team is composed by Mica, an Argentinian girl now based in Madrid for a few years, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Mica is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Julia, who joined us in in February 2023. Julia is Mica's friend, also Argentine and has a super cool and fun vibe.

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens, spending time with friends, our dogs and Vanessa's daughter (the only mother of the team!). We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 

We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Osca, Vanessa, Mica and Julia
Nuba Gestión de Apartamentos, S.L.

name: Acogedor apartamento en Lavapies
description: Nice and very bright apartment in the middle of downtown Madrid, in the old neighborhood of Lavapiés, with typical balconies and beautiful views of the rooftops and picturesque buildings. Very close to Reina Sofia museum, Retiro, Prado museum, Atocha Station, Rastro, Sol, La Tabacalera. Many restaurants with terraces, shops of all kinds, three supermarkets very close by: Lidl, Carrefour, Mercadona.
neighborhood_overview: It is a mutlyultural neighborhood, old, beautiful, with many bars, restaurants, very cheerful. You have many small theaters and cultural centers.
host_about: Normalmente vivo en el piso que puedes ver en este anuncio, solo lo alquilo cuando tengo viajes largos :), entonces seguramente encuentras mis libros, especias, té y muchas plantas en casa. Siempre pido que no dejes morir a mis plantas y las riegues un poquito. Comparto piso con mis perritos, si tienes alergía fuerte, puede que no es el lugar que buscas, aunque cuando llegues los perros no estarán y la casa estará aspirada de sus pelitos cortos. No soy obsesiva de la limpieza y tampoco tengo tiempo para serlo, entonces no te esperes un hotel de cinco estrellas, aunque te digo que mi casa, por lo acogedora que es, te va a hacer sentir que estas en un lugar mucho más mágico que un hotel.

The neighborhood is La Latina, one of the most historic neighborhoods in Madrid, known for its artistic atmosphere, its bars, restaurants, flamenco tablaos.
A place where you can breathe the real Madrid, where traditions, parties, and a very authentic atmosphere are kept, at the same time it is visited by many young people for its restaurants, bars and atmosphere both at night and day.
There are green areas, squares, market with high quality fresh produce, theater, supermarkets next to the house.
host_about:

Soy viajero de naturaleza y he viajado mucho por Europa  y Latino américa especialmente.

Soy actor, y creador escénico, también trabajo en el área de la educación.

MADRID 360 ZBE. Only vehicles with an environmental badge can access.
neighborhood_overview: The Barrio de Las Letras is one of the oldest areas in Madrid, that's why its streets are narrow and its apartments are so classic and beautiful. For more than 10 years the whole neighborhood has been pedestrian. It is currently the cultural heart of Madrid, where Cervantes, Lope de Vega and other great masters of literature lived in the Spanish Golden Age. The area is full of theaters and even some of the sixteenth century such as the Spanish Theater. The taste of its streets, especially Huertas Street, where the house is located, and the fact that it is a pedestrian area has turned the neighborhood into the fashionable area of the capital, with its many restaurants, some over a hundred years old, bars and fashionable shops.  In addition to being in the triangle of museums (El Prado – Reina Sofía – Thyssen) makes it a perfect point for art lovers who come to spend a few days in Madrid.

name: Room Mate Madrid - Luxury living in Madrid center, 5ESP | PREMIUM ROOM
description:
Newly renovated apartment located in one of the most exclusive areas of Madrid. The rooms are of various sizes and types, however all of them dispose of the same services included in the price. The rooms are for single use, while the house and common areas are shared among the tenants, this includes the kitchen with all its equipment. The property has 3 bathrooms with shower + 1 toilet (allocated by room). There is also a large living room of 35 m2. The rent price includes all costs and services, ie: electricity, water, gas, Internet wifi, telephone, beddings (sheets and towels, washed and changed for you), cleaning products, iron and optional lunch.
Located in the district of Chamberí, one of the most sought after places in Madrid for its relaxing and lively atmosphere and, obviously, tapas. No surprise that so many students choose it as a place of residence – this is one of the best neighbourhoods in Madrid. If you are a fan of live music, this area offers a good range of live
