name: Calle Mayor, trendy, bright, central, balcony
description: Bright one-bedroom one-bathroom apartment with a balcony in the very centre of Madrid, a few steps from the famous Plaza Mayor, and a two-minute walk from the metro station in Puerta del Sol. The apartment comes with Wi-Fi, TV, all modern appliances and a fully equipped open kitchen. Our team will be happy to help you with everything you need. The sofa-bed in the living room can accommodate two more guests.
neighborhood_overview: This great apartment is located on Calle Mayor, just a few steps from Plaza Mayor and very near the famous Puerta del Sol and Mercado de San Miguel. It is great for discovering the city on foot. There are lots of tapas bars and typical Spanish wine taverns near the apartment. The recently refurbished Mercado de San Miguel is a great place for foodies, who will find hundreds of delicious things in this market. Nearby is Calle de Preciados - a lively street which is great for shopping. Madrid's most central square, the Puerta del Sol, is only two minutes' walk away from the apartment. It is very lively: a meeting point for Madrid residents and tourists alike.
host_about:
I live in Madrid, a city that has captivated me from the start for its culture, history and beauty. I work as a full-time host for Aspasios and couldn’t think of a better job: at Aspasios we love to make our guests feel at home. A big part of our job is listening carefully to our visitors: we learn so much from them every day. We enjoy meeting each and every person who comes to stay with us, and want them to come back because of us. We pride ourselves on being professional and friendly at the same time. At Aspasios, we are passionate about hospitality.

My colleague Luis and I are always on hand to help you make the most of your trip to Madrid. We know this lovely city inside out, so can recommend plenty of restaurants, bars and activities that you might not find in the guide books!

Vivo en Madrid, una ciudad que me ha cautivado desde el principio por su cultura, historia y belleza. Trabajo como manager para Aspasios y no podía pensar en un mejor trabajo: a Aspasios nos encanta que nuestros huéspedes se sientan como en casa. Una gran parte de nuestro trabajo es escuchar atentamente a nuestros visitantes: aprendemos mucho de ellos todos los días. Nos gusta conocer a todos y cada uno de los que vienen a quedarse con nosotros, y queremos ser la causa para que vuelvan. Nos enorgullecemos de ser amables y profesionales al mismo tiempo. En Aspasios, nos apasiona la hospitalidad.
Mis colegas y yo estamos siempre a tu disposición para ayudarte a sacar el máximo provecho de tu viaje a Madrid. Conocemos que esta ciudad de adentro hacia afuera, y podemos recomendar restaurantes, bares y actividades que no puedes encontrar en los libros de guía!

description:

host_about:
Algo tengo que escribir. Arquitecto nacido y criado en Buenos Aires, vivo en Madrid hace 10 años y me encanta la vida aqui­. Creo ser de mente abierta, la gente que me conoce dice que soy gracioso con un toque de locura (quien no la tiene). Me gusta compartir un buen vino con una buena conversación. Ahh! Tambien dicen que cocino muy bien. Me interesa el arte en general, especialmente el cine independiente y la buena música. Aprovechar la ciudad al maximo, recorrer las calles e intentar tener buenas charlas con la gente. 

J.P. Sartre decia que "cada uno es lo que hace en la vida con lo que le hicieron de él." Bueno, trato de disfrutar de la manera mas apasionada posible todo lo que hago.

Halfway between La Latina and Lavapies, it is the most charming area of the city! On the well known street Ribera de Curtidores, on Sundays you can wake up in the heart of the traditional flea market "el Rastro", but away from the bustle.

Madrid has much to offer, but certainly La Latina concentrates many of the main of this city. It is one of the areas with much more cuisine offer of Madrid, every day you can discover a different place to try the best tapas and spanish delicacies! And on Sundays the Rastro, it's not only a flea market with hundreds of years of tradition but as well a conglomerate of beautiful streets, bars lifetime, people ... La Latina is recognised as the most traditional neighborhood in the city.

If you want to see good Flamenco, all the places are walking distance (2-15 minutes).
Oh, and the Opera is about a 7-minute walk straight out the door and through the small winding streets, past the 12th-century Saint Nicolas church.

neighborhood_overview:

Right by plaza de Santa Ana and Plaza del Angel. Walking distance from Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor. You can also walk to Atocha Train station. From where you can take the AVE to Barcelona, Sevilla, Cordoba and many other cities of Spain. You can also take day trips to Toledo or Segovia.
Perfect Location!

I speak several languages and enjoy meeting people from all over the world. It will be my pleasure to host you in Madrid.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartement is located in the heart of Madrid, between La latina and the Austrias Neighbourhood
The narrow and winding streets of this irregularly laid-out area, mostly dating back to the Middle Ages, usually lead onto a square. Most of them lay outside the Medieval walled village and provided accommodation to a great many merchants who sold their goods at the market. This commercial tradition still echoes in several street and square names, such as Plaza de la Cebada (Barley Square), where the farmers’ market used to be held, Plaza de los Carros (Carriage Square), Plaza de la Paja (Straw Square), or even El Rastro (owing its name to the blood trail of the old slaughterhouse), the city’s best-known flea market.
Plaza Mayor, La Encarnación Monastery and Plaza de la Villa, with buildings erected in the fifteenth, sixteenth and seventeenth centuries – Casa de la Villa (formerly, Madrid City Hall), Los Lujanes Tower, Cisneros House –, are the main architectural complexes bui

Travel, share my leisure with my family and friends, discover the world, a book, a movie, a new restaurant in Madrid ... .These are my hobbies .... For now !!!
I love Madrid and I love you like a lively, changeable, you can not bore ... I will help you !
Soy una persona optimista, extrovertida y con mucho sentido del humor, disfruto de la buena gente y disfrutar de su sonrisa y de sus historias.
Viajar, compartir mi ocio con mi familia y amigos, descubrir el mundo, un libro, una película, un nuevo restaurante de Madrid….Esas son mis aficiones…. De momento!!!
Me gusta  Madrid y me gusta que os guste, una ciudad viva, cambiante, que no te puede aburrir,... yo te ayudaré.

The apartment is located in the area of El Rastro, a market that is set up on Sunday mornings on Calle Ribera de Curtidores. This market, where you can find almost everything from clothes to antiques, is an institution in Madrid, as well as one of its biggest tourist attractions. Just a few meters from Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, or Madrid de los Austrias, the location of the house is perfect for exploring the capital's historic center.

name: Sunny Double Bedroom with Balcony
description: Gorgeous sunny double bedroom with great view in our recently refurbished 3-bedroom flat in Lavapiés, Madrid’s cultural headquarters. All the main art and cultural venues, as well as the usual touristy ones, within walking distance.
neighborhood_overview: The multicultural Lavapiés has become Madrid’s cultural centre with its broad offer of venues and events. Our place is surrounded by the most interesting art galleries, museums and theatre venues in the city, with places such as Teatro Valle-Inclán, La Casa Encendida, La Tabacalera, Cine Doré or the Museo Reina Sofía. Also, the wide variety of restaurants, bars and cafes is amazing and we can give you a good insight of what’s on offer depending on what you’re into. You will be able to choose from the best restaurants, specially if you’re a vegeterian  like us. :)
host_about:
¡Hola! Somos Marián y Juan Gabriel. Marián es madrileña y Juan Gabriel es colombo-británico. Estamos casados desde hace tres años y hace un par decidimos comprar y reformar una casa en el centro de Madrid. Nos encanta viajar así que, cuando no estamos viajando, recibir a gente de todas las partes del mundo en casa es nuestra manera de viajar y seguir conociendo gente y aprendiendo. Nuestro tiempo libre lo pasamos en el cine, exposiciones de arte y conciertos... ¡pero todos los planes acaban siempre de cañas con los amigos!
¡Nos encantará guiarte por Madrid para que te guste la ciudad tanto como a nosotros!

name: Madrid Best Location Casa Moderna RetiroPark&Prado
description: Room in the most elitist and quiet neighborhood of Madrid called Jerónimos. Crossing Calle Alfonso XII is the famous Retiro Park with its lake where you can ride a boat or see the Palacio de Cristal. Behind is our jewel El Museo del Prado. It is an area to walk to the best museums in the world to rent bicycle or skate in an easy and easy way.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is called Jerónimos and our house is in front of Parque del Retiro, you just have to cross Calle Alfonso XII and if you follow straight you meet the Puerta Alcalá and the Barrio de Salamanca with the most elitist and typical shops of Madrid, going down you find La Gran Vía and everything straight down the street you are in the Museo del Prado and in front of the neighborhood of Las Letras and Museo Reina Sofia.
Great grastonomic and tourist variety two steps from the house
host_about: Si vienes a Madrid o Ibiza unos días sin duda estás son tus casas, facilidad ir andando donde elijas por perfecta ubicación Sus barrios más exclusivos y seguros te enamorarán. name: Grand apartment in Madrid

neighborhood_overview: This north edge of Castellana is one of the most exclusive residential areas of central Madrid. It is not a suburb, but rather a quite and safe pocket in the city. Close to the Bernabeu Stadium (walking distance) and to the Michelin Star restaurant Diverxo, the neighbourhood has plenty of green areas, shops and malls, bars, and other more affordable dinning spots etc.  It is also 10 minutes away from Chamartin train station, with regular trains departing to the Basque Country and Galicia, and a direct connection to Atocha Station.

description:
Apartment in a former 17th century convent in the heart of Madrid's historic center between the traditional neighborhoods of La Latina and Lavapiés
Ideal space to work and live in downtown Madrid.
Stucco, lime plaster, wood, mosaics, and a lot of enthusiasm.
It has a living room of seventy square meters and another of thirty square meters, four meters high ceilings with three balconies to the street and an American kitchen.
A very open space.
Enjoy.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood where this apartment is located is one of the most multicultural and with incredible life and joy at all hours.
You can find tapas bars, art galleries, restaurants from all countries, and an infinite number of people of the most varied and cheerful.
Something like a village in the middle of Madrid.
Diverse, fun and in short... wonderful.

Os  esperamos

Barrio de Salamanca is a great choice for travellers interested in gourmet food, shopping and culture.

It is located in one of Madrid’s main commercial districts. There you can find firms like Gucci, Channel or Carolina Herrera, and

neighborhood_overview:
In the Barrio de las Letras there is a complete range of shops, ranging from the most traditional, with centuries of history, to the most modern that respond to the latest trends. Tradition and avant-garde merge; the world of the permanent and the Ephtholes go hand to offer the best range of possibilities to all visitors.

Shopping in the Barrio de las Letras becomes a true delight given its very wide and rich variety of commerce, where quality is the common denominator, as well as the care of its merchants. Art galleries, silverware and antique shops, bookstores, trendy, music, decor shops... offer the best service to the most discerning customers. Everywhere in the world, people come to buy collectibles or fashion in the shops of the neighborhood.

KNOW
The Barrio de las Letras has distinguished neighbors that surround its boundaries: The Prado Museum, The Thyssen Museum, the Reina Sofía Art Center and inside the Medialab and Caixa Forum. All this artistic

name: Apartamento en Madrid muy cerca a Plaza Mayor
description:
A beautiful apartment near Plaza Mayor, ideal for couples or small groups, offering the perfect location to visit Madrid while staying in the heart of the city.

Just a 5-minute walk from Plaza Mayor, Sol, Gran Vía, and the La Latina neighborhood.

It features a wonderful bathroom, a spacious double bedroom, a large living room with a sofa bed, and a fully equipped open kitchen.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the Centro district of Madrid, in the city's oldest area, nestled in the Barrio de Embajadores, just a few streets away from the iconic Barrio de las Letras, home to great writers of Spain's Golden Age such as Cervantes and Quevedo. This area also hosts some of Madrid's most important museums. Calle Huertas is the main artery, lined with tapas bars and party spots where young locals gather on weekends for drinks with friends. Plaza de Santa Ana, with its wide terraces, is another major attraction for tourists in the area.

The Art Triangle
The Museo del Prado, Reina Sofía, and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums form the three corners of this cultural triangle in the heart of the Paseo del Prado, part of the Barrio de las Letras. These world-renowned museums are a must-see for both tourists and locals. In addition, the CaixaForum and its impressive vertical garden, along with smaller galleries in the area, make this part of the city a true cultural hub
host_about:
Como anfitrión profesional y gestor de propiedades en Airbnb, mi objetivo es brindar experiencias excepcionales a cada huésped. Con años de experiencia en Madrid, lidero un equipo comprometido con la hospitalidad, garantizando estancias cómodas y memorables. 

Nos especializamos en la gestión integral de alojamientos, combinando calidad, atención personalizada y el auténtico encanto de España. 

¡Bienvenidos a una experiencia única!

neighborhood_overview:
Our home is in the city centre, walking distance from many landmarks and must-visit spots of the city like Palacio Real, Catedral de la Almudena, Plaza de Sol (km zero of Spain), Gran Vía (main shopping avenue), Plaza de Espana, etc. Right in the centre of Madrid which allows you to enjoy the more central (above mentioned) as well as arriving easily to more recent attractions the south has to offer such as Madrid Rio (Madrid's "beachfront" where you can bike, roll in huge green areas or walk along the river) or Matadero Cultural Centre. What used to be a Slaughterhouse is now a great place for audiences of all ages that combines outdoors and indoors spaces to eat (plenty of food trucks on the weekends aside from the restaurant), visiting interesting temporary exhibitions, free gigs/concerts or as an architectural must-see place of interest itself.

THE STREET, THE NEIGHBORHOOD. A GOOD NIGHT SLEEP IN THE PLACE TO BE
Because of its placement in a mainly residential street
host_about:
Es difícil describirse uno así mismo, pero ahí va: Me considero una persona abierta, me gusta conocer gente nueva, al principio tiendo más a escuchar que a hablar, tal vez recuerdo de mi timidez de la infancia, dicen que soy agradable y educado, al menos eso intento, sobre todo si las personas se muestran agradables.

Lo que más me gusta es ir a conciertos de música de mis grupos preferidos, ((que son bastantes dentro del pop electrónico), también me encanta el cine y viajar y suelo repetir cuando  la gente  ha sido tan amable conmigo que me ha hecho estar en lo más cercano al paraíso que conozco.

Me gusta mucho interactuar con mis huéspedes, aunque les dejo que interactuen lo que les apetezca, ya que cada uno tiene sus necesidades e intereses y ante todo no quiero parecer pesado,¡ Están en su tiempo de vacaciones!
¡Espero conoceros y bienvenidos  a vuestra casa!!!!!

Somos de Tenerife,  la isla  donde nos conocimos y en la que hemos vivido intermitentemente durante los últimos 12 años. 

El trabajo nos ha llevado a insospechados países, desde Estados Unidos a Catar, pasando por Italia o Letonia. En nuestros viajes hemos aprendido a valorar España por su historia y su incomparable oferta gastronómica y cultural. 

Nuestra casa es vuestra casa. La elegimos por su excelente localización en el epicentro de Tenerife, una auténtica villa de diseño, a tan sólo un paso del Parque Nacional del Teide, de las costas salvajes, de senderos y de su hermoso cielo azul. ¡Esperamos que disfrutéis!

name: Apartamento 2 Habs en el retiro (2)
description: House with two individual bedrooms in Retiro Park, with wifi access, elevator, renewed bathroom...
neighborhood_overview:
The Retiro neighborhood is characterized by its residential and commercial character. Retiro Park is its central lung. The Atocha, Méndez Álvaro, and Avenida de América train and bus stations are just a few stops away by public transportation. In the neighborhood there are many shops, tapas bars, drinks, restaurants. A five-minute walk away is the Goya shopping area and the exclusive Salamanca neighborhood. On the same street as the apartment there are three supermarkets and the Ibiza market. The Ibiza, Goya, and Sáinz de Baranda metro lines are nearby, as are many public bus lines.
To go downtown, you can also walk through the Retiro Park (15-20min).

description: Recently refurbished with capacity of up to 6, our apartment is perfect for travelers seeking to discover Madrid, and its most multicultural and alternative neighborhood. 15 minutes walking from Sol and Plaza Mayor. Several metro stations nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
Lavapiés is Madrid’s most multicultural and alternative neighborhood, it's home to a high percentage of the city’s immigrants and Spanish bohemians.
Thanks to the neighborhood’s immigrant population, Lavapiés is home to many Indian, Arab and African restaurants, and some of the most authentic international restaurants in Madrid. You’ll also find Spanish restaurants that cater to local residents with simple, hearty food and minimal décor.
You won’t find big, raging clubs or luxury bars here in this neighborhood. Lavapiés nightlife is much more intimate, laidback and economical than that. Think of small, dimly-lit cafes and bars where you can drink wine and beer, and sometimes smoke hookahs, too, and you’ll get what Lavapiés nightlife is all about.
The shopping in Lavapiés is as eclectic as its residents. With its host of import shops and independent stores, you’ll find anything from Indian bangles to Moroccan lamps to books on Spanish anarchism. You’ll have better luck sh

With multitude of squares, churches, old palaces and convents is full of life and history. We will find several street coffees, bars and restaurants as well as numerous shops and their famous Rastro, the major outdoor market of the city.

name: In The Very Heart of the City + Video Projector
description:
THE CALENDAR OPENS 3 MONTHS IN ADVANCE. Apartment with eight balconies overlooking the street, benefiting from abundant natural light and exquisite decor. It is fully equipped with all modern conveniences.

Located in one of Madrid's most vibrant neighborhoods, within walking distance of Gran Vía, the city's most iconic and bustling street, and at the heart of the bohemian neighborhood of Malasaña, often compared to New York's Williamsburg. Right in the center of Madrid.
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is located in the heart of the bohemian neighborhood of Malasaña, often compared to Williamsburg in New York, right in the center of Madrid.

Malasaña is known for hosting some of the best bars and restaurants in the city. Additionally, in the vicinity of the apartment, guests can explore cutting-edge clothing stores and vintage boutiques.

Within walking distance, you'll find attractions like the historic Plaza del Mayo, the Old Conde Duque Barracks, and the Museum of History. If you wish to explore further, you can walk to Plaza de España, Puerta del Sol, Retiro Park, or Plaza Mayor. Furthermore, the apartment has excellent connectivity to the public transportation system, with the nearest metro stations being Noviciado, Callao, and Tribunal, making it easy to get around.

name: Apartamento 4 personas en el Centro de Madrid
description:
SEASONAL RENTALS.

1 bedroom with bunk bed Living room with double sofa bed. Includes sheets-toallas. Equipped kitchen. Second floor with no elevator. Crib without cost. Air-conditioning. Quiet street next to Plaza Lavapiés. Puerta del sol a 10-minute walk. Atocha station a 5-minute walk away. 2 minutes away metro or bus. neighborhood_overview:
You're staying at the trendy neighborhood in Madrid. Multicultural neighborhood, very dynamic and with a lot of life. It is located 10 minutes walk from the Puerta del Sol.

Located next to the Plaza de Lavapiés, in a quiet street that allows you to rest after a day visiting the city, and very well connected with metro and buses in the Plaza.

Building configured around the typical corrala with its wooden structures. In the surroundings we find terraces where you can have a drink, quality restaurants and fast food and supermarkets. Large multi-ethnic offer in restaurants and tapas bars, which is complemented by the gastronomic offer in the surroundings of the Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. House located in a bohemian neighborhood, with a lot of atmosphere during the day and night, and with a great cultural and artistic activity.

There are independent theaters, Valle-Inclán Theater, Casa Encendida, Circus Price Theater and bars that offer exhibitions and

name: Oasis II: luxury by Prado&Cortes
description: What a cute gem right in the centre! Our flat has been recently refurbished and is centrally located on a quietstreet in the charming Cortes!
host_about:
Hi!!

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer (during 2017 I became mum, so I won't be doing check in's for a while). However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 25 years now and enrolled in a new adventure in spring 2017: becoming a mum. Life had still not so pleasant surprises and in september 2021 she was diagnosed a breast cancer and is still in treatment. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board, a lot since 2012 we must say, and each of them have left their impromt in our company. Now the team is composed by Mica, an Argentinian girl now based in Madrid for a few years, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Mica is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Julia, who joined us in in February 2023. Julia is Mica's friend, also Argentine and has a super cool and fun vibe.

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens, spending time with friends, our dogs and Vanessa's daughter (the only mother of the team!). We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 

We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Osca, Vanessa, Mica and Julia

neighborhood_overview: Plaza de Tirso de Molina is named after playwright of the Golden Age of the original author breaks Don Juan in "The Trickster of Seville." name: Double room with private bathroom
description:
A big double room with private bathroom in a beautiful 6th floor attic flat situated in the middle of cultural and green areas: Prado, Reina Sofia, Retiro park.
Perfectly communicated with airport and city center: the best solution for a comfortable stay in Madrid. Breakfast included!

Guides and maps of the city!
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is quiet and very well served.
Big and well supplied market (fish, meat, vegetables and fruit) at 2 minutes walking, 3 supermarkets are very near (Mercadona, Lidl and Día), post office, drugstores, buses, metro and Atocha train station.
Near the apartment there are the best museums of the city: Prado and Reina Sofia, but there are also Retiro park and botanic gardens to be visited.
host_about:
I'm Italian, living in Madrid for 15 years already. I love this city, and I'm always glad to "share it" with people who is willing to know it, in all its aspects!
I love travelling, getting to know new people and different cultures, I've always thought that getting to know a place with local people it's the best way to do it.
I have also many interests like music, movies, reading, playing piano, basketball, swing dancing.. and many others!

name: ~ Fantástico loft en pleno Retiro ~
description:
Charming apartment type loft of 100 square meters in the Salamanca neighborhood next to the Retiro and at the doors of the Retiro metro station, line 2.
Lovely 100 sqm loft apartment of in the Salamanca district, very close to Retiro park.

It has split air conditioning downstairs and ultra quiet Dyson fans upstairs.
neighborhood_overview:
The Salamanca neighborhood is the most emblematic in Madrid, full of good restaurants, the best shops in the city and home to some of the best museums in the world - Museo del Prado, Museo Reina Sofia, Museo Arqueológico Nacional and Museo Thyssen. The area is ideal to enjoy and get to know the best of Madrid, walk, shop and taste its famous tapas.
******************************************************************************
Salamanca is one of Madrid's historic neighborhoods in the core of the museum area. The Museo del Prado, Museo Reina Sofia, Archaeological Museum and Museo Thyssen are 15 minutes far by foot. There are also great restaurants and shops in the area and Madrid's Golden Mile is two blocks away.
The neighborhood and the apartment is especially recommended to those people who love promenading, visiting Madrid's best monuments and enjoying the city's famous tapas.
host_about:
Me gusta viajar. Mi profesión, enfermero, y estudiar lenguas. Hablo inglés y entiendo ruso. Me gusta cuidar el medio ambiente y ayudar a los mas necesitados.

I love to travel. I'm a nurse and study languages. I speak English and a little of Russian. I love diving, taking care the enviroment and helping the people in need.

name: LATINA SOL Best tapas areaLIFT WIFI
description: LATINA SOL  just refurnished, 3rd floor with lift, air conditioning/heating, WIFI!!UNBEATABLE LOCATION !!! BEST TAPAS AREA!!! FREE WIFI! LIFT!!! Tube station out the front door.
neighborhood_overview:
LA LATINA
It is the oldest part of city and one of the most popular districts. It takes part of the medieval and Renaissance Madrid and surely is one of the most beautiful areas of the city. With multitude of squares, churches, old palaces and convents is full of life and history. We will find several street coffees, bars and restaurants as well as numerous shops and their famous Rastro, the major outdoor market of the city.

Surrounded by all type of transports: underground, buses and Atocha train station.
Conveniently located in the heart of the historic city center is perfect for tourist breaks, within a walking distance to Paseo del Arte (Prado Museum, Museum Reina Sofía, Museum Thyssen Bornemitza, Caixa-Forum), Madrid of the Austrias (Royal Palace, Royal Theater), the Rastro of Madrid, PLAZA MAYOR, La Latina (La cava baja y La cava alta) and also close to Atocha train station. Also is possible to walk to the best places to enjoy the kitchen and night of Madrid:

Located in the Retiro district, one of the most tourist spots in the city. With its great cultural offer: The Prado Museum, shopping area and great Gastronomy. You can walk to the most emblematic sites or take the metro 5 min from the apartment.
neighborhood_overview:
The Buen Retiro Park is the true protagonist of this neighborhood of Madrid that has its flanks in the streets of Alcalá and O'Donnell at the north end, Doctor Esquerdo street in the east, the Avenida del Mediterráneo and the Paseo de Reina Cristina in the south and the street of Alfonso XII in the western end.

The origins of the park date from the time of the Catholic Monarchs, in the late fifteenth and early sixteenth centuries. However, the construction of the neighborhood is much later. Corresponds to the late nineteenth century, when the population boom in the city led to successive enlargements. This area maintains a layout similar to that of its neighboring Salamanca district, with perpendicular streets with wide sidewalks and some of them equipped with boulevards to enhance the walk and recreation. This is the case of the streets of Ibiza and Mayor Sainz de Baranda. Although fundamentally residential, its proximity to the city center makes it combine with the commerc

description:

Excellent travel connections from Atocha Railway Station, Estación Sur de Autobuses, ( South Bus Station) ,Metro Palos de la Frontera, Delicias City Train (Cercanías ), City bus, Night bus, etc. My accommodation is good for couples and travellers alike.

Very close to the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Anthropology Museum, the Retiro Park, the Prado Museum, the Thisen Museum, etc.
In Calle Ancora El Asturian Corner, Asturian food of great quality to the same as the restaurant that is stuck also Asturian of great local acceptance.
The Parque del Retiro is a must see and is near without needing public transport, I recommend renting a boat, it is fun and relaxing in a splendid setting.
Really close to the center, full of public transport,main train station: Atocha, main bus station : Station South, metropolitan buses and metro
host_about:
Es difícil describirse uno así mismo, pero ahí va: Me considero una persona abierta, me gusta conocer gente nueva, al principio tiendo más a escuchar que a hablar, tal vez recuerdo de mi timidez de la infancia, dicen que soy agradable y educado, al menos eso intento, sobre todo si las personas se muestran agradables.

Lo que más me gusta es ir a conciertos de música de mis grupos preferidos, ((que son bastantes dentro del pop electrónico), también me encanta el cine y viajar y suelo repetir cuando  la gente  ha sido tan amable conmigo que me ha hecho estar en lo más cercano al paraíso que conozco.

Me gusta mucho interactuar con mis huéspedes, aunque les dejo que interactuen lo que les apetezca, ya que cada uno tiene sus necesidades e intereses y ante todo no quiero parecer pesado,¡ Están en su tiempo de vacaciones!
¡Espero conoceros y bienvenidos  a vuestra casa!!!!!

description:
Live, like a neighbor, this wonderful Madrilenian Historical Corral with the most chaste flavors! You will be in the most canine and multicultural neighborhood, LAVAPIÉS! 1 min from the metro, public bicycles, museums, theaters, restaurants ;-). For <40 YEARS!

IMP: Please, this is an accommodation experience to support a SOCIAL PROJECT OF artistic-scientific RESIDENCE and ACTIVIST with local impact!!! Only for those who feel solidarity with this community project;-)!
neighborhood_overview:
Lavapiés is considered to be Madrid’s coolest urban area! The heart of creativity in the capital paired with the colorful fusion of people and cultures produces Madrid's most interesting barrio!!

On October 2014 "Lavapiés theater district" was created, a network of 15 independence theater companies that offer more than 400 performances per year.

Social diversity and vibrant Street Art is the visible flavor of the neighborhood. We recommend to visit the Tobacco Factory of Embajadores, a public ownership and under the Ministry of Culture through the General Directorate of Fine Arts (GDFA). This building has been listed as Heritage of Cultural Interest.

There are dozens of ethnic bars, restaurants and cafes in which you can taste worldly flavors like Indian, Arabic, Bangladesh, Chinese, Japanese, Italian, Spanish, Vegan food...... These bars and coffee-shops have a friendly bohemian vibe which welcomes everyone who enters.

In the famous Argumos

Cycling Ring (one step away from the study), which surrounds the city for 65 kilometers where you can go by bike or on foot.

host_about:
Hola!, me llamo Antonio, soy un madrileño de nacimiento y  me encanta mi ciudad.
Vivo  con en un bonito y acogedor apartamento-ático en una calle muy tranquila perpendicular a Gran Vía, una de las avenidas más bonitas de Madrid. El apartamento dispone de una estupenda terraza con aromáticas plantas,  velas, el lugar perfecto para tomarnos un café o un vino y explicaros todo acerca de Madrid.
Estamos a 5 minutos andando de la Puerta del Sol, así como de la Plaza Mayor, el Palacio Real, Parque del Retiro, Museo del Prado, Reina Sofía...todos los lugares más emblemáticos de Madrid a los que se llega dando un agradable paseo.
Me encanta recibir y conocer personas de todo el mundo y compartir experiencias no sólo culturales sino de vida, por eso abro mi casa al mundo.
Un abrazo y os espero en Madrid!

i love meeting people from everywhere and sharing experiences of culture and life.

name: Cibeles , centro de Madrid.oferta.
description: Located in the Plaza de Cibeles, the heart and most characteristic place of Madrid next to the Paseo del Prado , a World Heritage Site recognized by Unesco , from where you can walk to anywhere, museum , theater and emblematic neighborhood of the city. It has a stop for all buses  and metro. It has a lot of charm. A very comfortable loft distributed over two floors.
neighborhood_overview: The location is unbeatable is located in the neighborhood of Las Cortes 300m from the well-known Cibeles fountain, 5 min from the Prado museum, 1 min from the thyssen museum, 5 min from the Reina Sofía museum, 1 min from the congress of deputies, 1 min zarzuela theater, 1 min Plaza de Cibeles, 5 min Puerta de Alcalá , 5 min Puerta del Sol , you can enjoy a pleasant walk through the Plaza Mayor and reach the impressive Palacio de Oriente in 10 minutes. Connection of all buses in Cibeles including the airport 1 min, and subway mouth 2 min, five minutes from the fun neighborhood of letters and 5 minutes from the famous Golden Mile. You can enjoy 5 minutes from the colorful and lively neighborhood of Chueca and Malasaña  . Vive Madrid , I look forward to seeing you!!!
host_about: Soy  madrileña de nacimiento. Trabajo en mi propia empresa y eso me hace feliz y estar creando ilusión permanentemente. Me apasiona el deporte y disfrutar cada momento. Viajo siempre que puedo y cuando no puedo compartir mi apartamento me permite conocer personas de otros lugares. Deseo que vuestra estancia en Madrid sea lo más agradable posible. Os espero!!! De Madrid al Cielo!!!!

name: Beautiful Apt. Historic District-Sol
description: The apartment is disinfected according to the existing recommendations of the health authority. Bed linen and towels are washed according to the hygiene protocol (disinfectant + 70º celsius laundry + iron). All surfaces known as virus carriers, such as door handles, switches, kitchen utensils and all furniture, are disinfected with specific antivirus products. I provide a virus prevention set for every guest (disinfection wipes, antibacterial hygiene hand gel 30 ml, protective mask and gloves).
neighborhood_overview:
This historic district area (Sol/ Huertas/ La Latina) is perfect for exploring the Spanish capital:

•Most of Madrid amenities are within walking distance, museums; or the countless bars, flamenco tablaos, theatres or musicals.
•Thriving cultural life, art galleries and the main city museums (Prado , Reina Sofia, Thyssen) are a stones throw.
•The vicinity is renowned as well for its thrilling night life, its typical restaurants, tapas bars and terraces.

•Puerta del Sol > 200 m
•Plaza Mayor > 100 m
•Plaza Santa Ana > 150 m
•Mercado de San Miguel > 150 m
•Gran Vía > 400 m
•Prado Museum> 800 m
•Reina Sofía Museum > 700 m
•Thyssen Bornemisza Museum > 800 m
•Cibeles > 1,1 km
•Retiro Park > 1,2 km
•Almudena cathedral > 300 m
•Kings Palace > 350 m

The exclusive Chueca neighbourhood is also nearby where many bars are concentrated, and offers very chic boutiques, high level restaurants and charming

I enjoy hanging with friends and eating out at restaurants! For all people who want to visit my lovely city, I offer him accommodation and personal attention. I love my city and I'm sure you too will like it, for its friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Do not hesitate to contact me. I'll be happy to help. See you soon!

name: Design Puerta Del Sol (M2)
description:
It is a small apartment with capacity for 4 people in front of Puertas del Sol, a place very visited by tourists all year round.
It has a dining room, and bathroom.
Our check-in time is from 3:00 pm to 9:30 pm, early entry is subject to availability and in some cases a surcharge of 30€ applies. Late check-in, after 9:30 pm has a mandatory cost of €35.
neighborhood_overview: The center of Madrid is full of life and in it, we can find a huge offer of culture and leisure. Living in the center, you won't miss anything. You'll be close to theaters and cinemas, plus the best museums in the country, such as the Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza or the Reina Sofia, which have interesting exhibitions. Madrid is among the 10 European cities with the best cultural infrastructures in Europe.
host_about:
Hola amigos!!
Somo Silvia y Hugo. 
Vivimos en Madrid desde hace varios años. Ésta es una ciudad que te atrapa desde el primer día. Estaremos encantados de aconsejarte sobre lugares que visitar y actividades que realizar por aquí, si te apetece.
Trabajamos en la Puerta del Sol, en pleno centro, desde donde observamos el latido constante y ajetreado del día a día de una gran capital.
Somos  persona amables, divertidas y extrovertidas. Nos encanta conocer gente nueva, aprender de las diferentes culturas y enriquecer nuestras vida con nuevas experiencias. Nos gusta mucho viajar y disfrutar de los días en familia y con amigos.
Nuestros trabajos están muy relacionado con el turismo, por lo que intentamos ser  buenos  anfitriones y atender personalmente a las necesidades de nuestros huéspedes.
Os esperamos. ;)
Un abrazo!!

name: Chulísima habitación en el centro!
description: Hello! My name is Javier and I have a beautiful room prepared for you to have a super pleasant stay in the center of Madrid. My idea is that you feel at home!
neighborhood_overview:
Chamberí is a wonderful neighborhood full of life - it has shops, cafes, bars, bars, restaurants, restaurants, cinemas, supermarkets... The location can't be better! There are always people on the street and you have absolutely everything. It's next to Malasaña, and you can walk almost anywhere.

The people in the neighborhood are very nice, you will love it!
host_about:
Hey! Tengo 36 años y soy diseñador gráfico freelance; desde hace 8 años trabajo desde casa, cosa que me encanta!

Soy una persona muy independiente, me encanta ir a mi aire y pasar mucho tiempo conmigo mismo. Esto no quiere decir que no sea sociable: me considero una persona simpática y agradable.

Me gusta la vida en la cuidad, y el ocio urbano. Intento disfrutar de los pequeños placeres de la vida, como tomar un café en un bar o visitar un museo vacío entre semana... Soy muy austero!

Me pirra el cine; tooooooodos los días veo una película o dos, es lo que más me gusta hacer en la vida... Me encantan Lars Von Trier, Cronenberg, Brian de Palma, el cine policíaco italiano de los 70, el cine clásico... Súper fan del cine de culto, vamos!

Plan perfecto: día lluvioso viendo pelis y comiendo pizza! WOOOOOW!

Bueno, o ver dos pelis seguidas en el cine: eso ya es el planazo del siglo!!!

Me gusta el orden y la tranquilidad, los planes cortos y tranquilos, y ver a mis amigos de vez en cuando. Me siento muy afortunado de haber conseguido una "familia urbana" en Madrid y tener amigos que me echan una mano cada vez que lo necesito.

host_about:
I'm Italian, living in Madrid for 15 years already. I love this city, and I'm always glad to "share it" with people who is willing to know it, in all its aspects!
I love travelling, getting to know new people and different cultures, I've always thought that getting to know a place with local people it's the best way to do it.
I have also many interests like music, movies, reading, playing piano, basketball, swing dancing.. and many others!

name: Estudio abuhardillado en Chamberí
description: Small but cozy studio in an excellent location. You will be in the center of Madrid but without traffic noise and light.
neighborhood_overview:
The historic neighborhood of Trafalgar in Chamberí in one of the most lively in the city. The terraces of Plaza de Olavide are behind the apartment and around it has well-known restaurants and bars with music.
You have Calle Fuencarral with its cinemas and shopping area, or if you prefer to walk 5 minutes to the well-known Malasaña neighborhood you will be at the top of the leisure offerings.
This neighborhood blends families and university students that bring life and excitement at all hours, although the small Garcilaso street is very quiet.
2 minutes away you have a well-stocked supermarket, a artisan bread bakery at C/ Luchana, wine and spirits store in Olavide Square, a Jamón shop and deli at the end of the street, you'll be all missing.
host_about:
Después de muchos años viviendo en Madrid, ciudad donde estudié y a la que regresé después de muchas vueltas por España, me fui un par de años a trabajar a México y ya no he parado de moverme.
Ahora estoy en Filipinas, en una pequeña isla con dos proyectos que quería intentar cumplir.
Soy miembro de kilaha.org y hemos empezado a hacer proyectos de desarrollo y por otro lado empiezo una nueva aventura dentro del turismo responsable.
Me encanta viajar pero entendiendo porqué somos tan diferentes y tan iguales en todas las culturas, así que ahora estoy en Asia...
Soy una reputada hacedora de tortillas de patata y comer rico con amigos y  reirte todo lo que puedas en la vida me parecen un "must"

name: Your Madrid Home
description: Situated in the best residential area of Madrid, Chamberí, this confortable and cozy flat is also near the most interesting places of Madrid (such as museums, theatres, shops, etc): live like a real "madrileño" during your stay in our city!
neighborhood_overview:
Chamberí is one of the best residential areas in Madrid. The flat is near the most interesting places to visit in the city (such as Museums, Theatres, etc.), but in a confortable and truly Spanish area of Madrid.

Residential area, but not boring: you will find many very enchanting terraces, tapas bar and restaurants (from most trendy to very traditional!) very near.

And within a 20 mns walk you will arrive to the biggest shopping mall in Europe: the Corte Inglés de Castellana, or even nearer (10 mns) to calle Fuencarral where you will find all the best shops in Madrid (from Zara to Adolfo Dominguez, Michael Kors, etc.).
host_about:
Francesa, de madre italiana, vivo desde hace más de 15 años en Madrid. 
Casada con un español, tengo dos niños pequeños.

He vivido en Francia, Italia y Estados Unidos; me encanta viajar... y la internacionalidad que permite AirBNB!

name: Luminoso y acojedor Piso en Madrid
description: The apartment is next to Piramides and Puerta de Toledo, an area surrounded by parks (Madrid-Rio, Parque del Sur, Casa de Campo and Parque de San Isidro). Ideal area for sports and leisure in general.
neighborhood_overview:
Very well connected area with 4 bus lines less than 50 meters from the portal. Metro (also less than 50 meters from the portal) although it is perfectly possible to move walking to the center (about 20-25 min) and thus get to know the most emblematic areas of Madrid Castillo.
all services on the same street: Super markets, fruit trees, banks, pharmacies and the covered market of San Isidro that is worth a visit for its history and age in the neighborhood. host_about:
A brazilian girl that live and work at Madrid since 2006. I like so much to travel and airbnb is a very good option to travel and feel their self like a home.

name: Palace Style -Barrio de Salamanca
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in front of the fabulous Palacio de Aguas de Sevilla, with numerous cafes, restaurants, businesses and shops in the surrounding area.

Barrio de Salamanca, is one of the most coveted and elegant areas of central Madrid. Considered an area designed in the past to the nobility. In the Golden Mile. Located near streets of great importance such as Serrano, and located actually in Ortega y Gasset where top international luxury firms are based. Safety, good communication of its streets with the rest of the city and services offered in the area, make it one of the best places to spend a great stay in the Spanish capital.

In the Barrio de Salamanca the best and most glamorous firms are concentrated. It is one of the districts with higher living standards at European level and has the best luxury hopping in Madrid. Boutiques like Gucci, Channel, Carolina Herrera or some of the most prestigious jewelers and art galleries are found in the area.
host_about:
Hola soy Javier!

Me considero amable, simpático y extrovertido. Soy una persona curiosa y es lo que me ha llevado a emprender en distintos proyectos a lo largo de mi vida.

Me encanta viajar y todo tipo de viajes, de ocio y descanso, de turismo, de aventura, a grandes ciudades, pequeños pueblos o lugares salvajes, con familia, amigos o incluso sólo. Disfruto mucho conociendo gente y aprendiendo de sus culturas, es una gran experiencia.

He utilizado Airbnb para viajar en numerosas ocasiones y ahora me he decidido a ser anfitrión. Me gusta ofrecer un buen servicio, que la gente quede encantada de la experiencia y que disfruten en la vivienda, del barrio y de la ciudad en la que llevo viviendo casi toda mi vida y de la que estaré encantado de compartir sus mejores secretos.

name: Habitaciòn en piso en Madrid centro
description: Apartment room located in Atocha Street, very close to Retiro Park and all the important museums such as El Prado and Reina Sofìa . Its windows overlook a very quiet street. It's very well equipped and has very high ceilings.
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of letters. Fuè en èsta calle de Atocha dònde se imprimiò el Quijote por primera vez. Mìsmo Cervantes lived in this neighborhood as well as Lope de Vega. Today, it's a neighborhood full of culinary and cultural activity. In its streets is the Café Central, which is recognized as the most prestigious live Jazz place in Madrid. Cruzando la calle Atocha estàn el museo Reina Sofìa y el Real Conservatorio Superior de Mùsica. Very close to home is the Caixa Forum in which several exhibitions are also presented. 5 mins. on foot is the Prado museum as well as the Parque del Buen Retiro, which is the màs bonito he important park in Madrid. This is a very central neighborhood that includes all the important neighborhoods of Madrid such as the Sol y Preciados shopping area, Plaza Mayor, El Teatro Real de Ópera, El Palacio Real, also the multicultural neighborhood of Lavapiès. In short, it is located in a location of Madrid's most privileged.
host_about: Hola què tal? Me llamo Ivàn. Nacido en Madrid y aunque parte de mi familia es rusa y la mayorìa española tambièn tengo que decir que crecì en Repùblica Dominicana en el Mar Caribe. Por eso me gusta tanto el sol y bailar supongo. Soy Mùsico y enamorado de la mùsica (buf desde Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin pasando por Billie Holiday, Duke Ellingthon tambièn por Beethoven, Gustav Mahler, John Cage, Ligeti, hasta Camaròn de la Isla, Paco de Lucìa, Vinicius de Moraes, Caetano Veloso, Cachao, Ruben Blades, Wilfrido Vargas, Bebo Valdès...); Tambièn del arte y de la poesìa. Mi chica de hecho es artista asì que èsta es una casa màs bien de letras (aunque la ciencia tambièn me encanta). Yo toco el piano, el cajòn flamenco y canto. Adoro viajar y conocer gente. Ya me he encontrado gracias a Airbnb con personas muy especiales. Un saludo a quièn lo lea y quièn sabe si nos conocemos algùn dìa!!!

neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is located opposite the amazing Plaza Mayor and walking distance to most major attractions of Madrid.

Plaza Mayor
Plaza Mayor is Madrid’s main square and the geographic centre of the city. It’s a great place to start exploring and provides a fascinating insight into Madrid’s history.

Begin the walking tour on Plaza Mayor (closest metro is Sol). The Plaza Mayor was the brainchild of King Philip II in 1560, who wanted to transform what was the bustling Plaza de Arrabal into a more streamlined, ordered square. Construction did not start for another 57 years, however, when the architect Juan Gómez de Mora undertook the project in 1617. After a devastating fire, the Plaza Mayor was almost completely rebuilt by Juan de Villanueva in 1790.

What to look out for
Benches

name: Downtown Sunny & Cozy Apartment Gran Via | A022
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home.
We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

Our apartment is located in a modern building with all the comforts, it is located in a residential area of ​​the Pacifico neighborhood.

The apartments have an individual alarm available to the guest and the video surveillance building at its entrances.

Consumption and internet are included in the price.
neighborhood_overview:
The Pacific neighborhood occupies the entire southern facade of the Retiro district. being the area with the highest population density and young population in the entire district. Currently it is divided into two administrative areas: the eastern area, called Adelfas, and the western area, which has preserved the historic name of the neighborhood. It is a middle-class neighborhood with typical architecture and network of streets in the Ensanche de Madrid.

Administratively it limits with the neighborhoods of Jerónimos (35) to the northwest, Niño Jesús (36) to the north, Estrella (33) to the northeast, Adelfas (32) to the east.

It is bounded by the Paseo de la Infanta Isabel, the Paseo de la Reina Cristina, the Plaza de Mariano de Cavia, the Avenida del Mediterráneo, the Plaza del Conde de Casal, the Calle del Doctor Esquerdo, the Calle de Pedro Bosch and the of the train that converge at Atocha Station. name: Duplex Rustic Style in Commercial Zone
description:
Duplex "Nuevos Ministerios".
50m2 with two floors, and small outdoor balcony.
Fully equipped and furnished.
It has everything necessary to make your stay a pleasant one.
1st floor no elevator.
neighborhood_overview:
Description of the Zone : Nuevos Ministerios

The Nuevos Ministerios Area is located between the districts of Chamberí and Tetuan. The zone combine tradicional constructions tipical of XIX Century with modern and sofisticated architecture. Between Paseo de la Castellana main Avenue of the City, and Calle Orense, -in the complex of Azca-, that was designed in the years 70, with the intention to create a modern financial and business center for the epoch. Located in the centre of Nuevos Ministerios are some symbolic skyscrapers of Madrid: the Tower Picasso and the Tower Europe. In the zone there are bars oriented towards executives, with a lot of Clubs, Pubs and Dicoteques to choice for nightlife. This is a zone of great financial activity, and is the choice location for the offices of multinational corporations and the most important financial institions both Spanish and Foreign. Here you will find Ministeries Offices and also numerous embassies. Also in the zone there
host_about:
Llevo 14 años viviendo en la encantadora ciudad de Madrid.
Me gusta ayudar y procuraré que tu estancia sea agradable y que los apartamentos te sean cómodos...

Cualquier recomendación de la ciudad, guía turística, te las proporcionaré. Siéntete en la libertad de consultar...

Soy Agente Inmobiliario y como profesional gestiono apartamentos en alquiler de larga estancia (anualidades), si estás buscando por anualidad pregúntame por si puedo ayudarte.

ENGLISH VERSION:
I've been living in the charming city of Madrid for 14 years.
I like to help and I will make sure that your stay is pleasant and that the apartments are comfortable ...

Any recommendation from the city, tourist guide, I will provide them. Feel free to consult ...

I am a Real Estate Agent of RE/MAX, as a professional I manage apartments for rent, long term (for years) you can ask for other options ...

name: Downtown Comfortable Apartment Gran Vía | A025
description:
The apartment is located in a privileged location just a few minutes from Gran Vía, in the heart of Madrid, just a step away from cinemas, theaters, shops, restaurants and all the tourist attractions of the city.

Apartamentos Day Madrid take care of every detail in all our accommodations to make you feel at home.
We look forward to welcoming you!.
neighborhood_overview:
The area between Puerta del Sol and Gran Vía and its surroundings is undoubtly the axis around which Madrid's tourist, cultural and recreational life develops. This area is the starting point of any tourist route through the city, and in its absence, is a must for any visitor who wants to feel the heartbeat of Madrid. The new Gran Vía is free of cars and pollution and is more pedestrian friendly.
Sol-Gran Vía is one of the main commercial areas of Madrid. Shopping in its streets and window shopping is an experience that no visitor should miss. A day of shopping here is like strolling through a large open-air shopping mall.
host_about:
Apartamentos Day Madrid es una empresa dedicada a la gestión de alojamientos turísticos en el centro de Madrid. Contamos con un equipo de trabajo diverso y multicultural que son parte fundamental del excelente servicio que brindamos cada día, aportando al turismo de la ciudad la oportunidad de alojarse en nuestros magníficos apartamentos.
Disfruta de la gastronomía, la cultura y de todas las actividades que están a tu alcance alojándote en uno de nuestros céntricos apartamentos en el corazón de la ciudad junto a la Gran Via, Sol y Malasaña.

neighborhood_overview: Without a doubt, the best of Esencial Apartments Madrid is its location. Very close to Puerta del Sol, the center of the city. You can visit the main tourist attractions by taking a walk.
host_about:
Hola!

Mi nombre es Rizwan, aunque todos me llaman Shah. ;)
Llevo 10 años viviendo en Madrid y os recomiendo venir a conocer esta increíble ciudad y disfrutar de todo el encanto que ofrece.
Estaré encantado de ayudaros en todo lo que necesitéis para que vuestra estancia sea lo más agradable y enriquecedora posible.
Además desde octubre de 2016 dispongo de un increíble restaurante indio en el Barrio de Salamanca de Madrid. A todos mis huéspedes, les haré un 20% de descuento en cuenta allí. 
Os invito a disfrutar de esta maravillosa ciudad y degustar la mejor cocina india tradicional.
MIRCHI INDIAN CUISINE, en C/ Alcántara, 35

neighborhood_overview:
The flat is in a lively area with many terraces and restaurants. there are two parks around: MADRID RIO and PLANETARIO park. MATADERO, one of the biggest Exhibition and Cultural Center where many activities are celebrated every day ((URL HIDDEN) is two minutes walking from the apartment. El centro cultural y de exhibiciones MATADERO ((URL HIDDEN) que cuenta con numerosas actividades diarias está a dos minutos caminando. Los museo Reina Sofia, Prado y Thyssen se encuentran a cinco minutos en autobús o 15 andando.

Hello,

name: Habitaciòn en centro de Madrid
description: Apartment room located in the heart of Atocha Street, very close to the Retiro Park and all the important museums such as El Prado and Reina Sofìa . Its windows overlook a very quiet street. It's very well equipped and has very high ceilings.
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of letters. Fuè en èsta calle de Atocha dònde se imprimiò el Quijote por primera vez. Mìsmo Cervantes lived in this neighborhood as well as Lope de Vega. Today, it's a neighborhood full of culinary and cultural activity. In its streets is the Café Central, which is recognized as the most prestigious live Jazz place in Madrid. Cruzando la calle Atocha estàn el museo Reina Sofìa y el Real Conservatorio Superior de Mùsica. Very close to home is the Caixa Forum in which several exhibitions are also presented. 5 mins. on foot is the Prado museum as well as the Parque del Buen Retiro, which is the màs bonito he important park in Madrid. This is a very central neighborhood that includes all the important neighborhoods of Madrid such as the Sol y Preciados shopping area, Plaza Mayor, El Teatro Real de Ópera, El Palacio Real, also the multicultural neighborhood of Lavapiès. In short, it is located in a location of Madrid's most privileged.
host_about: Hola què tal? Me llamo Ivàn. Nacido en Madrid y aunque parte de mi familia es rusa y la mayorìa española tambièn tengo que decir que crecì en Repùblica Dominicana en el Mar Caribe. Por eso me gusta tanto el sol y bailar supongo. Soy Mùsico y enamorado de la mùsica (buf desde Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin pasando por Billie Holiday, Duke Ellingthon tambièn por Beethoven, Gustav Mahler, John Cage, Ligeti, hasta Camaròn de la Isla, Paco de Lucìa, Vinicius de Moraes, Caetano Veloso, Cachao, Ruben Blades, Wilfrido Vargas, Bebo Valdès...); Tambièn del arte y de la poesìa. Mi chica de hecho es artista asì que èsta es una casa màs bien de letras (aunque la ciencia tambièn me encanta). Yo toco el piano, el cajòn flamenco y canto. Adoro viajar y conocer gente. Ya me he encontrado gracias a Airbnb con personas muy especiales. Un saludo a quièn lo lea y quièn sabe si nos conocemos algùn dìa!!!

description: Welcome! From the morning, the light will directly illuminate each of the rooms of this bright 5th floor with elevator and doorman, inviting you to discover the heart of one of the most emblematic and historic neighborhoods of Madrid, Los Austrias.
neighborhood_overview:
Los Austrias is one of Madrid's most emblematic and representative neighborhoods. It is located in the historic heart of Madrid. Its streets are home to iconic places such as the Royal Palace, Plaza de Oriente, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, Gran Vía, Plaza de España, Temple of Debod, Teatro Real, etc. You can discover and enjoy all these sites by walking through its pedestrian and restricted traffic streets.
The building is located in the beautiful Plaza del Biombo, a quiet pedestrian square with fountains, several restaurants, terraces and an art gallery. In the San Miguel Market, 2 minutes from the house, you can enjoy some of the best tapas and wines in Madrid and also several famous flamenco venues such as the “Corral de la Morería” where guitarists such as Paco de Lucía or Camarón de la Isla were regulars.

name: Colourful single bedroom for female
description: Take a look at this superb apartment situated in the Ibiza neighbourhood, right next to the beautiful Parque de El Retiro! If you're coming to Madrid to stay for a few months, then you could hardly ask for a better location than this.
neighborhood_overview:
Retiro is one of Madrid's poshest neighbourhoods. Far more relaxed than neighbouring Salamanca, Retiro is named after the massive park lying within its boundaries - the Parque del Buen Retiro.

The Parque del Buen Retiro is Madrid’s lungs. It is ideal for a relaxing day around nature or for practicing several sports: from cycling, skating and jogging, to tennis, paddle and football. You can have a picnic on the grass under the shade of ancient trees, you can rent a boat on the pond or see the different street artists who have puppet shows or are playing music. Inside the El Retiro Park you’ll find the most modern and bright library of the area - the Biblioteca Eugenio Trías.

Next to El Retiro, lies the Prado museum. The Prado is the most important museum in Spain and one of the most important art museums in the world. Here, you’ll find works from most of the major painters since the Renaissance, including the Spanish geniuses El Greco, Velazquez, Goya and Picasso.

host_about: Somos un grupo de autónomos con auténtica vocación por s cosas bien hechas y llevamos 10 años dedicados a la gestión patrimonial íntegra de edificios y complejos hoteleros. Puerta del Sol, Museums,  Cathedrals, Churches, El Palacio Real, Las Cortes, El Congress of Deputies, Plaza España, Teatro Circo Price and many more places to visit. In the neighborhood you can enjoy with the terraces of Calle Argumosa, any of the many Indian restaurants on Calle Lavapiés and more Argentine, Brazilian, Italian, Peruvian and Moroccan restaurants and as you will see many more from different cultures and nationalities. See some of the plays of the Centro Dramático Nacional. De Tirso de Molina with its flower stalls and terraces and theatres. From the markets that offer its culinary attraction news, the  stunning San Miguel market. See any of the Tabacalera exhibitions or Casa Encendida and much more that Madrid has to offer, which here is impossible to describe and name.

A wonderful and very big attic flat with a beautiful and romantic terrace situated right on the trendy and "hip" quarter of Malasaña, one of Madrid’s liveliest neighbourhoods, right in the heart of Madrid.
neighborhood_overview:
TIPS ABOUT MALASAÑA ( your neighbourghood)
Malasaña or Barrio de las Maravillas ( Neighbourhood of Wonders) is now your home. The best way to get to know it is by wandering through its streets and alleyways, spreading from its main artery, calle Fuencarral, where all the best-known brands are centred. If you’re looking for something a bit different or unique, there are independent design and vintage fashion shops in the calles Espiritu Santo and Conde Duque. Two of the most original are in Plaza del 2 de Mayo - the epicentre of the barrio, full of roof terraces – namely Sin clon ni son and Taller de FEEAS, next to the Conde Duque cultural centre. This area also has two unmissable stops for foodies: a bakery called Panic, which sells the best bread in the city, and La Queseria de Conde Duque, a fascinating cheese shop where producers of artisan cheeses sell directly to the public. To regain your strength and enjoy a good coffee and a piece of homemade cake, the places to be are To
host_about:
After visiting 35 countries and living in three of them, I know what travelling is alike and what may make it a bit nicer and easier. I want to provide you a cosy place for your business or leisure trip, give you hints about all the nice things in the surroundings and even there is a chance I get you around if you dont know or come from abroad. 
Soy un madrileño amante de mi ciudad. Me gusta su belleza imperfecta, las calles, las terrazas, el sol y su gente. 
Comparto esta pasión con la decoración y la arquitectura. 
Viajero incansable, he vivido varios años en diferentes países. Disfruto mucho conociendo gente nueva y diferentes culturas, ademas me gusta viajar para echar de menos mi ciudad, cargarme de ideas e inspiración para luego plasmarlo en los ambientes que decoro.

Design apartment in the very center of Madrid (Kilómetro Cero) with all the necessities and whatever you may need in its immediate vicinity: bars and restaurants, shops, public transport, as well as the main attractions and museums.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood, El barrio de Huertas, also known as Las Letras, is one of the oldest and most authentic neighbourhoods of Madrid, filled with antique dealers, and countless shops selling vintage furniture, clothes, and jewellery.
This is the place to taste Madrid’s finest cuisine and enjoy its proverbial nightlife. Plaza Santa Ana is one of the hotspots with numerous bars and restaurants, as well as a theatre. A cinema theatre showing films in original version (undubbed) is a short walk away (Cines Ideal).
Interested in arts? The world-renowned Museo Reina Sofia and Museo del Prado, The CaixaForum Museum and many other art galleries are within walking distance from the apartment.
The Puerta del Sol, marking the very centre of Spain’s capital, is only a one-minute walk away from the apartment, as are the picturesque Plaza Mayor and the lively Mercado de San Miguel (the place to go for tapas).

name: Nice and cozy apt in Malasaña.
description:
A very well located apt, right by Chueca, Malasaña and Chamberí. Close to all kind of restaurants, stores and tourist places, and perfectly equipped with all you will need (I actually live here, so you wont miss anything).
Breakfast is included.
neighborhood_overview:
The best thing is that you can choose from several neighborhoods:
1. Chueca, known as the gay town, where you can find all kind of stores, bars, discos and restaurants. Feeling the liberal spirit.
2. Malasaña, the hipster town, full of art and expositions.
3. Chamberí, the most madrilian town. You can find either the elder people, or the young college students. And lots of pubs and discos.

Right in front of the house you can find two big markets:
1. Mercado de Barceló, where you can find all the fresh food you could need.
2. San Ildefonso, where lots of bars and restaurants are hold together in a nice and new modern building.

name: A room surrounded by art & culture
description: It is in one of the best areas of Madrid, full of parks and gardens, the Prado, Thyssen, La Caixa and Reina Sofia museums. It's the city's cultural center. The diverse atmosphere of restaurants, bars, and all kinds of places to eat and drink, cafes with live jazz or flamenco. The theaters of La Zarzuela, Comedia, Español, Apolo and Monumental for classical music.
neighborhood_overview:
Cortes-Letras Neighborhood, Centro District, 28014 Madrid
There are restaurants specializing in meat and fish, vegetarians, all kinds of bars with our tapas and national dishes. On Calle Huertas and Plaza de S.Ana, there are live music venues, jazz type. Walks in El Retiro Park or the Botanical Garden are my favorites along with the small garden of Lope de Vega's house on Cervantes Street. I regularly visit the El Prado, Thyssen, La Caixa Forum, and Reina Sofia museums. It's amazing to have classical and contemporary art so close. Theaters are around the neighborhood with all kinds of programs
host_about:
I like travelling and hosting travellers, to share the wonders of my city: its art, music, culture and diversity. Surrounded by a 17th century Monastery and the most important museums in Europe, in my place you can have a peaceful room where to think, rest and dream.
